But if you cancel within 5 days of departure you will have topay 50% of your total booking.我知道了。不用担心，我们可以先帮您做一个临时预订。这样您的位置就可以保留了。您需要在预订的时候预交20%的定金。但是如果您 在出发前 5 天之内取消预订的话，您就得支付总额的50%。
M6没有问题。就这么做吧。That is not a problem. Let’s do it.

entry.title: 度假咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Hu (H), a Chinese tourist, and thereceptionist (R) at a travel agency. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon, thanks for choosing Dreamworld Travel. You must beMr. Hu. What can I do for you?下午好，感谢您选择梦想世界旅行社。您一定是胡先生吧？能为您做些什么呢?
M1噢，你好。对于你们提供的这附近的沿海度假项目，我很感兴趣。特别是，我喜欢跟鲸鱼有关的一些假日套餐。Oh hello. I am very interested in the holidays you offer along thecoast near here. I especially like the holiday packages which havesomething to do with whales …) 
E2Which package are you looking for in particular? Is it ‘Whalewatching’? I have to tell you that our whale watching experience is themost popular and it’s based in a lovely little town with nicebeaches.具体您想要的是哪一个套餐？是观鲸旅游么？我必须告诉您，我们的观鲸体验是非常受欢迎的项目，而且主要地点是在一个美丽的小岛，有漂亮的海滩。
M2是的，我想要找的就是这个。不过现在是观鲸的季节吗？能保证我在旅行中一定能看到鲸鱼吗？Yes, that is exactly what I’m after. But is it the right season forwhale watching? Is it guaranteed that we will be able to see some whalesand dolphins during the trip? 
E3Yes. From June to July is the best season for whale watching. Wewill take you to the right spot where whales will definitely show up. Soyou can see and hear whales up close. But it really depends on theweather and you do need a bit of good luck to see many dolphins on thesame trip, as dolphins are smarter and more sensitive.是的。6 月到 7月正是观鲸的最好季节。我们会带你去鲸鱼一定会出现的某个地方。但是要在同一次游览中也看到很多海豚，就要看天气和你的运气了，因为你海豚更聪明、更敏感。
M3这听起来太棒了。我都等不及要近距离的看看鲸鱼甚至听听他们发出的声音了。我还想带我女朋友一起去。但是她有晕动症，她能参加这种海上巡游么？That sounds great! I can’t wait to see and hear whales up close. Iwant to bring my girlfriend with me as well. But she has serious motionsickness, would she be fine to go on a whale watching excursion? 
E4Normally we suggest passengers take Dramamine, the non-drowsy typeif they get seasick. It would also help a lot if you stay up on deck andwith your eyes fixed on the horizon. 34
M4我听说这种药至少要在上船前半小时服用。如果整个出海只有两个小时的话，我想她应该没有问题。套餐里还包括其他的项目么？I’ve heard this medication must be taken at least a half-hour beforetravel. If the whole trip is only two hours, I think that won’t be aproblem for her. Is there anything else available for us in thepackage? 
E5Oh, there are lots of things. If you don’t want to do the whalewatching cruise, your guide will take anyone who is interested either ona bushwalk through the national park near the hotel or on fishing anddiving trips. And there’s also a reptile park in town. 噢，还有很多可以做的事情。如果你不想坐船去看鲸鱼，酒店附近有个国家公园，导游会把对丛林徒步有兴趣的人带那去，或者带去参加钓鱼和潜水。在镇上还有一个爬行动物公园。
M5这简直太完美了！我女朋友非常喜欢潜水的。你们基本的费用是多少？对了，如果是去徒步或者潜水，要另外加钱么？How perfect it that? My girlfriend is a big fan of diving. How muchis the basic tour? By the way, is there any extra charges for goingbushwalking or diving?
E6At this time of year, it's usually around $300 but let me check, um… it's actually $280. And there’s no extra charge for bushwalking, butyou will have to pay $12 extra for the fishing and diving trip.每年的这个时候，一般都在 300 元左右。但是让我查查，嗯，其实是 280元。徒步的话没有额外的费用，但是钓鱼和潜水就需要再加付 12 元。
M6听起来不错。那么，你们经常有这个项目的团吗？下一个团是什么时候？That sounds good. So do you run these tours regularly? And when isthe next one going?

entry.title: 办图书卡
entry.content:
This is a telephone conversation between Mrs Jin (J), a new migrantand a librarian (L). * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, South-cross College Library. How can I help you?早上好，南十字大学图书馆。有什么能帮您?
M1我想问一下我能否成为图书馆会员。我不是这个大学的学生，但我听说即使我不是学生，也是可以作为外部会员加入的。I am wondering if I can become a member of your library. I’m not astudent of your college, but someone told me I don’t have to be astudent to join as an external member. 
E2That’s right, although we do have a few other requirements, such as,you must be at least 18 years of age and you have to be holding a validAustralian visa other than a visitor’s visa or a bridging visa.是这样的。但我们也还有其他的一些要求，比如必须年满 18 周岁，你必须持有一个有效的澳大利亚签证，并且不能是旅游签证或过桥 签证。
M2是的，这些条件我都满足。能否告诉我，申请加入你们的会员的程序是什么呢？比如，我要提交哪些材料呢？Yes, I meet all the requirements. Could you tell me what I need todo to get membership? For example, what kinds of documents should Iprovide?
E3Well, you’ll need to come into the library and fill out some forms.You’ll also need to bring two passport photos with you. We also need twoidentification documents with your address on it, so a driver’s licenceand a passport would be fine.这样，你需要到图书馆来，填写一些表格。你还需要带来两张护照规格的照片。我们还需要你的两份身份证明文件，上面要带有你的住址。所以，驾照和和护照就可以的。
M3我才刚收到我的澳大利亚驾驶执照，时间赶得刚好。可是我的中国护照上只表明了我中国的住址，而不是在澳大利亚的，那怎么办？出示信用卡行么？I’ve just received my Australian driver’s licence. That’s reallygood timing！But my Chinese passport only shows my residential addressin China instead of in Australia. So what else can I do? Can I use acredit card?
E4No, it needs to have your address on it. I believe a bank statementwill do. Or if you don’t have a bank statement but you have a Medicarecard, you can also provide an official letter from Medicare, which hasyour name and address on the left top.不行，上面必须显示你的住址才可以。我想银行的结算单就可以。或者，如果你没有银行结算单但是你有Medicare 卡，你也可以提供 Medi-bank给你邮寄的正式信函，左上角印有你的姓名和地址。
M4好的，听起来不难。我是配偶移民过来的，目前还没有找到工作。要成为会员需要交什么费用么？有年费么？Good, that doesn’t sound difficult. I migrated here via the spousalsponsorship scheme and I haven’t found a job yet. Does it cost anythingto become a member? Is there an annual fee? 
E5Well, it’s free for students here but otherwise it’s $125 per annumor $25 per quarter if you’ve got a current student card from anothercollege.嗯，对于本校学生来说，是免费的。否则我们的收费是每年 125澳元，或者，如果你现在持有其他大学的学生证，费用是每季度 25 澳 元。
M5呃，这可比我原想的要贵得多。但是，我刚刚注册了一个成人移民英语计划(AMEP)课程。这样说起来，我也还算是学生。我能用这个来申请优惠吗？um, it’s more expensive than I thought. However, I am currentlyenrolled in the Adult Migrant English Program (AMEP). So I am still astudent in this case. May I use this to apply for a concession?
E6No, I am afraid you can’t do that. You have to be a current studentof another TAFE, college or university. Otherwise, the concession policydoesn't apply to you.不，我恐怕你不能这么做。你必须是其他某所 TAFE 院校，学院或大学的在校学生。否则，优惠的政策是不适用的。
M6我明白了。那我也没有办法，就只好付 125了。我想了解的就这么多。这个星期我会再来，办理加入会员的手续。谢谢，再见。I see. So I guess I don’t have any choice but to pay the $125.That’s about everything I need to know. I’ll be along later this week tojoin. Thanks. Bye.

entry.title: 尿道发炎
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr Kong (K) and Dr Hugh, a urologist (D).* * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1 Good morning, Mr Kong. I understand your daughter is studying atthe university here and she was a doctor in China, but today I’ve askedan interpreter to come to help us. This is because I want to beabsolutely sure that we can fully understand each other.早上好，孔先生。我知道你的女儿在中国的时候是个医生，现在又在这边上大学，但今天我还是请了一名口译员来帮助我们。因为我想完全确定，我们可以完全的明白对方所说的话。
M1 我不觉得有必要请来口译员。不过既然她已经在这儿了，我也不介意使用这项服务。I don’t see the need for an interpreter. But as long as she isalready here, I don’t mind using this service. 
E2 Ok, thank you. Please take a seat, Mr Kong. Now tell me what theproblem is.好，谢谢。孔先生，请坐。现在跟我说说，你怎么了?
M2 我的问题是，每次排尿的时候，我都觉得疼。我以为可能是尿道炎，因为我妻子从两周之前也出现了同样的症状。可是这疼痛感变得更严重了。 My problem is that every time I pass urine, it hurts. I thought itcould be urethritis, since my wife has had the same symptoms since 2weeks ago. But the pain is becoming more serious now.
E3 Do you have or have you ever had any venereal diseases? I mean nooffence, but are you in an exclusive sexual relationship?你现在有没有，或者曾有得过任何性病吗? 我无意冒犯，但是你是有固定的性伴侣吗?
M3 是的，是的，当然。你说什么呢？虽然我知道你们很开放，但我被问到这种问题时，还是难免觉得尴尬。。。我非常忠于我的妻子，从没有做过什么越轨的行为。我从没得过任何性病。Yes, of course. What are you talking about? I know people here arevery open-minded about talking about sex, but I still feel embarrassedwhen being asked these questions. I am very faithful to my wife, and Ihave never cheated on her. And I’ve never had any V.D. 
E4 I see. Your GP’s referral letter shows that you had a hernia aroundtwo years ago. Then you had surgery and it was repaired. Therefore,there is a possibility that the hernia has come back. Or, it could besomething wrong with your prostate.我知道了。您全科医生的转介信上说，您大约两年得过疝气，后来通过手术，痊愈了。所以，现在有可能是疝气又回来了。或者，也可能是您的前列腺出了问题。
M4 那我会需要再动一次手术吗？我可是才做了手术，不想再做了。另外，你为什么怀疑是前列腺的问题？In that case, do I need another surgery? I just had an operationdone, and really I don’t want another one. In addition, why do you thinkthere is a problem with my prostate?
E5 It is not very serious so at the moment it doesn’t require anysurgical treatment. Your prostate is enlarged, so I am thinking thiscould be another cause of your problem. Do you have a burning sensationwhen you pass urine? 这次并不是很严重，所以目前你不需要任何的手术治疗。你的前列腺有肿大，所以我在想这可能是另一个诱因。你排尿的时候，有灼烧感吗？
M5 一开始没有，过了几天就有了。再后来，这种灼烧感就越来越严重。我实在受不了了，所以才来见您的。Not at the very beginning, but I started to feel burning pain somedays after, and then it became worse and worse until I couldn’t bear itanymore, so I came to see you. 
E6 I will now write a note for you to have an ultrasound check foryour prostate. I also want to run a blood test which includes threestages. You must fast for the first stage.我现在给你写个记录，你要去做一个前列腺的超声波检查，我还想让你去做个血检。这个血检包括三个阶段，第一阶段你要空腹去。
M6 这么多检查？你可吓到我了，医生。So many examinations and tests? You have scared me, doctor.

entry.title: 学渣儿子
entry.content:
A teacher wants to talk to the parent of a primary school studentregarding the difficulties the student seems to be having in keeping upwith the class. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Thank you for coming to see me today. I wanted to talk to youbecause Christopher seems to be having some learning difficulties.23
M1谢谢您为了儿子的事儿打电话让我过来。他在家不怎么跟我们说学校的事。他上课表现怎么样啊？Thank you for calling me to talk about my son. He doesn’t tell usmuch about what happens at school. How is he in class?
E2Oh, there is no problem with his behaviour at school. However, we'venoticed that his speaking and reading skills are below what we wouldexpect for someone of his age.30
M2您是说他不具备成为一个好学生的能力吗？我们来澳大利亚之前，他可是学业挺好的。现在，他看起来也很满意自己的老师和同学。Are you saying that he doesn't possess the qualities of a goodstudent? He was doing well at school before we came to Australia and nowhe also seems happy with his teacher and classmates. 
E3Well, he seems to struggle with reading aloud in particular. Thiscould hold him back later on, so we'd like to look into it now and givehim some assistance if he needs it.34
M3所以您有什么建议呢？上次家长会上，一位老师鼓励我们家长要通过一同参与的方式来帮助孩子提高写作能力。但偏巧我们家没有一个人能说好英文。What would you suggest? At the Parent-Teacher meeting last week, oneof the teachers encouraged parents to help children with their writingby getting involved, but unfortunately none of us have goodEnglish. 
E4Actually, I'd like to start by recommending that you have your son'shearing and vision checked, just to be sure he has no physical barriersto his learning.28
M4这个…我不觉得我儿子有任何的问题，但如果你怀疑的话，我一定会带他去看医生的。Well I don’t think there is anything wrong with him, but if yoususpect there may be something, I'll definitely take him to thedoctor. 
E5While the interpreter is here, I'll get our School Services Officerto help you make an appointment for a check-up at the local Child andFamily Health Centre.28
M5谢谢您这么关心他。但我很担心。我不知道他会不会是得上了某种严重的疾病，而我们还一无所知。Thank you for caring about him so much. But I feel so worried. Idon't know if he caught some serious illness without us knowing anythingabout it. 
E6It's probably nothing to worry about, but it'll be good tocheck.12
M6好的，我明白了。好的。I see. That's ok.

entry.title: 腿部钢钉
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Ms Zhong and Dr Freeman about treatment ofher bone fracture. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1 医生，你好。我的 X 光片报告是不是出来了?Hello doctor. Have you got my X-ray results?
M1 Yes, I have. Your X-ray shows that there is a serious fracture inyour left leg, which would have resulted from the bad fall you had onthe stairs. 30
E2 难怪我摔了之后左腿一阵剧痛，差点没疼得晕过去，还好当时我老公在家。医生，那现在我该怎么办？能痊愈吗？以后还能正常行走吗？我可不想瘸着走路啊！ No wonder I felt a sharp pain in my left leg after the fall. Ialmost fainted from the pain. Thank god that my husband was home at thattime. So what should I do now, doctor? Will I fully recover and be ableto walk normally again in the future? I don’t want to walk with alimp!
M2 Don’t worry too much. As your husband gave you proper first aidbefore the ambulance came, there is no serious damage to tissues aroundthe injury, which makes the treatment process a lot morestraightforward. As long as you strictly follow my instructions fortreatment, the complications will be minimal and your leg will fullyrecover. 56
E3听您这么说，我就放心一点了。虽然跟老板请了病假，但是只有 10天是带薪的，所以我想尽快回去上班。请您跟我说一下具体要进行哪些治疗，我让我老公记下来。I’m a little relieved to hear that. I have asked my boss for sickleave, but paid leave will be 10 days only. That’s why I want to go backto work as soon as possible. Please tell me exactly what treatment I’llhave to have. I’ll ask my husband to take some notes.
M3 For starters, I’ll need to immobilise the broken bone. Long bonesare difficult to keep aligned, so I’ll use both internal fixation and anexternal splint. 27
E4 我听不太懂啊。你是说要往我的腿里面放东西吗？那岂不是要开刀吗？我想只绑石膏就算了。I don’t quite understand. Are you saying that you will put thingsinto my leg? Does that mean there is going to be open surgery? I justwant to get a cast and a splint. 
M4 Internal fixation is the most effective way to ensure a fullrecovery. You will have a general anaesthetic during the procedure. Andyes, it requires open surgery, where a cut will be made and a screw willbe passed through the inside of your thighbone. It goes across the breakand holds your bone in the correct position. 58
E5 听起来有点吓人啊，难道钉子就一直留在我体内吗？还是以后要再开刀把它拿出来呢?It sounds quite frightening. So the screws will be left in my body?Or will I have open surgery again in the future to have them takenout?
M5 The screws may be left in the bone even after the healing iscomplete. But if there are any complications in the future, such asbacterial infection or arthritis, the screws may need to beremoved. 36
E6 老实说，这个手术听起来一点都不安全，光是那些并发症就听得我脊背发凉，会不会越弄越严重啊？我想我要再咨询一下别人，看是不是真的必要做这个内固定。To be honest, this operation doesn’t sound safe at all. Thecomplications alone are sending shivers down my spine. Could it makethings worse? I think I’d like to get a second opinion on whether aninternal fixation is really necessary. 
M6 No problem. But please be quick. It’s best to have the operationdone as soon as possible. 17

entry.title: 痴呆婆婆
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mrs. Guo (G), a mandarin speaker and aDoctor (D) in a health care service centre. Mrs. Guo’s mother in lawseems to have dementia. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
M1 医生，您好。我担心我的婆婆可能精神上出现了问题，她最近总是说胡话。Hello, doctor. I am afraid my mother-in-law has got some mentalproblems. She keeps speaking non-sense recently. 
E1 What are the symptoms? Does she often have some kind ofhallucinations or delusions? Or do you know if there are any unusualthoughts or ideas that seem to be with her?有哪些症状呢？她是不是经常产生某种幻觉或错觉？或者，你知不知道她是否有任何异常想法和奇怪的念头?
M2 是的，她有。但还不止这些。最近，她已经尿床好几回了。她也坐不住，还经常搓拉皮肤。她看起来不安又焦虑，对了，她还有失眠。Yes, there are. But that’s not all. Recently she has wet her bedseveral times. She can’t sit still and she has been rubbing and pullingher skin. She appears to be restless and anxious. Also she hasinsomnia. 
E2It seems to me that your mother-in-law has Dementia. It is the namefor a group of brain disorders that affect memory, behavior, learningand language. And Alzheimer's disease (AD) is the most common form ofsenile dementia.看起来你的婆婆得了痴呆症。痴呆症是一系列大脑失调的统称，会影响到记忆力、行为能力、学习和语言能力。阿尔兹海默氏症是老年痴呆中最常见的。
M3老年痴呆？怎么可能呢？她才 50 多岁。而且就在一年前，她还是好好的,而且我婆婆身体到现在都很健康，从不生病，壮得像头牛。Senile Dementia? How could this be possible? She is only in her50’s. And she was doing well just over a year ago. Plus my mother-in-lawis still physically fit. She never gets sick. She’s as tough asnails.
E3 Oh ok, she is suffering incontinence and anxiety. Those are signsof having dementia, including suddenly losing one’s faculties. Does shehave any problems taking showers, dressing, preparing meals or withother daily tasks? 喔，她现在大小便失禁，并且表现出焦虑。包括突然丧失自理能力/官能，都是痴呆症的症状表现。她在日常生活或活动中，有没有什么困难，比如自己洗澡、穿衣服、做饭等等？
M4 你说的这些，她都做不了。从前还是她替我们接送孩子上下学呢，可是现在连照顾好自己都有困难了。She can’t do any of the things that you mentioned. She used to helpus send the kids to school and pick them up from school, but now she iseven having difficulties looking after herself. 
E4I’m afraid your mother-in-law has already reached the advancedstage, which is not uncommon among people who have reached their 50s.She will need to see a psychiatrist.我恐怕你的婆婆已经到了晚期了。 这在年满 50 岁和 50岁以上的人群中，并非罕见。她必须去看精神科医生。
M5 我们带着她去看过许多老年病专家，可是都没什么结果。我跟我老公白天都上班，没人在家照顾她。现在我们知道她病了，我们该怎么办呢？We have taken her to see many geriatricians without any results. Myhusband and I have to work during the day, so nobody looks after her athome. Now we know she is sick, what should we do? 
E5 In that case, she will need to go into a nursing home. I am sureshe will be well looked after by the nurses and social workersthere.这样的话，就需要送她去疗养院。我相信那里的护士和社工会给她很好的照顾。
M6 那有什么很好的治疗方法吗？我父亲对于中医非常有兴趣，他很相信中药比常规的那些药更有效。Is there any effective treatment for this disease? My father is veryinterested in traditional Chinese Medicine, and he believes it is moreeffective than conventional medicine.
E6 Certainly there are some approaches and methods to deal with thissituation. However, as I said before, she is already in the late stagesof dementia, so it is really hard to guarantee the outcome.当然是有一些治疗方法的。但是，正如我说的，她已经是痴呆晚期了。所以很难保证治疗的结果。

entry.title: 医疗事故
entry.content:
This dialogue is between Mrs Yang (Y) and a legal aid officer (o). ** *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, my name is James Blue, a solicitor at this legal aidoffice. How can I help you?早上好，我是 James Blue, 是这个法律援助办公室的当值律师。有什么能帮您?
M1早上好。我是 Wen. 我想咨询一下法律程序方面的问题。Good morning, my name is Wen. I would like to make some inquiriesabout a legal procedure. 
E2Yes, what would you like to know? Is it regarding worker’s comp oris it a medical issue?好的。你想知道些什么呢？是关于工伤赔偿的？还是医疗方面 的?
M2事情是这样的。我一个月前在某家医院做了一个小手术，可是我上次例行复查的时候，居然发现我体内居然留有手术时器械的残片。这太吓人了！对于这起事故我非常生气，想对该医院采取一些法律手段。 Here is the story. I had a small operation at a hospital one monthago. But last time I went for my regular check-up, I was found with abroken piece of a utensil left in my body. It was very shocking! I amvery upset over the incident and I am going to take legal action againstthe hospital. 
E3There is a claim called medical negligence. It is normally wherepatients sue their doctors. Although your case is quite straightforward,winning is not guaranteed. That is the thing you have to be awareof.这种案子被称为医疗事故。一般是指病人状告医生。虽然你的案子很直接，但也不能保证一定会赢。你需要明白这一点。
M3也就是说，如果我输了官司，我就得支付双方的诉讼费用，这可会是一大笔钱啊，是这样吗？In other words, if I lose, I may have to pay the legal costs of bothsides, which is quite a large amount of money, isn’t it?
E4Yes, you are right. But there are some solicitors in Sydney whohandle no- win-no-charge cases. I can give you a few names and telephonenumbers if you like.是的，你说对了。但是悉尼一些律师是受理“不赢不收费”的案子的。如果你需要，我可以给你他们中一些人的名字和电话号码。
M4要是我不想告他们呢？律师可以帮我在庭外要来赔偿吗？如果解决不了，我再上法庭解决。 What if I don’t really want to sue them? Can those solicitors helpme to handle the claim outside the court? If it is not settled, we thenpresent the case in the court. 
E5Yes. You can discuss your preferences with the solicitor you havechosen. Regarding the procedures, I can only give the procedures most ofthe solicitors would follow, but it varies from person to person.是的。你可以跟你所选择的律师讨论你的意向。关于司法程序，我只能跟你讲讲大多数律师会遵从的程序，但这是因人而异的。
M5没关系。在法律方面，我是个外行。所以想请您跟我在详细地解释一下，并且让我很容易就能听明白。That is ok. But I don’t know much about law. So could you pleaseexplain to me in detail and make it easy for me to understand? 
E6First, your solicitor will write to the hospital informing them thathe or she is acting on your behalf. In the meantime you will need toobtain a written report "from the medical specialist to verify it is amedical negligence. // Secondly, your solicitor will inform you to goahead with all the necessary treatments and keep all the accounts.Thirdly, your solicitor will lodge a formal claim including the chargesto the hospital or their insurance company.首先，你的律师会发一封书面通知给医院，告诉他们他/她现在代表你行事。同时，你需要从专科医生那里拿到一份报告，证明这是一起医疗事故。然后，你的律师会告诉你接受所有必要的治疗并保存好相关的账目资料。最后，你的律师会提交一份正式的索赔，包括他要向医院或者医院的保险公司收取的相关费用。
M6如果他们同意照价赔偿，这个案子就结束了吧？要是他们拒绝了呢？Will the case be finalised if they are willing to pay the agreedamount? What will happen if they refuse to pay?

entry.title: 结核确诊
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Zhang (Z) and a TB specialist (S) atthe clinic. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1So what symptoms do you have? How long have you been feelingunwell?你有什么症状呢？你感觉不适有多长时间了?
M1我从三周前就开始咳嗽，我一直都以为是慢性支气管炎，因为我以前得过。您能跟我说一下结核病的常见症状吗？这样我也好回答一些。I have been coughing for more than three weeks. But I always thoughtit was just chronic bronchitis because I used to have this problem. Canyou tell me some common symptoms of TB so I can better answer yourquestion? 
E2Sure. People with TB may have some or all of the following symptoms:a cough that lasts for more than three weeks; fevers; unexplained weightloss; night sweats; always feeling tired; loss of appetite;blood-stained sputum and pain and/or swelling in the affected area whenTB is outside the lungs.好的。有结核的人通常会有以下一些或全部的症状：连续咳嗽超过三个星期，发烧，不明原因的体重下降，夜间盗汗，时常感到疲倦，胃口不好，痰中带血，如果是肺部以外的结核感染，受感染的部位还会有疼痛或肿胀，或又疼又肿。
M2我想起来了。我是最近食欲不佳，经常觉得累，体重也有骤然的下降。可是我不是病了么？这些反应都应该属于正常。That rings a bell. My appetite has been really poor recently, and Ioften feel tired. I have lost some weight in a very short period aswell. But aren’t they normal since I have been sick? 
E3Some people with active TB disease may have only mild symptoms, justlike your case here.有些结核病患者可能只有一些轻微的症状，跟你的情况一样。
M3那结核是怎样传播的？我可不想传染给我的家人或是身边的朋友。How is TB spread? I don’t want my family or my friends to beinfected. 
E4TB is spread through the air when a person with TB coughs, sneezesor speaks, sending germs in to the air, and when other people breathe inthese germs they can become infected.携带结核病菌的人在咳嗽、打喷嚏或讲话时会把病菌传播到空气中，病菌通过空气传播，别人吸入带有病菌的空气后就会受到感染。
M4那些长时间跟我接触的人，岂不是很容易被传染吗？那我是不是要带一直带着口罩？是不是应该最好被隔离起来？So it is easy for those people who spend a lot of time with me toget infected? Do I have to wear a mask all the time? Would it be bestfor me to be isolated?
E5I’d suggest they have a skin test as well. But it is not necessaryto keep you separated from others, because TB is not spread by householditems, such as crockery, drinking glasses, sheets, clothes ortelephones. But I am afraid you have to keep your mask on all thetime. 我建议他们也应该做个皮肤测试。但也没必要把你隔离起来，因为结核病菌不会通过接触家用物品传染。如餐具，水杯，床单，衣服或是电话。但我恐怕你得一直都带着口罩了。
M5那还好。我可不想被隔离起来，像个外星人一样生活。我大概会接受怎样的治疗呢？That makes me feel better. I don’t want to be isolated, living likean alien. What kind of treatment will I be receiving?
E6Generally, TB disease is treated with a combination of specialantibiotics for at least six months. People with TB can be cured if theycomplete the treatment.一般来说，结核病的治疗需要至少连续六个月服用特殊的抗生素药物组合。结核患者完成治疗后可以完全康复。
M6谢谢您的耐心讲解。我现在感觉好多了。Thank you for the explanation and for your patience. I am feelingmuch better now.

entry.title: 结核复查
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Zhang (Z) and a TB Specialist (S) atthe clinic. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1 Good morning, Mr Zhang. Thanks for coming today. Please let me havea look at your file first. So you have been diagnosed with TB, is thatcorrect?张先生，早上好。谢谢你今天过来。先让我看一下你的资料。你被诊断出患有结核，是这样吗?
M1 是的。我上个星期做了一个 X光胸片检查，医生发现了一些异常。但这之前，我定期的体检都没查出任何问题。 Yes. I had a chest X-ray last week, and the doctor found somethingabnormal. But before that, my regular health checks revealed noproblems. 
E2 First, you must know that TB infection and TB disease aredifferent. Maybe you have been infected since a long time ago, but theTB germs have just become active recently.首先，你必须知道结核感染者和结核患者是不同的。也许你很久以前就已经被感染了，但是结核菌直到最近才发作。
M2 对不起，我完全听不懂您说的。叫结核的这个东西到底是种什么病？I am sorry, but I didn’t understand what you said. What on earth isthis so-called TB? 
E3 TB is short for tuberculosis. It is a disease caused by thebacteria, Mycobacterium tuberculosis. TB can damage a person’s lungs orother parts of the body and cause serious illness.TB 是结核的简称。它是由于感染到一种叫结核病菌的细菌而引起的。结核会损伤人体的肺部或其他器官，从而引发严重的疾病。
M3 也就是说这是一种传染病。那您刚才所说的，感染结核病毒和患结核病，分别又是指什么呢？So it’s a contagious disease. Regarding the TB infection and TBdisease which you just mentioned, could you tell me what each of themare?
E4 TB infection means the TB germs are in the body but they areinactive. In most cases, the body’s defences control the germs. However,these germs can stay alive in an inactive state. While the TB germs areinactive, they cannot do any damage or be spread to other people. Theperson is “infected.”结核感染是指结核病毒已经进入人体但是出于潜伏状态。结核病毒进入人体后通常被人体的免疫系统所控制。但是这类病毒能够潜伏在人体中保持存活。在潜伏状态，结核病菌不会对人体造成伤害，也不会传染。携带者只是受到“感染”。
M4 那如果在潜伏期，怎么确定自己是不是被感染了呢？那么感染后多久，就会发病呢？During the period when the germs are inactive, how is the infectiondetected? And how long does it usually take for an infection to become adisease?
E5 Infection can be detected by a positive result to a Tuberculin SkinTest. It is possible, even after many years, for inactive TB germs tobecome active when the body’s defences are weakened. This may be due toageing, serious illness, a stressful event, drug or alcohol misuse, anHIV infection or other conditions.结核菌素皮肤测试如果呈阳性，就说明你被感染了。潜伏了许多年的结核病毒依然有可能活跃起来。由于年龄增加，罹患严重疾病，外界压力，滥用药品、酗酒，艾滋病毒感染或其他原因导致的人体抵抗力下降，就可能引起这种转变。
M5 所以结核和肺结核基本是一回事，对么？我听说这个病还挺严重的呢，在中国古代，多少人都死于肺痨。So TB and pulmonary tuberculosis are quite the same thing, am Iright? I was told that, this kind of disease is very serious. So manypeople died of pulmonary tuberculosis in ancient China. 
E6 Not really. Pulmonary tuberculosis is just one type of TB diseases,but this is the most common one. Actually, people who can be infectiousto others are only those with TB of the lungs or throat. TB is a curabledisease now. You don’t need to worry about that. 不完全对。肺结核只是结核病中一种，却是最常见的一种。其实，只有喉部和肺部有结核病菌的人才会对他人造成感染。结核病现在是一种可以治愈的疾病。你不必担心。
M6 这我就放心了。您不知道，我最怕死了。哪怕是身体有点儿小毛病，我就非常担心。That’s a big relief. Maybe you didn’t know, I am very afraid ofdeath. I become extremely worried whenever I have problems with myhealth, even small issues.

entry.title: 租车意外
entry.content:
Mr Xue (X) is reporting a car accident over the phone to a car rentalagency (A). * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1你好，请问是 ABC租车公司吗？我的名字叫薛安利。我和我妻子今天早上从你们公司租了一辆马自达。 Hello, is that ABC Rent-a-car company? My name is Anli Xue. My wifeand I rented a Mazda from your company this morning. 
M1Yes. Good afternoon, Mr Xue. May I have your booking referencenumber before I assist you with anything? 是的。下午好，薛先生。在我帮助您之前能否先告诉我们一下您的订单号码？
E2哎呀，来不及了。你先听我说，我们正开车去往 Blue Mountains， 但我们在Katoomba火车站附近出了交通事故。我不知道该怎么办，但我想我应该先通知你们一声。Well, there is no time for that. Listen, we are driving to the BlueMountains, but we’ve had a car accident near the Katoomba railwaystation. I don’t know what to do, but I thought I should just inform youabout this accident first. 
M2Yes. You did the right thing. I think I am able to find the bookingdetails if I do a search by your family name. Yes, there it is. Is thereanyone else in the car? Are you all fine?是的。您做的对。我想我可以通过搜索您的姓氏来找到您的预定信息。找到了。车上还有其他人吗？你们都还好吗?
E3我的头撞到了前玻璃窗，但不是很严重。所以我还好，可是我的妻子受伤很重。她说腹部有剧痛，而且她还有一条腿正在流血。I hit my head against the windshield. But it wasn’t very serious. SoI am alright but my wife is seriously injured. She is now complaining ofa sharp pain in the stomach, and her leg is bleeding. 
M3Do you need us to call an ambulance and the police for you? Pleasetell us exactly where you are. You can find this information on yourGPS.你需要我们帮您叫警察和救护车吗？请准确的告诉我们你的位置。 你可以从GPS 上找到这个信息。
E4是的，请你们马上就叫吧。我现在真的吓坏了。GPS 说我们现在的位置是Katoomba 区，Royal 路 5 号。 Yes, please do it right away. I am really freaked out right now.The GPS shows our current address is 5 Royal Road, Katoomba.
M4Ok, got it. Please first calm down. One of my colleagues is nowcalling the ambulance and the police for you. They will reach there andhelp you out in a few minutes. Also do you need an interpretingservice? 好的，收到。请先冷静下来。我的一位同事正在帮你叫警察和救护车。他们应该几分钟后就能找到你们并把你们解救出来。你也同样需要口译服务吧？
E5是的，你想的真周到。请他们让一个口译员跟他们一起来吧。因为我们还是要跟救护人员和警察讲一下事情的经过。Yes. You are very thoughtful. Please ask them to have an interpretercome with them, because we will have to explain to the paramedics andthe police about what happened. 
M5Sure. While we are waiting for help, could you tell me very brieflyhow it happened?好的。在我们等救援的这期间，您能够简要的告诉我事故是怎样发生的?
E6我在左转的时候，撞上了护栏。也许是车速太快了，撞了以后就翻车了。 I run into the guardrail when I turned to the left. Maybe I wasdriving too fast, the car went upside down after the collision. 
M6I see. I think the ambulance will be there in a minute. Are you witha private health insurance fund? Because the ambulance service is notcovered by Medicare.知道了。我想救护车应该马上就到了。你们有购买私人医疗保险吗？因为国民医疗保健 Medicare 是不报销救护车服务的。

entry.title: 课程咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Miss Jiang (J) and a course consultantregarding course enrolment (C). * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon, Miss Jiang. My name is Andrew Paris, a courseconsultant of DG TAFE. Nice to meet you.下午好，蒋小姐。我是 Andrew Paris. 是 DG TAFE 学校的课程顾问。很高兴见到你。
M1也很高兴见到你。有人告诉我要来这里咨询一下关于管理学文凭课程的情况，我找对地方了吗？Nice to meet you, too. I was told to come here for advice about theManagement Diploma courses. Have I come to the right place?
E2Certainly you have. So have you read our diploma course prospectusyet? I believe the information on what is covered in this course can bevery useful to you. And there are different ways you can do thecourse.你当然来对了。那么，你有没有看过我们文凭课程的详细说明？我相信关于课程内容的信息会对你很有帮助的。还有多种修读课程的方式可供你选择。
M2其实，这正是我感到有点困惑的地方。你们有全日制精读课程，部分时间学习的课程，模块课程等等。我不知道我该选哪一种。 Actually, this is where I’ve got a bit confused. There are full-timeintensive courses, part-time courses, and modular courses and so on. Idon’t know which one I should go with.
E3Well, let’s see if I can help. I think each course type has itsadvantages and disadvantages, so it really depends on you – your ownstudy habits, and your financial circumstances, of course. Are youworking at the moment?这样，让我看看能帮上什么。我想，每一种类型的课程都有其利弊，所以主要还是根据自己的情况：你个人的学习习惯，当然，还有你的经济状况。你现在有工作吗?
M3是的。我已经在某家当地的招待所做了三年的管理工作了。在那之前，我在一家销售公司做过两年的办公室工作。所以，我已经有5 年的相关工作经验了。这次我希望我能集中学习一下人事管理。Yes. I have been working in the administration section of a localhostel for the last three years. And before that, I had worked in theoffice of a sales company for two years. So I have got about five yearsof relevant work experience. And this time I’m hoping to focus onpersonnel management.
E4I see. And are you planning to leave your current job to study, orare you thinking about just taking a few days off from your weeklyschedule?我明白了。那你是打算辞掉你现在的工作呢，还是考虑每周请几天假而已?
M4真的，我想知道我都有哪些选择。我不想辞职或者怎样，而且我的雇主非常希望那我能拿到更高的学历。但是很明显，如果我能够在不过多影响工作的前提下学习课程，那就更好了。I want to know what my options are, really. I don’t want to quit myjob or anything and my employer is keen for me to get a higherqualification, but obviously it would be better if I could do a coursewithout taking too much time away from work. 
E5In this case, the full-time course is definitely not suitable foryou, right? So how about the financial side of things? Will you pay forthe study by yourself? Or will it be your employer? 这样看来，全日制的课程是不大适合你了，对吗？那么钱的问题呢？你是自己付学费，还是你的雇主会帮你付？
M5你看，我老板已经同意了为我支付课程本身的花费。但是，如果我想全日制学习的话，我必须请无薪假期，那么，我觉得我没办法在一整年都没有薪水的情况下养活自己。You see, my boss has agreed to pay the cost of the course itself,but I would have to take unpaid leave if I want to study full-time and,well, I don’t think I could afford to support myself with no salary fora whole year. 
E6Ok, well. You have two other possibilities: you could either do thepart-time course; that would be over two years and you won’t have totake much time off work. Or you could do what we call a modular course.You could do that in eighteen months or longer if you wanted.好的，那么，你还有两个选择。第一个选择，你可以读业余课程，要两年才能修完。你将不要请很多假。或者第二个选择，你可以选修我们的模块课程。如果你想的话，可以18 个月修完，或者更长的时间也可 以。这个很灵活，都取决于你。
M6后面这种听起来时间上比较灵活。我觉得会比较适合我的情况。我能知道更多的详细情况吗？The latter one sounds more flexible in terms of the time. I think itwould suit me better. Could you give me some more details?

entry.title: 考前家访
entry.content:
This dialogue is between Mrs Huang (H), a mother, and Mr Edward (E),a school teacher. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon, Mrs Huang. I am Mr Edward, a high school mathsteacher. Your son Eden is in one of my maths classes. Thanks for comingto today’s parent and teacher interview.下午好，黄太太。您可以称呼我 Edward先生。我是一名高中数学老师。您的儿子Eden，是我一个班上的学生。谢谢您来参加今天的家长 老师见面会。
M1下午好，Edward 先生。我很高兴来这儿。但是，是因为什么事情呢？是 Eden在学校闯祸了吗？Good afternoon, Mr Edward. I am happy to be here. But what is thisabout? Did Eden get into any trouble at school?
E2No, not at all. He is doing well. This kind of interview is arrangedfor every student in year 11. Because they are going to have their HSCexams next year, and they will have to make the first really importantdecision of their life on their own.不，根本没有。他表现很好。这样的见面会是为每一名 11年级的学生安排的。因为他们明年就要参加高考了，而且他们将要首次自主做出人生中最重要的一个决定。
M2是的，是的，我能理解。Eden也感觉到了压力很大。所以他学习更加刻苦了。作为家长，我和他爸爸都很关心他，可是又帮不上什么忙。Yes, yes. I can understand that. Eden also feels a lot of pressure,so he is studying even harder now. As parents, his father and I careabout him very much. But there is not much that we can do to helphim. 
E3That is exactly what we should figure out during today’s interview.Has Eden told you what he plans to do after graduating from highschool?这正是我们今天会面要解决的问题。Eden有跟你讲过他高中毕业后的打算吗？
M3他想读大学，学会计。按照这个目标，他现在的成绩够好吗？还是他需要再加多做做功课？您怎么认为？Eden wants to go to the university and study accounting. Are hisgrades good enough for that or should he be doing more homework? What doyou think?
E4Well, I have to answer that in two parts. Firstly, Eden is receivingexcellent results in all tests and assignments. He is actually one ofthe best students in his class. You should feel very proud of him.是这样，我必须分两个部分来回答这个问题。首先，Eden目前左右的测试和作业的成绩都非常好。他其实是他班上成绩最好的学生之一。您应该为他骄傲。
M4这个消息太好了。我很高兴听到这样的消息。谢谢，我想他能取得这样的成绩，也多亏了您教导有方，辛勤耕耘。That’s very good news. I am so glad to hear that. Thank you. Ibelieve it’s thanks to your excellent teaching and hard work that Edencould get such good grades. 
E5Thank you I’m flattered. And as he is receiving such good results Idon’t think it is necessary for him to do more homework. And if he cancontinue to work hard in class, I don't think he will have a problem ingetting into an accounting course.谢谢，您过奖了。既然他现在的成绩这么好，我觉得他没有必要再做更多的家庭作业了。而且，只要他能保持在课堂上努力的学习，我认为将来报读会计课程，对他来说没有问题。
M5听您这样说，我和她爸就都可以放心了。我们都不想给 Eden太大的压力，是他自己，追求完美。Hearing you say that, his father and I can now both relax. Neitherof us wants to put too much pressure on Eden. But it is just himself,always pursuing perfection. 
E6Eden is such a smart yet humble boy. I can see there is somethingvery special about him and I can tell he will do everything he can tomake his dreams come true.Eden 是这样一个聪明却谦虚的男孩子。我看到他身上有非常与众不同的地方。而且，我敢说，他会为了实现自己的梦想而不顾一切。
M6谢谢您，Edward 先生。我们会一如既往的支持他的。Thank you, Mr Edward. We will continue to support him as we alwayshave.

entry.title: 客房失窃
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Dong (D) whose room has just beenburgled and a police officer (P). * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Are you Mr. Dong? Did you call the police at 3:15 this afternoon,saying a burglar seemed to have broken into your room?你是董先生吗？是你今天下午 3 点 15分打电话报警说似乎有贼进入你的房间行窃吗?
M1是的，是我。是我打的电话。我们是外国来的游客，我们已经在这个酒店住了一个星期了。Yes, I am. And it was me who made the phone call. We are touristsfrom overseas, and we have been staying in this hotel for a week. 
E2Can you tell us about the situation first? I mean, can you tell usin detail what happened.能先跟我们介绍一下情况吗？我是说，请告诉我们更多的关于此事的详情。
M2好，当然。我们从市区观光回来的时候也就才 5点钟。之后我们就去了朋友的房间，在那儿聊天大概呆了有一个小时的样子。我确定我们锁好了门，但当我们回来的时候，门却是开着的。这非常奇怪。Yes. Of course. It was just 5 o’clock when we came back from a citytour. Then we went to our friend’s room, and stayed there talking for anhour or so. I am certain we locked the door properly, but when we cameback, the door was open, which was very strange.
E3That is very strange. Did you run into anyone suspicious in thehallway outside your room at that time? And what happened after you cameinto the room?这的确很奇怪。你在那时有没有在你房间外面的走廊里遇见什么可疑的人？那你进屋之后又发生了什么?
M3我谁也没看见。我发现我的行李箱是开着的，我的相机以及钱包里的 500元钱都不见了。但我女朋友的情况更糟。我想她的行李箱都被偷走了，而且她放在桌上的旅行支票也都不见了。I saw no one. I found my suitcase was open, and my camera and $500in cash inside the wallet were gone. But for my girlfriend, hersituation is much worse. I think her suitcase was stolen. And thetravellers cheques that she left on the table are gone.
E4Sorry to hear that but I am afraid that the cash is gone for good.As for the rest of the things, I have to ask: are you bothinsured? 很遗憾，但是我恐怕你们必须放弃这笔现金了。至于其他的物品，我必须得问，你们俩都上保险了吗？
M4是的。这是我的海外旅游意外保险卡，这是她的。我想我们必须给中国大使馆打个电话，因为丢了的行李箱里有我女朋友的护照。Yes. This is my overseas travel insurance card. And that’s hers. Ithink we have to call the Chinese embassy, because my girlfriend’spassport was in that stolen suitcase. 
E5Yes. I think you should. Did you ask the hotel to send up a securityguard to your room after the accident? It could be an inside jobconsidering there is no damage or any scratches on the door itself.是的，我想你应该打这个电话。事故发生后，你有没有让酒店派一个保安到你屋里来？考虑到门的本身并没有损坏或划痕，有可能是内部作案。
M5我们叫了。可是客房部的人说还得通知经理，可是经理那会儿不在。We did. But a staff from the housekeeping department told us theyhad to report this accident to their manager, but their manager was notthere. 
E6I will make a report for you ... Ok, here is the copy. Please attachthis report to your claim to the insurance company.我会给你写份报告的。好了，这是复本。请带着这份报告的复本到你的保险公司去索赔。你可以用这个复本来申请保险赔偿。
M6好的。虽然我们是很倒霉，但万幸的是，我们上了保险。Alright. Even though we’ve had this bad luck, we’re lucky that weare insured.

entry.title: 看车试驾
entry.content:
Well, we can go outside and you can have a good look at this one. Ithas auto transmission, only the colour is not red. Everything else isexactly the same as the one you ordered. You can even take it out for atest drive if you wish.  * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Well, we can go outside and you can have a good look at this one. Ithas auto transmission, only the colour is not red. Everything else isexactly the same as the one you ordered. You can even take it out for atest drive if you wish. 这样，我们可以到外面来，您可以好好的看看这款车。只是颜色不是红色的除此之外，其他都一模一样。甚至您喜欢的话，还可以开出去兜兜风作为试驾。
M1那可太好了，我都等不及想开车体验一下了。等等，对不起，我刚才出门比较急，好像忘记带驾照了。 That’s fantastic. I can’t wait to drive it and try it out. Wait aminute, I’m sorry. I forgot to bring my driver’s license as I was insuch a rush when I left home.
E2That’s alright. You can come back anytime this week. Can I ask youabout finance? The cash price is going to be somewhere in the region ofseventeen thousand. How would you like to pay? Are you in a position topay cash, or would you need credit?没关系。本周之内你可以随时再过来。能否让我问一下费用的问题？现金购买的价格大概会在 1 万 7这个区间左右。您想通过什么方式付款呢？您是想付现金呢？还是信用支付?
M2我想通过信用卡分期支付。我刚支付了房子的首付，所以目前手头有点紧。I’d like to pay by credit in instalments. I am a little bit short ofmoney as I just recently paid the down payment for a property. 27
E3Well, you can discuss that with my colleague in a moment; we havevarious methods of payment. Do you have a trade-in? I mean, would you beinterested in us taking your present car as part exchange?好吧，您可以稍后和我的同事一起商量一下这个问题。我们有很多种付款方式。您有没有要冲抵的车呢？我是指，您是否有兴趣把您现在的车卖给我们冲抵一部分费用?
M3是的。但我得知道你们是怎么估价的。只有我认为你们的估价是公平的，你们才能拿走它。否则，我们就自己找个车行把它卖掉。Yes. But I need to know how you will value it. You can take it onlyif I think your valuation is fair. Otherwise, we will find a dealerourselves and sell it. 
E4Ok, fine. So I will just need some personal details from you andthen we can do a valuation. Please give me your full name, address,postcode and a daytime phone number.好的，没问题。所以我需要您提供一些个人信息，然后我们会去做评估。请告诉我您的姓名、地址、邮编和白天的联系电话。
M4我名字是潘阳。住在 Norman 区，James Street 17 号，邮编2234。我白天的联系电话是 96887601。这个号码只是留言的，我会尽快给你们回电话的。这样可以吗？My name is Yang Pan, I am living at 17 James Street, Norman,postcode 2234, and my daytime phone number is 9688 7601. This number isjust for messages and then I will get back to you as soon as I can. Isthat ok?
E5That’s fine. And how about the car you have now, what make is it?And do you know the year of production or the model name? And themileage roughly? What colour is it?没关系。关于您现在的那辆车，是哪家制造商生产的？您知道它的出产年份或者型号名吗？还有大概的使用里程是多少？什么颜色的?
M5是辆本田车。我想生产年份应该是 2006 年，型号是 Puma.我不大确定里程数了，但我知道是少于 7 万公里的。灰色的，是金属灰。It’s a Honda. I think the year of production is 2006 and it’s calleda Puma. I am not sure about the mileage. But I know it is less thanseventy thousand. And the colour is gray, metallic gray.
E6Right, and one last thing – what sort of condition would you say itis in?好的。最后一个问题，您觉得它目前的使用状况如何?
M6我大概会说它现在用着还行。我手机里有几张我的车的照片，昨天刚拍的。你需要看看吗？I’d probably describe it as reasonable. I have a few photos of thatcar in my phone which I took yesterday. Do you want to see?

entry.title: 买辆丰田
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between a mandarin-speaking customer (C) and a carsales consultant (S). * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, please take a seat. I am John, the salesrepresentative here. How can I help you?早上好, 请坐。我是这里的销售代表 John, 有什么能帮您?
M1是这样，我正在考虑买一辆新车，需要一些建议。我对丰田车比较感兴趣，但我还没真的想好。Well, I’m thinking of buying a new car and I’d like some advice. Iam interested in a Toyota. But I haven’t really made up my mind. 
E2That is a smart choice. I’ve had a Toyota before and I liked it verymuch. We've got various models here. What about the engine size? Anyideas?明智之选。我以前也有一辆丰田，我也很喜欢它。 我们这儿有各种型号的丰田车。那发动机的大小呢？想要什么样的?
M2我现在用的这辆车是 1.2 升的发动机，但是我觉得长途旅行时它有些慢。这次我想要动力更强劲一些的。我想，1.8 升的应该够了，我觉得我不需要2.0 或者更大的了。The one I’ve got at the moment is a 1.2 litre engine but I find it abit slow on long journeys. I’d like a bit more power this time … a 1.8should do. I don’t think I need a 2.0 or anything more than that.
E3Right. Well I think the model you’re looking at is the Corolla.Here’s a picture. Of course we have got one in, and I will take you tohave a look in a minute. The Corolla has been awarded as the “bestselling economical compact car”.好的。那么我想你要着的车型是卡罗拉。这是一张图片。当然，我们也有现车，我会马上就带您去看的。卡罗拉被誉为是“销量最好的、最经济实惠的小型汽车”。
M3我喜欢这外形。多吸引人啊，不是吗？你看见红色的这台了吗？充满了激情和欲望，就像一团火。我猜我女儿也一定很中意这一款。I like the appearance. It’s very attractive, isn’t it? Did you seethe red one? It is full of passion and desire, just like a flame. I betmy daughter will also like it a lot. 
E4Yes, I agree. I have to say you have very good taste in cars. I willjust get a few more details. Um … are there any more requirements interms of the engine? What kind of gear change do you want? I presumeyou’d want a manual?是的，我同意。我必须说您对于汽车有很好的品位。我只是还需要一些详情。呃，还有什么和发动机相关的要求呢？你想要怎样的变档类型？我猜您想要手动档的?
M4我想要自动档的。我从来没在澳大利亚开过手动档的车。因为我第一个驾照是在中国拿的，而中国是靠右行驶的。可是这里是反的。I’d want a automatic. I have never driven a car with manual gears inAustralia. Because I got my first driving license in China, and in Chinapeople drive on the right. But it is the opposite here. 
E5I see. Well, now, here’s the colour chart for the Corolla. I knowyou love the red, but this blue is also very popular at the moment. Haveyou thought about the blue?我明白了。现在，这是卡罗纳的比色图表。 我知道你喜欢红色的那款，但是这款蓝色当下也很受欢迎。您有考虑过这款蓝颜色吗?
M5是，蓝的也好。可是我还是更喜欢红的。如果你了解一些中国文化，你应该知道，红色在中国是最喜庆的颜色。我想我就要这款叫做“激情之红”的吧。Yeah, blue is nice. But I still prefer the red. If you know a bitabout Chinese culture, you would understand Red is the most popularcolour for festivals. I think I will go for this one called “passionred”. 
E6Sure, I have heard of that. However, the only red Corolla we’ve gothere is a manual one. Therefore you might have to wait a week or so foryour order, but I assume that would be ok, right?当然我还真听说过。但是我们这儿有的唯一一辆红色卡罗拉是手动挡的。您可能要等一个星期左右才能到货。但我想，这应该不成问题吧，对吗?
M6是的，可以。只要不超过两周。因为我们在女儿的婚礼上会需要这辆车。Yes, fine, as long as it is no more than two weeks. Because, we aregoing to need this new car for my daughter’s wedding.

entry.title: 授权详谈
entry.content:
Mr Fan (F) is having a consultation regarding Power of Attorney witha solicitor at a Legal Aid office. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Morning, Mr Fan. Good to see you here today. You look great! What doyou think about the new aged care facility you just moved into?早上好，范先生，今天能在这里见到你真好。你看起来很不错。你觉得你刚搬入的那家老年人照料中心怎么样?
M1啊，这个敬老院挺好的。那里的社工把我照顾得很好，而且每天都有很多活动，我还能结识一些朋友。Uh, this nursing home is very good. The social workers here aretaking good care of me; they also arrange many activities every day forus to enjoy and I am able to make new friends. 
E2It seems to me that you really enjoy your life there, that’s good tohear. So what brings you here today? 看起来你很喜欢那里的生活，这很好。那么，你今天是为什么事情而来呢？ 
M2就是我老人院的一个朋友，跟我建议弄一个什么，叫什么来着？对了，授权书的一个东西。她说我已经78 岁了，最好安排一个人来替我管理我自己的事务。One of my friends in the nursing home suggested that I arrange athing … a … what is it called? Right, a power of attorney. She told meI’d better get someone to look after my own affairs since I am already78 years old.
E3Ok, I see … A power of attorney entitles a person to act on behalfof another and may include the power to make financial, personal ormedical decisions. The purpose of a power of attorney is to make surethat a trusted person attends to essential matters at the righttime.好，我明白了。授权书是让某人有权利来代表另一人行事，这些权利可包括对财务、个人或医疗事务做出决定的权利。授权书的目的在于确保接受授权的人士在适当时间管理基本的事务。
M3那您觉得我一定要这样做吗？我现在独立生活得挺好的，目前为止都没有任何的问题。但我的身体状况，的确是大不如前了。Do you think I have to do that? I am doing very well livingindependently. There has been no problem at all. However, my health isindeed not as good as before. 
E4No, you don’t have to unless you want to. It is your decision. Mostpeople prefer to look after their own affairs and retain theirindependence for as long as possible. However, for some people therecomes a time when they lose the ability to make decisions forthemselves.不是的，除非你愿意，否则你不一定要这样做。这你自己的选择。大多数人都喜欢自己管理自己的事务，尽可能长时间保持独立。但一些人到某一时间会丧失自己做决定的能力。
M4丧失做决定的能力？我并没有得老年痴呆，所以从来没考虑过这些情况。能给我举些例子来说明吗？Lose the ability to make decisions? I don’t have senile dementia soI have never thought about this scenario. Could you explain this to meusing some examples?
E5Sure. For some people, change may come quickly with the sudden onsetof an illness or accident. With a power of attorney, responsibilitiescan be gradually passed on to an adult family member, a non-familymember or a partner.当然。对于一些人来说，由于突发疾病或事故，他们可能遭遇突然的变故。如果有了授权书的话，当事人就可以将责任逐渐转给成年家庭成员、非家庭成员或是配偶。
M5那么具体说来，我可以委托哪些人，来代表我行事呢？我老伴儿已经去世了，我也无儿无女。So who exactly can be appointed as my attorney to act on my behalf?I am widowed and I don’t have any children. 
E6Under a power of attorney arrangement, the person acting on yourbehalf can be a close friend, a relative, a Public Trustee, a solicitoror an accountant. If you choose to appoint a Public Trustee, a solicitoror an accountant to act on your behalf, some costs may be involved.按照授权书的安排规定，代表你行事的人士可以是亲友、公共受托人、律师或会计。如果选择指定的公共受托人、律师或会计，就可能要支付一些费用。
M6我明白了。我可以再来找您吗？因为我现在还没想好该委托谁。I see. May I make another appointment with you? Because I haven’tdecided which person I should appoint.

entry.title: 交规咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between a new Mandarin-speaking migrant (M) and anofficer of Victoria Roads (O). * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Here is your Victorian driver’s licence. Please be aware that todrive a car in Australia, you must have a driver’s licence with you andthe vehicle you are driving must be registered with the government.这是您的维多利亚州的驾照。请注意，在澳大利亚开车，您必须随身持有驾驶执照，而您所驾驶的车辆也必须跟政府登记。
M1我知道，谢谢。这些规定跟中国几乎一样。我会谨慎驾驶的，但说实话，因为我当时只需要参加这里的路考，就可以把中国驾照转成澳洲驾照，所以在相关的法律法规方面，我并没有十足的把握。I know, thank you. These regulations here are similar to those inChina. I will be driving carefully. However, I don’t have fullconfidence in my knowledge on the relevant laws and regulations as Ionly needed to pass the road test here to have my Chinese licenceconverted to an Australian driver’s licence. 
E2There are quite a few things you should keep in mind, actually.Disobeying or breaking traffic laws can result in large fines, the lossof your driver’s licence or even imprisonment. Using a mobile phonewhile driving is against the law, unless you do so using a 'hands free'kit.确实有一些需要注意的事项。不遵守或违反交通规则会导致大笔罚款、被吊销驾驶执照、甚至被监禁。驾驶时使用手机是违法的﹐除非您使用“免提”设备。
M2这个我知道了，谢谢您的提醒。关于安全带呢？在中国，只有前排的人才必须系好安全带，对于坐在后排的人并没有硬性的规定。Ok, I know, thank you for reminding me. What about seatbelts? InChina, only people sitting in the front must wear seat belts. It’s notcompulsory for back seat passengers. 
E3There are seatbelts or 'restraints' in all cars for adults and olderchildren. The law states that everyone in your car must use a seatbeltor a proper child restraint, and if you are involved in a road accidentyou must report it to the police immediately.所有的汽车都安装了给成人及大一些的孩子使用的安全带。法例规定，车上的每个人必须系上安全带或使用适当的儿童安全座椅。如果您发生交通意外，您必须马上报警。
M3我只有一个 6 岁的儿子。我还去 Target转过，儿童安全座椅还挺贵的呢。用不了几年，他就长大了，有点划不来。I only have a 6-year-old son. I have been to Target looking forchild restraints/capsules, but they are rather expensive. He will growup soon, so he will only use it for a couple of years. It is not reallycost effective.
E4I see. In some areas it is possible to hire child safety restraints.To find out about the availability of this service in your area, you cancontact the Kids Safety Centre Victoria, on 9244 6858.我知道了。在某些地区是可以租用儿童安全座椅的。你可以拨打号码 92446858 给维多利亚州儿童安全中心，来查询你所在的地区是否提供该项服务。
M4这可太好了。谢谢。我知道，有关超速驾驶及酒后驾驶的法例特别严格。但是法定的血液酒精含量每个州各有不同，并且要视乎所持有的驾驶执照级别。Great. Thank you. I also know the laws are particularly strictregarding speed limits and driving after drinking alcohol. However,permitted blood alcohol levels vary, depending on the state orterritory, and in accordance with the class of driver’s licenceheld. 
E5Yes, that’s correct. In Australia, you must be familiar with theAlcohol Guidelines. And it is illegal to drink alcohol while driving. Adrink driving charge is a criminal charge and therefore if you areconvicted of drink-driving, it will appear on your criminal record.对，是这样的。在澳大利亚，你必须熟悉饮酒规定。而且，在驾驶时饮酒是违法的。酒驾是一项刑事指控，所以如果你因此被判有罪的话，会留下刑事犯罪记录。
M5好的，我会回去好好研究一下这些规定，多加注意。不过我是生意人，几乎每个星期都有很多应酬。不能自己开车，就得想好别的后备计划。Ok, I will study those policies closely and be very careful. But Iam a business man, I have to attend different business banquets andparties almost every week. If I shouldn’t drive, I’ll have to figure outa plan-B. 
E6That’s a wise decision. I have to tell you, driving safely is notjust for yourself, it impacts your family and the entire community aswell.这么想就对了。我必须告诉你，驾驶安全不仅仅是为了你一个人，这也关系到你的家庭和整个社会。
M6我完全同意你说的。谢谢。I can’t agree with you more. Thank you!

entry.title: 抑郁咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mrs. Li, a Chinese-speaking woman, and Mr.James, a counsellor at Lifeline, about the progress of Mrs. Li’sdepression problems. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning Mrs. Li. I haven’t seen you for three weeks. How areyou today?15
M1你早，James先生。说句实话，我不太好。这段时间我不常出门，可越呆在家里，情绪越低落。Good morning, Ms. Alison. To be honest, I‘m not that well. I don’tgo outside often these days. But the more I stay at home, the moredepressed I feel. 
E2Last time we met I asked you to go for a 30 minute walk every dayafter dinner. Did you try that and how did you find it?28
M2我试过。但是每次吃过晚饭，我总是感觉很累，想躺下睡觉。再说现在天黑的早，我一个人也不敢出去。I tried. But when I finish dinner, I always feel tired and want togo to bed. And it’s now getting dark early and I’m afraid of going outalone. 
E3I see. People with depression often don’t see the point of doinganything and they tend to enjoy solitude more than before. What do youdo during the day?29
M3也没什么特别的活动，就是每周去上两天英语课。有时候我还会坐公交汽车出去随便转转，就是为了消磨时间。Nothing particular, I just go to English courses for two days aweek. Sometimes I go around on a random bus tour just to kill sometime. 
E4That sounds like you are off to a good start. Apart from that, didyou find another activity that you really enjoy?22
M4我现在根本没有什么兴趣爱好，干什么都觉得没劲。我总是感到很孤独，有好几次都想一死了之。I have no hobbies at all. I feel listless doing anything. I alwaysfeel lonely and have wanted to kill myself on several occasions. 
E5Well, it seems that these suicidal thoughts are stopping you fromliving a normal life. Try to do things that can help you get the mostout of life.29
M5好吧，我尽力。每次和你谈完了之后，我都觉得有种如释重负的感觉。你能给我推荐一些相关的资料或者网站吗？All right, I will try my best. Each time I finish talking with you,I feel much relieved. Could you please recommend to me some relatedinformation or websites?
E6Good. It’s very important to think about the people who care aboutyou and try to enjoy things you like doing. Here is a brochure withorganisations that can provide support, education and information.34
M6非常感谢！那我们下次什么时候再见？Thank you very much. So when will our next appointment be?
E7We are supposed to see each other every three weeks. I’ll send you aletter informing you the date and time of our next meeting.25

entry.title: 静脉曲张
entry.content:
Mr Gao (G) goes to see a surgeon (S) after being treated for varicoseveins by his G.P. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mr Gao. Let me read your referral letter from Dr.Ruiz. I see, you’ve had some trouble with your legs. Tell me, what istroubling you?早上好，高先生，让我看一下 Ruiz医生给您写的转介信。我知道了，您的腿有些不好。告诉我究竟是什么困扰着您？
M1我的两腿痛得厉害。夜里经常痛得睡不着觉，有时一个晚上痛得醒过来五六次。天气变化时，我觉得更难受。My legs are so sore. I can’t ever sleep due to the pain. Sometimes,the pain wakes me up five or six times during the night. And I feel muchworse when the weather is changing. 
E2Would you take your trousers, shoes and socks off, Mr Gao? I want tohave a look at your legs. Yes, you have an infection and you suffer fromvaricose veins. Are you familiar with this condition?高先生，能否请您脱去裤子和鞋袜，我想检查一下你的腿。是的，你有感染，还有静脉曲张。您了解这样的病况吗?
M2其实从我小时候起就一直有这个毛病了。但以前并不经常发病，而且严重程度也远远不如今天。Actually, I have had this problem since I was little. But used tonot happen very often. And it was far less severe than it istoday. 
E3Right. This condition is hereditary. You now need to wear elasticstockings and take antibiotics to fight the infection. You may also needan operation if it gets any more serious.是的，这种病是会遗传的。现在你需要穿弹性橡皮袜，并服用一些抗生素来抑制感染。如果再恶化下去，你可能还需要动个手术。
M3大夫，我最怕的就是手术了。如果能用药物控制的话，请尽量避免手术吧！顺便问一下，动手术是否有后遗症呢？Doctor, an operation is the last thing I want. If we can control itwith medication, please try to avoid an operation. By the way, will theoperation cause any after-effects? 
E4Mr Gao, you may not have a choice. I can give you some drugs, butonly for today and tomorrow. But you have to come back to see me the dayafter. If there is no improvement, you need to have your varicose veinsremoved as soon as your infection is under control. 高先生，你可能没有选择。我能给你开点药让你今明两天服用。但你后天必须回来见我，如果没有好转，一旦我们控制住了感染，就需要将静脉曲张移除。
M4我之前一直服用抗生素，然是作用似乎不大。是不是因为我经常用抗生素，使细菌产生了抗药性呢？I used to take some antibiotics, but they didn’t seem to be veryeffective. Is it because I take antibiotics very often, so the bacteriahave gained resistance to the drugs?
E5You are partially right. It looks as if bacteria have begun tooutwit antibiotics, and hospitals are now fighting a battle againstgerms.您说对了一部分。看起来，细菌正在逐渐战胜抗生素，医药正在跟病毒进行着对抗。
M5还是不动手术的好！我从来都没做过手术。再说，手术也可能造成感染的吧？I’d still prefer not to have the operation since I’ve never had onebefore. What’s more, operations may also cause infections, right? 
E6But unfortunately, you must have this operation, or you may run therisk of losing your legs. Hospitals are the cleanest of places, and therisk of microbes being transmitted from patient to patient is stilllow.但是，很遗憾，这个手术你必须得做，否则你可能会失去你的双腿。医院是最卫生的地方了，微生物在病人中传播的可能性也很低。
M6让我回去和家里人商量商量，再来请教您吧。您能先帮我开药吗？Please let me go home and first discuss this with my family. Then Iwill come back to you. Could you just give me the prescription?

entry.title: 辅导咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mrs. Meng (M) and a counsellor (C). * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1While preschool is for children between the ages of 2 and 6, andhelps them to develop physically, emotionally and socially; Kindergartenis a kind of pre- schooling for children aged 4 to 6 to prepare them forprimary school.幼儿园招收年龄在 2 岁到 5 岁或 6岁之间的儿童，让孩子们在身体、情感和社交方面得到发展。而学前班也是一种幼儿园服务，适合准备升入小学的 4 至 6 岁的儿童。
M1可是我女儿已经快 6岁了。我可以让她先去上这种学前班么？要知道，她刚刚从国内大老远得过来，在这儿什么朋友也没有，除了弟弟，都没有人跟她一起玩儿。But my daughter is nearly 6 years old. Can I send her to this kindof kindergarten first? You know, she just came to Australia all the wayfrom China. She doesn't have any friends here. She has no one to playwith her, except for her younger brother.
E2You can. But you must know in Australia, it is compulsory forchildren between 6 and 15 years old to go to school, and often continueuntil they are 17 or 18 years old, in preparation for university orother further education.是的，可以。但你必须知道，在澳大利亚，所有 6 岁至 15岁之间的孩子都必须去上学。直至他们 17 岁或 18岁，就开始准备上大学或其他更高阶段的教育。
M2我还知道，一般说来 12 岁或 13岁以下的孩子上小学，年龄更大的孩子则上中学。你们还有政府公立学校和非政府学校，它们之间有什么区别？I also know that in general children under 12 or 13 years old attendprimary school and older children go to secondary school. And also thereare government schools and non-government schools. What are thedifferences between them?
E3Government schools provide free education. However, most schools askfor a voluntary contribution to enhance the school’s educational andsporting programs. Payment is up to parents. There are additionaleducational materials or services that parents can be expected toprovide or pay the school to provide.公立学校提供免费的教育，然而，大部份学校要求家长自愿资助学校的教育和运动课程。付款与否由家长决定。额外的教学材料或服务，则需要家长自己提供，或是由家长付款给学校而由学校来提供。
M3那基本上，家长就只需要给子女购买铅笔、钢笔、书本，以及有需要的话，还有校服等。对吗？那非政府学校呢？Therefore, basically parents only need to provide their childrenwith pencils, pens, textbooks, and school uniforms where appropriate. Isthat correct? And what about non-government schools?
E4Non-government schools charge fees, and they may have a religiousaffiliation or a particular educational philosophy. Parents who want tofind out about private education should make an appointment with therelevant non- government educational authority or contact the selectedschool directly.非政府学校要收费，而且它们可能会有宗教背景或者有特定的教育宗旨。想要了解有关私立教育情况的家长，应该与有关的私立教育管理机构预约或者直接和所选的学校联络。
M4可是我的孩子都是刚过来的，他们之前一直住在中国，一点儿英语也不会说。我很担心他们上课的时候，什么也听不懂, 学习跟不上。 But both of my children have just arrived here. They were living inChina before, so they can’t speak English at all. I am really worriedthat they may not understand anything or not be able to keep up.
E5Newly arrived children who don’t speak English should enrol directlyin English Language Schools (ELS) or English Language Centres (ELC)which provide intensive English programs designed for children. Theseare located in metropolitan areas and in some larger countrycentres.刚抵达不会说英语的孩子﹐可报读 ELS 英语学校及 ELC 英语中心﹐他们提供特别为孩子而设的强化英语课程。他们在市区内及一些较大的乡镇中心开设。
M5我们就住在市中心，这应该不难找。那我怎么给他们报名呢？报名时要带哪些材料呢？We live in the city, so it should be easy to find one. What should Ido for enrolment? What kinds of documents should I bring with me? 
E6To enrol your child in a school, contact the school by telephone orin person. You will need to take your visa or entry to Australiadocuments, proof of your child's date of birth, and any papers includingschool reports relating to their previous education.若要给您的孩子报名上学，请打电话或亲自去学校联系。您将需要带上您的签证或来澳大利亚的入境文件、您的孩子的出生日期的证明、以及和他们以前的教育有关的任何文件，包括成绩单。
M6好的，我明白了。谢谢您的宝贵时间。Alright, I see. Thank you for your time!

entry.title: 托儿咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mrs. Meng (M) a new migrant and acounsellor (C) from VIC Department of Education and Early ChildhoodDevelopment. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, welcome to the Department of Education and EarlyChildhood Development. My name is Lisa Green. I am a counsellor here,nice to meet you.早上好，欢迎来到教育与幼儿教育部。我是 LisaGreen，我是这里的咨询顾问。很高兴见到您
M1噢，你好，很高兴见到您。我和我丈夫刚刚拿到了永居签证。所以我想了解一下澳大利亚的教育和儿童照管服务。Oh, hello, nice to meet you, too. My husband and I have justreceived our Australian permanent residency, so I want to learn a littleabout Australia’s education and child care.
E2Sure, I can definitely help you with that. First, could you tell mehow many children you have and how old they are?当然，这方面我肯定能帮到您。首先，请告诉我您有几个孩子？他们都多大了?
M2我有一个男孩儿和一个女孩儿。我儿子三岁了，但我女儿今年七月份就满 6周岁了。我周一到周五都得上班，所以我白天的时候不怎么有空照顾他们。I have a boy and a girl. My son is three, but my daughter is turningsix in July this year. And I have to work from Monday to Friday, so Idon’t have time to look after them during the day.
E3For your son, there are many types of full-time and part-time childcare services available for children too young to go to school, as wellas for school age kids outside of school hours.针对你儿子的情况，我们有多种类型的全日制和非全日制的托儿服务。这些服务是为学前儿童以及课余时间的学龄儿童提供的。
M3据我所知，好像是有很多不同种类的托儿服务机构，对了，还有幼儿游戏小组呢，它们都各自提供什么样的服务呢？我可以在黄页电话簿中找到他们的联系方式吗？As far as I know, there are many different types of child careagents. Right, there are also playgroups. What kind of services do theyeach provide? Can I find their contacts in the Yellow Pages telephonedirectory?
E4Yes, you can. In Australia, there are preschools or kindergartens,which prepare children for school; child care or day care centres, whichlook after younger children; and family day care. And playgroups arewhere parents bring their children along so the children can learn tointeract with other children and the parents can chat and shareinformation.是的，可以。在澳大利亚，有为学龄前儿童上学做准备的幼稚园和学前班，照顾婴幼儿的托儿所或日托中心，和家庭日托中心。幼儿游戏小组是指，让各位家长和其孩子们聚在一起，让孩子学习如何相处，并且让家长们聊聊天、分享信息。
M4我现在还在上 AMEP的英文课，我班上也有一些同学和我情况差不多。他们告诉我说，我有可能有资格获得免费的学龄前儿童托儿服务。这是真的吗？Currently, I am still a student in the Adult Migrant English Program(AMEP). Some of my classmates are in a similar situation to me. Theytold me that I may be eligible for free child care for my kidsunder-school-age. Is that true? 
E5Yes. However, if you progress to a different study program aftercompleting your AMEP entitlement, it is important to review child carepayment arrangements as other programs do not cover these costs.是的。但是，当您完成了 AMEP课程，进升到不同的学习计划后，您便要为您的托儿服务另作安排，因为其他的学习计划是不会支付这些费用的。
M5那您是否刚好知道，我是不是也有资格获得托儿福利金或家庭补助金，来帮助支付托儿服务及其他开支呢？So do you happen to know whether or not I am also eligible for theChild Care Benefit and Family Assistance payments to help with childcare and other expenses?
E6Families with low incomes may receive some assistance from theGovernment to send their child to preschool. However, this is to do withthe social welfare policy. I am afraid you will have to go to speak withCentrelink about this issue. 低收入家庭可能由于送孩子到幼儿园学前班，而获得一些政府津贴。但这涉及到社会保障的政策。我恐怕，您必须得去Centrelink 咨询这方面的事宜。
M6我还听说，小孩注册儿童保育的时候，都需要出示孩子的疫苗接种记录。我该去哪查询这方面的信息呢？Also, I have been told I will need to present my children’simmunisation record when enrolling my children in child care. Where canI get more information about this?

entry.title: 分行投资
entry.content:
This dialogue is between Mr. Johnson, a branch manager of a bank, anda Chinese woman, Mrs. Li, who wants to find a good investment option. ** *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mrs. Li. It’s my pleasure to meet you here today. Doyou want anything to drink?18
M1不用了，谢谢。您电话里说有很多好的投资选项给我，今天我想跟你了解一下具体情况。I’m fine. Thank you. You told me on the phone there are a lot ofinvestment options. I would like to know more about those optionstoday.
E2You will have peace of mind if you choose to make a term depositwith us. I would recommend a term deposit of 6 months. The interest ratefor today is 5.3% per annum.34
M2我其实希望找到一种资金灵活性比较高的投资项目，我想随时可以把钱拿出来，以备不时之需。Actually I was hoping to find an investment project with higherflexibility. I want to be able to take my money out in case ofemergency.
E3We have a wide range of other products. You can take a look at ourrates here for term deposits of 30, 60 and 90 days.27
M3恩，这些时间投资产品时间上比较适合我。但是利息有点太低了，有没有利息更高的选项呢？Term deposits are suitable for me, but the interest rates are toolow. Are there any options with higher interests?
E4Our bank is in a long-term partnership with a few investment bankshere in Australia. They could come up with investment portfolios for youwith much higher returns. But higher returns carry higher risks.34
M4那都有哪些投资组合呢？有哪些风险呢？投资都会有风险的，也许几个投资方案组合在一起可以降低风险。What investment portfolios are available? What are their risks?There are always risks when you invest. Maybe the risks can be reducedif I combine several investment options.
E5Every investment is subject to credit risk, interest risk anddefault risk, etc. I think it would be better if you talk to ourpartners in person.27
M5好的。那麻烦您帮我约一下时间。现在把钱放在网上银行利息很低，我得尽快找到合适的投资产品。希望能够找到回报高，风险相对较低的产品。Ok. Could you please make an appointment for me? The interest foronline banking is very low. I want to find a suitable investment productas soon as possible. Hopefully I can find a product with high returnsand relatively low risks.
E6Take this term deposit sheet with you. They will help you can get anidea of our term deposit rates.20
M6非常感谢您的建议。今天我学到了很多。再见！Thank you for your advice. I have learnt a lot today. Bye.

entry.title: 雪糕上新
entry.content:
Steven, an advertising agent, meets Richard Wang, the marketingmanager of an ice-cream manufacturing company. They’re talking about thepublicity campaign for a new product. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mr. Wang. I’m Steven of Sterling & CooperAdvertising Company. Nice to meet you today.17
M1你好，Steven。我也很高兴见到你。我在邮件里跟你说了，我们公司准备促销一些新产品，希望通过你们的专业服务来提高销量。Hi Steven. Nice to meet you too. As I told you in the email, we arepreparing to promote some new products. I hope that through yourservices, we’ll be able to increase sales.
E2Sure, I’ll try my best to assist you. Our company is a 4A companywith a lot of well-known clients like McDonald’s and the CommonwealthBank. I can assure you that we provide services that are professionaland effective.39
M2好的。我们公司了解宣传的重要性，所以给了市场部充足的预算来支付广告费用。但目前我们还没有决定用哪一家广告公司。Ok. We understand the importance of promotion, so we have provided asufficient budget to the marking department to cover the costs ofadvertising, but at the moment, we haven’t decided which advertisingagency to use.
E3Mm, as an advertising agency with a high reputation in the industry,I firmly believe that our company would be the best choice for you.25
M3但愿如此。不过新视野公司是你们的强劲对手。这个咱们先不谈，你能和我说说对于这次新产品的宣传活动，你有什么想法？这一次我们加了一些新口味。I hope so. But New Vision Agency is a strong competitor of yours.But lets not talk about that first. Can you tell me your ideas for thenew products’ marketing campaign? This time, we added some newflavours.
E4Mm, summer’s coming and it’s really good timing for your newproducts. What I recommend to your company is what I call “diversifiedpublicity”.24
M4这是什么意思呢？What does that mean?
E5Diversified publicity is to create different publicity angles basedon your business life cycle and to time those products to the media foroptimum exposure. For example, many media outlets are seeking the latestin new products and will give you solid product reviews in theirpublications or on their shows.51
M5那你们可以帮我联系这些媒体吗？相信由你们出面协调此事一定能够事半功倍。Can you contact those media outlets for me? I’m sure if youcommunicate with them, it will be more effective.
E6Sure, that’s what we’re here for. Besides, we may also take intoconsideration television, radio, and outdoor billboardadvertisements.19
M6啊，这就是你们所谓的多元化宣传吧。听起来很不错。我决定了，这次和你们公司合作，希望我们这笔广告费能花的物有所值。Oh. This is what you mean by diversified publicity. It sounds good.I have decided to work with your company on this. Hopefully we will geta good result from the money spend on advertising.

entry.title: 东方丝绸
entry.content:
Mr. Johnson is calling from Sydney with an enquiry. Mr. Li Hua, whoworks with the Oriental Silk Corporation, answers the phone. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1感谢您致电东方丝绸公司，我是销售代表李华。请问我有什么可以帮到您？Thank you for calling Eastern Silk Company. I’m salesrepresentative, Li Hua. How can I help you?
M1Oh, good morning, Mr. Li. This is Rodger Johnson from Sydney,Australia. I’m calling with an enquiry. We are considering purchasingChinese silk products. Could you give us some idea about yourprices?33
E2当然。我们有各种各样优质的丝绸制品，相信能够满足您的不同需求。不过我觉得在电话上很难将他们一一列举。Sure. We have a wide variety of excellent silk products. I’m surethey can meet your various needs. But I think it is hard to list themone by one on the phone.
M2Could you please email us your samples and quotations? My emailaddress is purchase@collinstrade.com.au.14
E3好的，我马上就发。您尽可以联系其他公司来比较他们的报价，但我相信，我们所给的报价是最有竞争力的悉尼的到岸价。Ok. I will send them immediately. You can contact other companies tocompare the prices. I’m sure our quote is the most competitive CIF toSydney.
M3There it is. I’ve just received your email. Let me see... Well, theproducts are beautiful but the prices are more than I wasexpecting.25
E4约翰逊先生，我们的报价已经是市场上同等质量产品中最具有竞争力的了。Mr. Johnson, our prices are the most competitive for products of thesame quality in the market.
M4But they’re not very appealing to me. Let’s get this straight. Whatis the best price you can offer?19
E5如果你们一次订购超过 5000 件的话，我们公司愿意给你们最多5%特别的优惠。这已经是我们能给的最低价了，你知道，中国的用工成本近来已大幅增加。If you order more than 5000 articles. We would like to give you upto 5% discount. This is the lowest price we can offer. As you know,recently, the labor costs in China have increased significantly.
M5It’s a deal. I’m willing to accept your offer although the pricesare still a bit higher than I expected. What we are after is a long-termpartnership, rather than a one-time deal. I’ll order 5000 articles forthe first time. Will they be supplied from current stock?48
E6库存已全部售罄。不过我保证会在一个月内装运完毕。All of the stock has been sold out. But I guarantee all of them willbe restocked within one month.
M6That’s fine. Just email us the terms of the contract so we can sealthe deal as soon as possible. Thanks for your time today.25

entry.title: 工伤咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between a solicitor and Mr. Ma, who is consultingthe solicitor about his work-related injury. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1This is a dialogue between a solicitor and Mr. Ma, who is consultingthe solicitor about his work-related injury. Mr. Ma, I’m sorry to hearabout your injury. I do hope that I can help you with your compensationclaim.21
M1多谢。我之前不知道我可以申请工伤赔偿，多亏我的领班告诉我。希望您能帮我讨个公道。Many thanks. I didn’t realise that I could claim worker’scompensation. Lucky that my foreman told me about it. I hope that youcan help me get a fair settlement.
E2If you have suffered an injury at work, whether it is temporary orpermanent, then you are entitled to claim compensation for any loss ofincome, medical expenses, rehabilitation costs and future economiclosses.34
M2老板一定是有责任的，我也不太清楚员工是不是有保险。能不能先告诉我一般工伤赔偿申请的程序是什么?Your boss is definitely liable. I’m not sure whether the employeesare insured. First of all, can you please tell me the procedures ofclaiming worker’s compensation?
E3" First, you need to notify your employer. Then you need to obtain aWorkCover medical certificate from your doctor. Finally, you must notifythe insurer of the injury. You also need to ensure that the medicalcertificate and any associated bills or expenses are given to youremployer. Can you tell me what happened?"54
M3出意外的时候老板不在现场，只有我和领班在干活，我当时用电钻在砖墙上钻孔。有一小块金属碎屑飞到了我的眼睛里。The boss was not there when the accident happened. Only the foremanand me were on the job. I was drilling holes through the brick wallusing the drill. Some small bits of debris flew into my eye.
E4Did you wear eye protection when you were drilling? Every employerhas a duty to look after the safety of their employees in theirworkplace.25
M4我没有带任何护眼的东西。老板什么安全防护装备都没提供。我听说如果雇主没有在雇员安全问题上采取合理的防范措施，因此导致雇员事故的发生，雇员是可以申请工伤赔偿的。I did not wear any eye protection and my boss didn’t provide us withany protective equipment. I heard that if the employer has failed totake reasonable precautions for the safety of employees, which thenresults in accidents, then the employee is eligible to make a workerscompensation claim.
E5That’s right. The employer has a duty to comply with all therelevant statutory requirements and regulations about safe workingpractices and safe premises in which to work.28
M5我当时感到一阵剧痛，领班把我送到了附近的医疗中心，我的眼睛现在经常流眼泪，眨眼时会有刺痒的感觉.I felt a sharp pain in my eye. The foreman took to the medicalcentre nearby. Even now, I still have a watery eye and a scratchyfeeling when I blink.
E6Don’t worry, we have access to specialist compensation lawyers whowill help you achieve maximum compensation for any injury or loss youmay have suffered as a result of the accident.31
M6太感谢你了，如果需要的话，我会详细的告诉您所发生的一切.Thanks a lot. If needed, I’ll tell you in detail everything that hashappened.

entry.title: 残疾津贴
entry.content:
This dialogue is between a Centrelink officer and Mr. Chen, who wantsto claim the Disability Support Pension. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, we have an interpreter here for you today. How can Ihelp you?15
M1我今天来是想问一下有关残疾人津贴的事。我的朋友告诉我像我这种 情况,有资格得到补助，所以我想问一问什么样的人可以申请？I’m here today to enquire about the disability support pension. Myfriend told me people like me are eligible for that payment. I wouldlike to know who can claim this payment.
E2You may be eligible for the Disability Support Pension if you have aphysical, intellectual, or psychiatric condition that prevents you fromworking or being retrained for work within the next two years.33
M2还好我不是永久失明。不过我刚刚经历了一场车祸,而且它导致了我腰椎间盘突出。我的医生告诉我未来两年最好都不要工作,好好休息。Fortunately, I’m not permanently blind, but I just had a caraccident and it caused me to have a slipped disc. My doctor told me notto work and to rest for the next two years.
E3I'm sorry to hear that. You may be eligible, but I need to confirmthat you meet the other requirements. Are you an Australian permanentresident or citizen?28
M3我是澳大利亚公民。我想我可以获得这个津贴。我真的无法工作，连家务活做起来都很困难。所以我没有收入，需要这个补助来维持生活。I’m an Australian citizen, so I think I can get the benefit. Ireally can’t work. It is even hard for me to do household chores. Idon’t have any income, so I need this payment to support myself.
E4If you are eligible, you may receive a fortnightly DisabilitySupport Pension along with other benefits. If you start working again,you may still receive a payment, depending on the hours you work and howmuch you earn.38
M4医生说我需要特别注意饮食，不能过度劳累。很多雇主一听我有伤病根本不愿意雇用我。那我需要做什么评估吗？我要怎么申请呢？The doctor said I need to pay attention to my diet and not getovertired. Many employers don’t want to hire me once they know I havesome health issues. Do I need to do any assessment? How do I apply?
E5To be eligible, you must have your income and assets tested. Youneed to fill out this form. Also, here is a booklet that might helpyou.27
M5好的，非常感谢。可是我不懂英文，有人帮我翻译这个表格吗？"Ok, thank you very much. But I don’t understand English; is thereanyone
E6You need to provide proof of identity. Here is a list of acceptabledocuments. Depending on your circumstances, you may have to fill inother forms. You can also email or fax your application. We also providean interpreting service at Centrelink.41
M6太好了，多谢，那我就先去填表，如果有别的问题再来问你。That’s great. Thank you. I’ll fill the form out. I will come back ifI have other questions.

entry.title: 替父询福
entry.content:
A man, Mr Wang, comes to an appointment with a Centrelink officer,Peter, to consult about options available to his disabled father. * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mr Wang. I’m glad you made it here on time.12
M1早上好。我刚才在路上堵了半天，不过幸好我提前出门了。今天我想咨询一下关于照料我父亲的事情。Good morning. The traffic jam cost me a lot of time, but fortunatelyI left home early. I’d like to enquire about looking after myfather.
E2Of course. How may I assist you with that? Is he here with youtoday?25
M2因为行动不便就没有来。我想看一下你们有没有什么办法可以帮到我们，因为我平时需要上班养家糊口，没有时间照顾爸爸的起居。He didn’t come because of his lack of mobility. I’d like to knowwhether you can help us. I have to work to look after my family and donot have time to take care of my father.
E3If you want to take care of your father at home, you can considerclaiming Carer’s Allowance. But you need to meet some requirements to beeligible for that payment.29
M3要满足什么条件才有资格领取这个津贴呢？要是我符合条件就好了，这样我就可以在家照顾爸爸，同时也不用担心没有收入了。What requirements do I need to meet to get the benefit? It would begood if I meet the requirements, then I could look after my father athome and wouldn’t need to worry about my income.
E4To be eligible for Carer’s Allowance, carers must provide additionaldaily care and attention to a person with a disability or medicalcondition or someone who is frail, aged, and meets the residencerequirements.34
M4这样看来我应该符合要求，我是澳洲公民，所以居住方面的要求肯定没问题。被照顾的人需要满足什么条件吗？In that case, I should be eligible. I’m an Australian citizen, so Idefinitely meet the residence requirements. Does the care receiver needto meet any requirements?
E5Care receivers 16 and over must achieve a qualifying score asdetermined by the Adult Disability Assessment Determination 1999, and belikely to suffer from the condition or disability permanently or for anextended period of at least 12 months. They must also meet the residencerequirements, and receive care in either their home, their carer’s homeor in hospital.60
M55年前他在工地工作时受了伤，但从那时起，他就离不开轮椅了。所以他符合要求的，我也没问题。要怎么申请呢？He was injured when working at the construction site five years ago.He has been wheel -chair-bound since then．So both of us are eligible.How can we claim this payment?
E6I’ll give you some forms to fill in. Once you’ve completed them, youcan take them to the office.19
M6我了解了，谢谢你的详细解答！我会尽快提交申请的。I see. Thank you for the detailed explanation. I will submit theapplication as soon as possible.

entry.title: 接机国宾
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Thomas (T), an employee at SydneyCompany and Mr. Yang (Y), a visitor from China. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Excuse me, sir. Are you Mr Min Yang from Beijing Yuntong Co.Ltd?打扰了先生，请问您是北京运通公司的杨民先生吗？
M1是的，我是。您一定是 Thomas 先生吧，如果我没有弄错的话。Yes, I am. You must be Mr. Thomas, if I’m not mistaken.
E2Yes. I’m Tim Thomas, the secretary of the Human Resource Departmentat the Gold Leaf Group. We have been looking forward to your coming,sir.是的，我是 Tim Thomas， Gold Leaf 集团人力资源部的秘书。我们一直都期待着您的到来。
M2谢谢您亲自到机场来接我。这个机场真是太棒了，绝对是世界一流的机场。Thank you for coming to meet me at the airport. This is a fantasticairport, absolutely one of the top airports in the world.
E3I’m very glad to have the honor of meeting you in my hometown. Thisis indeed a first-class international airport, as everybody says. We’revery grateful that you took time from your busy schedule and come tovisit us.我很高兴能有这样的荣幸在我的家乡欢迎您。 正如大家所说的，这个机场的确是世界一流的国际机场。我们也非常感激您能在百忙之中抽出时间来我们公司访问。
M3我很期待能更好地了解贵公司。很感谢能有机会向澳大利亚的企业“取取经”。I’ve been looking forward to learning more about your company. Ireally appreciate this opportunity to learn from an Australiancompany.
E4How was the trip? It must be very tiring, flying for more than 10hours.您这一路还好么？飞了 10 个多小时，一定很疲劳吧。
M4还不算太坏。但是我们比预期的时间晚了一些。起飞的时候就因为遇上了暴风雨而推迟了。但后来，飞行天气就非常好了，而且机上的服务当然也很不错。Not too bad. But we were later than expected. Our plane was delayedtaking off as we ran into a storm. But we had good weather for flyingand the service on the plane was really good, of course.
E5Well, you must be very tired after the long trip, and you have toget over the jet-lag. We have got all the luggage, haven’t we? Let’sdrive directly to the hotel.这样，长途跋涉之后您一定很累了。而且您还必须克服时差的问题。我们是不是已经拿好全部的行李了，是吗？让我们直接开车到酒店去吧。
M5是啊，是有点累。而且我很不习惯时差。但过个两天，我就没问题了。Yes, I’m a bit tired. I’m very bad with jet-lag. But I’ll be alrightin a couple of days.
E6Good. We’ll take you to the hotel for a good rest. Here’s theschedule for tomorrow. We’ll host a reception lunch in your honour. Thenyou’ll meet with the chairman of the board in the afternoon. We’ll takeyou to an aboriginal show in the evening. Do you think that arrangementis suitable, Mr Yang?好的。我们这就带您去酒店好好休息。您明天早上不需要起太早。这是明天的安排。我们会为您举办一个欢迎午餐，之后您将在下午和董事长会面。晚上的时候我们会带您去看土著表演。您觉得这个安排合适么，杨先生？
M6我喜欢这样的安排。我听说澳大利亚人民是非常友善好客的。恐怕我很快我就会被你们宠坏的。您想得非常周到，Thomas先生。谢谢您啦！I like that. I’ve heard Australian people are very friendly andhospitable. I will soon be spoiled, I’m afraid. You’re very considerate,Mr. Thomas. Thank you!

entry.title: 招待国宾
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Chen (C), a Chinese speaking staff ofan international company and his Australian colleague Mr Kos (K). * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Hello Mr. Chen. Is there anything worrying you? You are not lookingvery well.嗨，陈先生。你今天可以下班了吗？是不是有什么担心的事情？你看起来不太好。
M1你好。明天有一个中国客户要来公司，老板让我帮忙定一家合适的餐馆，请中国客户吃晚饭。Hi. a Chinese client will come to visit us tomorrow and our bossasked me to book a good restaurant to invite the Chinese client fordinner.
E2Right. It is not that easy to choose a good restaurant which willsuit both parties. Do you need some recommendations?是这样的，要挑选一家双方都喜欢的餐馆不是一件很容易的事。需要什么建议吗？
M2是的。首先，餐馆的环境要适合商务会谈；其次，饭菜也得可口，服务还得非常好。Yes, I do. Firstly, the atmosphere of the restaurant must besuitable for business conversation. Secondly, the meals they offershould be tasty and the service there must be excellent.
E3Yes, exactly. It's better to choose a place that you have been tobefore, so you don’t have to check it out by yourself before the dinner.What do you think?是的，的确如此。最好选择一家你以前去过的餐馆，这样你就不用在晚宴之前亲自去试吃了。你觉得呢？
