M3你说得太对了！我想我想到了一家不错的餐馆，就在 Darling Harbour附近。不过是家中餐馆，你说行吗？you are absolutely right! I think I have come up with a goodrestaurant, very close to Darling Harbour. But it’s a Chineserestaurant. Do you think it will be fine?
E4I think I know which restaurant you are talking about now. I havebeen there many times. Their service is fantastic! However, the problemis, it’s too popular. So it may not be that quiet, especially at dinnertime.中餐馆? 我想我知道你说的是哪一家了。那家餐馆我去过很多次了。我喜欢那儿的饭菜！他们的服务业很棒！只不过，问题是，这家餐馆太受欢迎了。所以，可能不是那么安静，特别是晚餐的时候。
M4对，这是个问题。而且，请中国客人大老远得来澳大利亚吃中餐，总觉得有点奇怪。Yeah, it is a problem. Besides, inviting a Chinese client who hascome all the way to Australia for Chinese food seems a bit weird.
E5Well, it could be. However, if you think about it in a differentway, maybe choosing a Chinese restaurant also shows our interest andrespect for Chinese culture.嗯，有这可能。但是，如果你换个角度想，这也许能表明我们对中国文化的尊重和喜爱。
M5有道理。这样的话，我想，如果我们能够预订到靠近窗户的位置，应该是不会太吵的。而且明天是周三，我想应该不会有太多人吧。Makes sense. So, I think if we can book a spot near the window, itwon’t be too noisy. Also, tomorrow is Wednesday, so I guess they won’thave many guests.
E6Yes, I think that’s probably right. Ring them up and find out first.If there are seats available, I think it will be an enjoyable eveningfor all. Next time you’ll know how to choose an appropriate restaurant,and to take care of everything as early as possible.嗯，我想是的。先给他们打电话问问看吧。如果他们有位置的话，我想大家明天会度过一个非常美好的夜晚的。下次你就会知道还怎样选择合适的餐馆并尽可能尽早的照顾到方方面面了。
M6好的，我这就打电话。太谢谢你了！你真是我今天的救星。Sure, I will call them right away! Thank you so much! You reallysaved my day!

entry.title: 补课咨询
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. King (K), an officer of ABC Collegeand Ms Wu (W), a Chinese student. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, my name is Thomas King. How can I help you?早上好，我是 Thomas King，有什么可以帮你的吗？
M1早上好，我是吴云，有人介绍我来你这里，因为我想咨询一下你们开设的辅导课程的情况。看是不是适合我。Morning, my name is Yun Wu. I would like to enquire about whatcourses you have and whether they are suitable for me. Someonerecommended I come here.
E2Ok. Well, we run quite a few different short courses for studentswho are either returning to study or studying part-time. Um, tell meabout your situation.好的，是这样的，对于那些返校继续学习或者业余时间上课的学生，我们是有很多不同种类的短期课程。嗯，能否告诉我你的具体情况？
M2嗯，我认为我非常需要帮助，以便为新学期做准备。特别是树立我的信心以及帮助我有效的学习。因为，你看，我已经有将近12年都一直在工作，不再上课了，所以，距离我的学生时代，已经是很久以前的事了。Well, I think I really need help in preparing for the comingsemester, especially to build up my confidence and help me studyeffectively. Because, you see, I’ve been out in the work-force fornearly 12 years now, so it has been a long time since I was last astudent.
E3Let me have a look at what courses we have that might suit you. Areyou an undergraduate or a postgraduate? Arts or sciences?24
M3本科生，我是商学院的。Undergraduate, and I’m in the faculty of business.
E4Right then. First of all, there’s our intensive ‘Study for Success’seminar on the first and second of February. It’s aimed at students likeyou who are uncertain about what to expect at college.好的。首先，我们在 2 月 1 号和 2 号有一期“为成功而学习”的强化讲习班。它就是针对和你一样的那些不确定在大学该怎么做的学生。
M4听起来不错。那这个讲习班会介绍哪些学习方法呢？That sounds good. What are some of the strategies that arepresented?
E5Well, we try to cover all aspects of study. Some of the strategiesin writing and reading, for example. By the way, it is very important tobegin reading confidently right from the beginning.嗯，我们努力想涵盖学习的各个方面。比如，一些关于写作和阅读的方法和技巧。顺便说一下，从一开始就能够自信的阅读，这是非常重要的。
M5我其实读写都不太好。我现在就非常没有自信。你能再说得具体一些吗？Actually, I am not good at reading or writing, and I am extremelyunconfident right now. Can you tell me more about this?
E6With writing, you will learn how to organise your thinking. Withreading, there’ll be sessions about how to analyse materials and tips onhow to remember what you have read.写作方面，你会学到一些关于如何完善写作计划 。阅读方面，那些课程旨在培养你怎么分析材料，并告诉你一些小技巧，如何来记忆读过的内容。
M6这真是太好了！这就是我最需要的。能告诉我怎样预约参加这个讲习班吗？非常感谢！That’s excellent! That’s what I need the most. Could you tell mewhere I can book this seminar? Thank you very much!

entry.title: 赡养福利
entry.content:
A woman Mrs. Lee is seeking legal advice about child maintenance. * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning. I’m Michelle West. How can I help you Mrs. Lee?12
M1早上好。我需要一些关于孩子抚养费的建议。我丈夫和我四个月前分居了。他承诺他会给我们钱的。但是昨天，我们一个共同的朋友跟我说，他已经回到中国，而且不会再回来了。Good morning, I would like to get some advice on child maintenance.My husband and I have been separated four months ago. He promised togive us some money. But yesterday a mutual friend of ours told me thathe has gone back to China and will never come back.
E2I assume that must be quite shocking to you. How many children doyou have with him, Mrs. Lee? And how old are they?22
M2三个。是两个女儿和一个儿子。他们分别是三岁，五岁和六岁。我现在应该怎么办呢？我都快绝望了。Three. Two daughters and one son. They are three, five and six yearsold. What should I do now? I feel so hopeless.
E3Do you work at the moment? And has your husband given you any moneysince you separated? It’ll be very difficult for you to get anythingfrom him if he’s living overseas.31
M3带着三个小孩子，我怎么工作？真的一点办法都没有吗？分居后他根本没给我钱。实际上，他还给我留了一些债务。我已经用我的积蓄还清了。How can I work when taking care of three kids? Is there anysolution? He didn’t give me any money after separating. Instead, he leftme some debts but I have already paid them off with my savings.
E4Let’s not give up all hope. Where did your husband work when he wasliving in Australia?18
M4在他离开之前，他已经有一阵子不工作了。如果他一直住在中国，而且不回到澳洲来，我怎么样才能让他支付孩子的抚养费呢？Before he left, he had been out of work for quite a while. If hestays in China and never comes back, how can I make him pay me the childmaintenance?
E5What you need to do now is to find out his address in China so thatwe can write to him and ask him what his intentions are. You should alsogo and speak to Centrelink as soon as possible.40
M5好的。我会马上找朋友帮我去查出他在中国的居住地址的。但是我拿到永居身份还不到两年，可以领取Centrelink 的福利款吗?Alright. I will ask my friend to help me find out his residentialaddress in China. But it hasn’t been two years since I got my permanentresidency, am I entitled to Centrelink payments?
E6Well, I suggest you go there anyway and make enquiries. Centrelinkprovides various forms of assistance, although certain residencerequirements do apply for most of the payments, maybe there are a fewbenefits you are entitled to.39
M6我明白了。谢谢您的建议。我这就去做。再见！I understand. Thank you for the advice. I will do that right away.Good bye.

entry.title: 目击陈述
entry.content:
The following dialogue takes place between a policeman, ConstableStevenson and a Mandarin speaker, Mr. Lin. It concerns a recent robberyat Mr. Lin’s house. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1谢谢你这么快就来了。我请来了一位专业口译。我在电话里已经告诉警察我们所有的电器设备都被偷走了。Thank you for coming at such short notice. I hired a professionalinterpreter. I told the police that all our electronic appliances werestolen.)
M1No worries. Now if you can just describe what happened. From thelook of things, there has been forced entry at the side window.24
E2是的是的。窗户上有保险锁。但我们认为小偷是用我太太放在车库里的一根高尔夫球棍砸开的，那根高尔夫球棍还躺在那呢。Yes, yes. The window has safety locks. But we think the burglar useda golf club that my wife put in the garage to smash it open. The club isstill lying on the floor over there.
M2Right. We’ll have to take that away to check for finger prints. Wewill also check the door for finger prints. Now tell me when you firstnoticed something was wrong.31
E3我五点下班回家看到前门被打开了而且旁边的窗户被打碎了，我就去按邻居的门铃，是跟邻居一起进来的。?
M3According to your description, it seems the burglar went in throughthe window and came out from the door. Have you checked what wastaken?25
E4有录像机，光碟播放机和我太太的笔记本电脑。小偷知道他要拿什么，因为他根本没有碰像微波炉和首饰这样的东西。A video recorder, CD-player and my wife’s laptop. The burglar knewwhat to take because they didn’t touch other stuff like the microwave orjewellery at all.
M4Yes, that’s often the case. We’ll check with the neighbourhood watchbut have you noticed anything lately or anyone suspicious in yourstreet?23
E5没有，我想不起来有什么。也许你应该等一下，问问我太太。她常常白天在家里工作，或许可以提供什么线索。No, nothing I can think of. Maybe you can wait for my wife to comeback home. She often works at home during the day, so she may have someidea.
M5Yes we’ll make a point of speaking to her as soon as possible. Whereis she now by the way? Also, is this the first time you have beenburgled like this?32
E6她可能是去买菜了。其实这是我们今年第三次被盗了。Maybe she has gone grocery shopping. In fact, it is the third timewe’ve been burgled this year.
M6You should always report any break-ins. You’ll be surprised how manytimes a thief strikes one neighbourhood in a short period of time.23

entry.title: 虐待儿童
entry.content:
Mr. Wang, a parent, is being interviewed by an officer from theDepartment of Community Services about the welfare of Mr. Wang’s child.* * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Mr. Wang, we’ve called you in because we are concerned about yourson. He has bruises on his legs. Can you tell us how he got them?27
M1我不清楚啊，我每天都很忙，平时都是他妈妈照顾他。我猜，一定是他在学校时摔了跤吧？I have no idea. I am pretty busy every day. His mother is the onewho is looking after him. I guess he must have had a fall atschool.
E2Well, it’s been reported that he has had these bruises before. Ifhe’s fallen over that many times perhaps there’s something wrong withhim that the doctor needs to check.30
M2我的儿子可没有问题，不需要医生检查。另外，是谁报告的？这是我们家里的问题，不管别人的事。There’s nothing wrong with my son and he doesn’t need to see anydoctor. Also, who reported this? It’s our own domestic affairs, none ofother people’s business.
E3It was reported by your son’s school, because they are worried itmight be a matter of child abuse. Do you understand that in Australiaphysical punishment upon children is illegal?31
M3虐待儿童？他是我的儿子。他做错事的时候，我必须要管教一下他。我那是在教育他该如何尊重父母。Child abuse? He is my son and I have to discipline him if hemisbehaves. I was teaching him how to show respect to his parents.
E4Discipline is one thing but causing bodily harm to your child is notacceptable under the law. You may face some serious criminalconsequences.25
M4没人可以告诉我怎么管教我的儿子。我必须让他知道好好学习很重要。如果现在读书不好，将来一辈子没出息。No one can tell me how to discipline my son. I have to let him knowthe importance of studying hard. If he is not doing well in his studies,he will be a loser for the whole of his life.
E5We are not questioning your authority over your son. It’s the waythe punishment is given which is wrong under the law. If you causebruising to your son, you can be charged.33
M5可我认为,做为父亲就是要对儿子严厉一些。但是，你刚说的刑事后果具体是什么意思？But I think as his father, it’s my responsibility to raise my sonstrictly. What do you mean exactly by criminal consequences which youjust mentioned?
E6You could be charged with assault or causing actual bodily harm andif found guilty, sent to jail. At the very least, your son will be takeninto care if you continue to abuse him like this.37
M6这么严重啊？那我以后注意。我当然不希望儿子被别人带走。20

entry.title: 邻家被盗
entry.content:
Mrs. Liu, a Mandarin-speaking woman is telephoning Crime Stoppers toreport a crime currently being committed outside her residence. * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Thank you for calling Crime Stoppers. How can I help you?11
M1我要报案，有人正在入室行窃。我从我卧室的窗户能看到三个人，他们闯进了我邻居的家里。I’d like to report a crime, a burglary. I can see three people outof my bedroom window. They’ve broken into my neighbour’s house.
E2OK. Stay where you are and don’t let them see you looking at them.Can you please tell me your address so I can send out a police carimmediately?31
M2是 Strathfield 区皇后大街 56号。三个男人正在把液晶电视、音响，还有台式机电脑往一辆面包车里搬呢。奇怪，报警器怎么没响？No. 56, Queens Street, Strathfield. Three men are now carrying theLCD TV, hi-fi system and desktop computer into a van. It’s very strange.How come the alarm wasn’t set off?
E3Could you describe their appearance to me as well as the van – andcan you see the license plate? Any details you provide will be of greatassistance to the police.31
M3他们身穿黑色 T恤衫，运动裤。是一辆老款的白色丰田车。天色太暗了，我看不清楚车牌。警察怎么还没来？They’re wearing black T-shirts and sports shorts. It’s an old modelToyota. I can’t see the plate clearly because it’s too dark outside. Howcome the police are not here yet?
E4I’ve notified the police already and they should arrive there in thenext five minutes or so. Do you know your neighbour’s name, where theyare right now and when they will come back?34
M4她叫 AliceGreen。她现在在马来西亚度假。她请我在她不在家的时候帮她收邮件和喂猫。她要过两个星期才回来。Her name is Alice Green and she is on holiday in Malaysia. She askedme to pick up her mail and feed her cat while she’s away. She’ll be backin two weeks.
E5Thank you. Now, you may want to remain anonymous, but if you’rewilling to give us your name or talk to the field officer later, it maybe of great assistance to the police.34
M5我不介意。我叫刘晓红，如果警察有什么问题，我很乐意和他们聊聊。我这辈子还从来就没遇到入室行窃的事儿。I don’t mind. My name is Liu Xiaohong and I’m happy to talk to theofficers if they have any more questions. I’ve never come across aburglary my whole life.
E6If you worry about your safety, please call your local NeighbourhoodWatch Centre. I’m sure they can help you with how to protect yourselfand your home.27
M6话是这么说，但我还是小心一点好。糟糕，他们正要开车跑了！That being said, I’d better be alert. Oh no, now they are drivingaway!

entry.title: 缉毒伸冤
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Cheng (C), a Mandarin speaking man,and Mr. Smith (S), a lawyer regarding some legal issues. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1你好，史密斯先生。今天为我是来寻求你的帮助的。我听说，你是本市有名的刑事案件方面的律师，对吗？Hello Mr. Smith. I am here today to seek your help. I heard that youare a famous criminal lawyer in this city. Is that correct?
M1Mr. Cheng, I specialise in criminal law with more than 25 years ofexperience in various criminal cases ranging from burglary to murder.Please give me a brief description about your situation.32
E2两天前，几个警察突然带着搜查令进入我居住的房子，他们从我家搜出了一包毒品，但我根本不知道那是哪来的。Two days ago, several police officers suddenly came to my house witha search warrant and they seized a packet of drugs from my house but Ihad no idea how it got there.
M2I am familiar with similar matters. The key question is if you areabsolutely certain you were not in possession of any drugs. Do yoususpect someone may have planted the drugs at your house?35
E3我很确定。关于你的第二个问题，那可能是跟我住一起的任何一个人。但不管是谁，这个人已经严重的败坏了我的名誉，使我的未来岌岌可危。I am positive. As to your second question, it could have been anyoneliving with me. But whoever did this has seriously harmed my personalreputation and put my future at stake.
M3Your concern is understandable, although not completely necessary,Mr. Cheng. Now I have another question for you, are you currently onbail? If so, when did you receive it?29
E4昨天，地方法院的法官准予我获得保释，但前提是，我必须上交我的护照。这个案子会在12 月 23 号开庭审理。 I was granted bail by a magistrate in the LocalCourt yesterday on the condition that I had to surrender my passport.The matter is due to be heard on the twenty-third of December.I was granted bail by a magistrate in the Local Court yesterday onthe condition that I had to surrender my passport. The matter is due tobe heard on the twenty-third of December.
M4Are you aware of the exact criminal charge laid against you? If youare, we should then lose no time in consulting the relevant legislationand case law.28
E5警察说，我被指控的罪名是私藏毒品。好像还有别的什么，我不大清楚。The police told me that I have been charged with illegal possessionof drugs. There could be something else….I'm not too sure.
M5Have the police told you the amount of drugs that were found in yourhouse? You need to inform me of the exact quantity, as it will make abig difference to your defense.34
E6我不大记得了，但可能是超过 100克的。为什么问这个呢？你是在怀疑我的清白吗？I cannot remember but it couldn’t be more than 100 grams. Why do youask this? Do you doubt my innocence?
M6On the contrary, I always have confidence in my clients. We’ll signa costs agreement and I’ll start working on your case immediately.23

entry.title: 租赁纠纷
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Chen (C), a Mandarin speaking man, andSteven (S), a solicitor in the local community legal centre. Mr. Chen isseeking advice on problems between him and his landlord. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
M1你好。我想问一下 Steven 先生在不在？我跟他约了今天十点钟的会面。Hello, I’d like to know whether Steven is here or not. I’ve made anappointment to see him at 10 o’clock today.Hello, I’d like to know whether Steven is here or not. I’ve made anappointment to see him at 10 o’clock today.
E1Are you Mr. Chen? I think you are looking for me as I’m the onlySteven here. Please take a seat. How may I help you today?27
M2是这样，我的朋友建议我到这里来咨询一下律师，因为我在准备起诉我的房东，来捍卫自己的合理权益。因为我房东他过分了！Look, my friend suggested that I come here and speak to some lawyersbecause I’m planning to sue my landlord and fight for my rights. He’sridiculous!Look, my friend suggested that I come here and speak to some lawyersbecause I’m planning to sue my landlord and fight for my rights. He’sridiculous!
E2It seems that you’ve got a problem or dispute with your landlord.But I can reassure you that you’re protected by the “Office for FairTrading” as a tenant in New South Wales. Tell me, what’s theproblem?38
M3两个星期之前，我跟我的房东说我想搬走。从那以后，他每天都带不同的人来我住的地方看房。我跟他表达过我的不满，但是他都不理不睬。I told my landlord two weeks ago that I wanted to move out. Sincethen, he’s taken different people into the place for an open house everyday. I made a complaint to him but he just ignored me.
E3You’re absolutely right in the sense that he can’t come whenever helikes. Landlords are only allowed to enter the premises at certain timesfor certain reasons and in most cases have to give you noticefirst.37
M4我也这样认为。当我问他怎么能这样做的时候，他只说他这是在保护他自己的权益。他想要尽快把这间房租出去。That’s what I thought. When I asked him why he was doing that, hejust told me that he’s protecting his rights by doing so. He wants torent the place out as soon as possible.
E4If this matter cannot be resolved between you and your landlord, I’dsuggest you take this to the Consumer, Trader and Tenancy Tribunal,which specialises in handling tenancy disputes.30
M5上法庭吗？那我需要请律师吗？会花很多钱吧？还有啊，我一点英语都不会讲，我跟法官沟通不了，可怎么办呢？Going to court? Do I need to hire a lawyer? Does it cost a lot? Ontop of that, I don’t speak English at all, what if I can’t communicatewith the judge?
E5You can represent yourself at the tribunal. The tribunal willprovide interpreters to assist people whose first language is notEnglish. As for the application fee, it’s $38 for tenancy disputes.33
M6那好，我明白了。我想问一下我可以去哪里拿一份申请表呢？今天真是麻烦你了。OK, I understand. I’m just wondering where I can get a copy of theapplication form. Thank you very much for today.
E6I can give you an application form, just a second.10

entry.title: 百日咳症
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mrs. Li and her GP, Dr. Smith, regardingher daughter’s whooping cough. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mrs. Li. How can I help you today?10
M1医生你好,我今天带了我的大女儿来看你。她最近一直咳嗽，不能停的那种，而且鼻子不通气，打喷嚏还有点发低烧。我的女儿到底是怎么了？Hello, doctor. I’ve brought my oldest daughter here today. She hasbeen coughing and couldn’t stop. She also has a stuffy nose, sneezingand mild fever. What’s wrong with her?
E2Well, based on what you have just described, I am afraid that yourdaughter may be in the early stages of whopping cough. The symptomscould develop further if it is not treated.33
M2真的？这听上去太可怕了！那这种病是不是很严重呢？我的女儿是怎么患上这种病的呢？最近她们学校感冒的人特别多，和这个有没有关系呢？Really? That sounds horrible! Is it a serious disease? Where did sheget it? Currently, so many students in her school have caught colds,could that be the cause?
E3Whooping cough is a serious respiratory infection that causes a longcoughing illness. In babies, it can lead to pneumonia and brain damageand it can be life- threatening. Older children’s lives are not at risk,but they can spread this illness to others, including babies.45
M3我家里还有一个小宝贝儿子呢，是不是就是说我的小宝宝现在也被传染上百日咳了呢？但是我的小宝宝没有咳嗽的症状，所以我今天就没有带他来。I have another little baby boy at home. Do you mean my little babyhas also contracted whooping cough? But he has no symptom of coughing soI didn’t bring him here today.
E4Yes, it’s possible! Whooping cough is highly infectious in the first3 weeks; it spreads easily through families, childcare centres andschools so it is likely that your baby boy has already been infected.Some newborn babies do not cough at all. Instead, they turn blue. So itis important that you bring your baby boy here for a check up.61
M4百日咳是怎样传染的呢？那我怎样防止我的孩子患上百日咳呢？我的小儿子在 2 个月，4 个月和 6个月的时候打过疫苗，这一点用也没有吗?How does whooping cough spread? What do I need to do to prevent mychildren from getting the disease? My youngest son was immunised againstit when he was 2 months, 4 months and 6 months old. Was that helpful atall?
E5Whooping cough is spread when the infected person coughs and thebacteria coughed into the air is inhaled by babies, children or adultsnearby. These people are in danger of getting whooping cough. Just keepin mind that even immunised children can sometimes catch whoopingcough.46
M5那我知道了，但是你还没有告诉我我都需要做什么去保护我的孩子。有什么药物治疗的方法吗?Oh, I see. But you still haven’t told me what I need to do toprotect my children. Is there any medicine that can treat thedisease?
E6If whooping cough is detected early enough, like in your daughter’scase, a course of antibiotics could be prescribed, which I am going todo in a second. After 5 days of treatment, enough bacteria will bekilled to stop it spreading to others. The best way to protect yourchildren would be keeping them away from the infected.59
M6我知道了，医生，谢谢。我明天就带小宝宝来见你。I understand. Thank you, doctor. I will bring my little baby here tosee you tomorrow.

entry.title: 初诊肥胖
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between a doctor and a patient who has just beendiagnosed with diabetes. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, thank you for coming in today. As I explained to youlast time, you have been diagnosed with diabetes; Your body can’tproduce enough insulin to break down the sugar in your body, so thesugar remains in your blood.
M1但是我还是不明白，我怎么会有糖尿病哪？我不喜欢吃甜食，怎么会有那么多的糖在我体内哪？还有为什么我最近会觉得有些虚弱，疲倦，而且有时还会头晕？42
E2Well, how much sugar remains in your body has little to do with howmuch sweet food you eat. Basically, without enough insulin, your bodycan’t break down the sugars in food into a form it can absorb, so thecells are not getting enough energy, which is why you get tired.But I still don’t understand. How come I have diabetes? I don’t likesweet food. Why is there so much sugar stored in my body? Also, why do Ioften feel weak, tired and sometimes dizzy?
M2我明白了，那有什么方法可以完全治愈吗？有什么药物还是我必须要打针呢？我有一些朋友也有糖尿病，他们每天吃饭之前都要打针，真是太可怕了！52
E3You have been diagnosed with diabetes type 2. There is no cure forthis type of diabetes at the moment. However, you can control it withmedication and you will also have to follow a strict healthy diet. Ifyou are careful enough with your diet and you also do exercise youshouldn’t need to have any injections.I see. So is there any way to cure it? Is there any medicine for thedisease or do I need the injection? Some of my friends have diabetes tooand they have to take a shot before meals every day. It’s horrible!
M3那我就放心了，那么在饮食上我都需要注意些什么呢？是不是一点甜的都不能吃啊？55
E4You need to eat food that has sugar but does not taste sweet at all,and which releases sugar into your body very slowly. And the “sugar” weare talking about here is not the sugar you use in cooking or put intoyour coffee.I’m relieved to hear that. What do I need to pay attention toregarding my diet? I can’t eat anything sweet, right?
M4那我怎么样才能知道我的血糖指数呢？ 每次都需要来医院检查吗？45
E5Not really, you can check it with a monitor that you can carryaround. It is very easy to use.So how can I find out what my blood sugar level is? Do I need tocome to the hospital to check it every time?
M5我最近总是感觉很累，所以基本上已经不怎么锻炼了，但是我以前经常打兵乓球和羽毛球，您说我是不是应该继续呢?20
E6Yes, of course. These exercises will keep you fit and help youcontrol your diabetes. Just make sure you eat enough food before doingexercise so that your sugar levels wouldn’t get too low.I always feel very tired lately, so basically I don’t do muchexercise. But I used to play ping pong and badminton very often. Do youthink I should take them up again?

entry.title: 甲亢就医
entry.content:
The following is a dialogue between a doctor and a patient withhyperthyroidism. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon Mrs. Wang. What seems to be the problem?10
M1医生，最近我容易发火并且心慌。以前没有过这样的感觉，只是近两个月才有的事。不知道是什么引起的。Doctor, recently I’ve been losing my temper easily and havepalpitations. I’ve never had that kind of feeling before. It juststarted happening in the last two months. I don’t know why.
E2Have you lost any weight recently? Have you been sweating as much asyou usually do? Have you been sleeping okay?21
M2尽管我饭量增加，两个月来，已经瘦了四公斤了。我比以前出汗出得多了，简直无法忍受热的天气。有的时候晚上会失眠，但不是每天都这样。I eat more than usual but I’ve still lost 4 kilograms in the lasttwo months. I sweat more than before as well, and I can’t stand hotweather. Sometimes I have difficulties falling asleep at night but notevery day.
E3Let me examine you. Swallow please. There are some tests you willhave to get done and we will see you in one week. At that time we willstart on some more definite therapy for your condition.36
M3谢谢您，医生。请您告诉我我得了什么病？但愿不是很严重。Thank you, doctor. Please tell me what kind of disease I have. Ihope it is nothing serious.
E4I suspect that you might have hyperthyroidism. We need to arrange atime for you to have some thyroid function tests done.22
M4医生，最坏的结果会是什么？甲状腺出问题可以采用药物治疗吗？我不想做手术。So doctor, what could be the worst scenario? Can thyroid conditionsbe cured by medicine? I don’t want to have an operation
E5I can’t make a diagnosis before getting the test results. But ofcourse, medication such as anti-thyroid drugs is an option. The majordisadvantages of medicinal treatment are the long treatment time and thehigh chance that the disease will reoccur.42
M5我明白了。那药物治疗是不是还有什么副作用？那如果必须做手术，会是什么样的手术呢？肯定会在颈部留下伤疤的吧？I see. Does the drug therapy also cause some side effects? If therehas to be surgery, what kind of surgery will I need to have? It willdefinitely leave a scar on my neck, right?
E6Yes, that’s why we don’t suggest drug therapy. As for surgery, I’mafraid it will leave a scar on your neck. The worst scenario for yourcondition is a subtotal thyroidectomy. But Mrs Wang, don’t worry at thisstage. We will talk about all the options that are open to you after weget the results.57
M6谢谢您，医生。我会先去安排检查的时间，希望没什么大碍。等我拿到结果再来找您。Thanks, doctor. I will go schedule a test first. I hope it’s nothingserious. I’ll come back to you as soon as the results come out.

entry.title: 眼睛测试
entry.content:
Mr. Wang is having an appointment with Dr. Jackman, anophthalmologist, at the public hospital for an eye test. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning. Mr. Wang, isn’t it? I am Dr. Jackman. Follow meplease, and I will check your vision. Is this the first time you havevisited our ophthalmology department?30
M1是的，我是第一次来这里。最近我看东西越来越模糊了，看一会儿眼睛就很酸，而且经常流眼泪。Yes. It’s my first time here. My vision has become more and moreblurred lately. My eyes get very sore after looking at anything for awhile and I have been getting watery eyes.
E2Okay, let’s take a look. Do you wear glasses for reading, driving,or watching TV or have you ever worn contacts?21
M2我没有隐形眼镜。平时一般不戴眼镜，只有看书的时候才戴，看电视也不用戴。医生，我是不是得了什么很严重的眼病呀，是白内障吗？I don’t have contact lenses and I usually don’t need to wear glassesunless I’m reading. I don’t need them for watching TV. Doctor, do I havea serious eye condition? Is it cataracts?
E3We won’t know until we’ve done all the tests. Now, please put onyour glasses and look at the eye chart. If you can’t see it clearly,just blink and look at it again.34
M3我看头两排没有什么问题，但是第三排就比较费劲了，更别说第四排和最后一排了。There’s no problem for me to see the top two lines but the thirdline is a bit difficult for me, let alone the fourth and lastlines.
E4OK. Please let me have your glasses. I need to measure the twolenses and then I’ll return them to you. If you can wait outside –you’ll be called when I’ve finished.34
M4大概要等多久？我还要回去接孩子，买菜做饭呢！还需要做什么别的测试吗？How long do I have to wait? I need to pick up my child, shop forgroceries and prepare dinner. Do I need to take any further tests?
E5It won’t be long as all the work will be done with the assistance ofa computer. After that, we’ll complete the optometry tests with you andcheck your eye pressure.31
M5眼压测试？听起来有点吓人。你能告诉我这个测试具体是怎么做的呢？会很疼吗？Eye pressure test? Sounds a bit scary. Could you please tell me in abit more detail how the test is done? Will it be very painful?
E6You don’t need to be scared. It’s a very easy and safe eyeprocedure. A device blows air into your eye and you just keep your eyeas open as possible.31
M6那好吧。我会尽力配合的。谢谢你医生。All right. I’ll try my best to do as you’ve said. Thank you,doctor.

entry.title: 儿科例检
entry.content:
Mrs. Lin, a Mandarin-speaking woman, has brought her three-month oldson to see Mr. Allen White, a pediatrician, for a routine check-up. * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1早上好，医生。我今天把我的小麦克带来了。请你帮着检查一下。Good morning, doctor. I have brought my little Mike. I would likeyou to have a look at him.
M1Good morning, Mrs. Lin. Nice to see you. Let me see. What a chubbylittle boy! First of all, I need to check his weight and length. If youcould put him down and undress him that would be great.40
E2好的。这是宝宝的健康记录本。我已经做过产后检查了。宝宝上一次体检的时候，那个助产士说一切正常，没什么值得担心的大问题。All right. Here is his health check record. I have done thepostnatal check and the midwife said he was perfect and there wasnothing in particular to worry about at his last examination.
M2I can see from his blue book that he’s got all the immunisationsfrom the GP. That’s excellent to start with. Are you giving him anyformula or vitamins at all?
E3孩子一直都是喝我的奶。别的什么也没吃过。但是，最近我发现他的体重长得慢了。我们有点着急。I’ve been breastfeeding him all the time and we haven’t fed himanything else. But, I’ve found that he’s been slow at gaining weightlately. We are getting a bit worried.
M3At three months of age, babies normally go through a growth spurt.That means they are growing muscles and reducing fat and stop gainingweight for about three weeks.29
E4另外，他现在睡觉也不如以前好了，总是要哭闹好一会儿，而且要我们抱着才能入睡。这正常吗？Also, his sleep is not as good as before. He will cry for quite awhile and can only fall asleep in our arms. Is this normal?
M4Babies also have a sleep cycle change at this age. Now they onlysleep three times during the day for no more than two hours and muchless at night.30
E5我看不少国内的网站说，这个岁数的宝宝应该开始喂辅食了。你觉得现在用得着吗？该吃点什么好呢？I checked some websites in China and they all say a baby of his ageshould be fed supplementary foods. Do you think it’s necessary and whatshould we give him?
M5No, it’s too early for you to do so. It was a practice years ago butnow we’ve learned that babies don’t need to be fed with solid food untilaround six months.33
E6看来中国和澳洲抚养孩子的方法还真的很不一样。那下一次检查时什么时候？我现在能预约吗？It seems that there is a whole lot of difference between Australiaand China when it comes to raising a baby. So when will be the nextcheck-up? Can I book an appointment now?
M6I can book you in for Thursday, the 5th of July, which is in another3 months. But you need to call one week before to confirm.27

entry.title: 入院手续
entry.content:
The following is a dialogue between a nurse and a patient who’s justbeen admitted to hospital. The nurse is taking the patient’s personaldetails and asking about the patient’s general state of health. * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning Jason, my name is Jessica. I’m a registered nurse andI’ll be looking after you today. How are you feeling at the moment?23
M1早上好。我现在感觉还可以。谢谢关心。因为之前没有在澳大利亚住过院，所以感觉有一点紧张。Good morning. I am feeling fine now. Thank you for asking. But I’m abit nervous as it’s my first time to be hospitalised in Australia.
E2Don’t worry. There’s nothing for you to be concerned about. Now,I’ve got a few questions to ask you and some paperwork to go through foryour admission. Shall we start now?31
M2是的。当然！你有什么问题尽管问，还好你们今天请了口译员来，不然我会很担心如何沟通的。Yes,Ofcourse!Pleasegoahead.Iwouldhavebeensoworriedaboutcommunicating with you if you hadn’t hired an interpreter for metoday.
E3No worries. Firstly, I’d like to take your personal details. Yoursurname is Lee, and your given name is Yang, am I correct? Could youtell me your marital status as well?32
M3是对的。不过我可以看一下你怎么拼写我的名字吗？想确认一下。哦，谢谢。是对的。我结婚了，但是太太现在在国内。Yes, that’s right. But can I have a look at how you spelled my name?I just want to make sure. Thanks. That’s correct. I am married, but mywife is in China at the moment.
E4Are you still living at the same address, Unit 16, 38 Adelaide St,Thomas Town? Could you tell me your date of birth and your next of kinin Australia as well as your religion, if you have one?39
M4好的。我还住在这个地址。我出生于 1958 年 11 月 13号。我和我女儿住一起，我信佛教。OK. I am still living at that address. I was born on the 13th ofNovember, 1958. I live here with my daughter and I am Buddhist.
E5Can you give me a few details about your medical history? Have youor any close relatives ever had hypertension, diabetes, asthma, heartdisease, or cancer? Have you had any operations?31
M5我七年前得了高血压，两年前确诊得了糖尿病。我用严格的饮食和锻炼来控制。5年前得了心脏病我做了一次手术。I was diagnosed with hypertension 7 years ago and diabetes 2 yearsago. I am managing these conditions with a strict diet and regularexercises. I had heart surgery 5 years ago.
E6Are you taking any medication? Are you allergic to any drugs orfood? Do you smoke or drink?18
M6我只是在吃一些维生素。到目前为止，我没有任何过敏的药物。我 5年前心脏手术过后就不吸烟了，只是偶尔喝一点红酒。I’m only taking some vitamins and I am not allergic to anymedication. I quit smoking after I had the heart surgery 5 years ago butI do drink some.

entry.title: 反复补牙
entry.content:
A woman is visiting a dentist. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1医生您好，我的牙龈总是出血，口腔还发出一种臭味，这种情况已经差不多一年了。Hello. My gums are always bleeding and I have bad breath. It has beenlike this for almost a year.Hello. My gums are always bleeding and I have bad breath. It hasbeen like this for almost a year.
M1Does the bleeding occur by itself or is it induced by someirritation? That is to say, do your gums bleed when you brush your teethor when you eat or do they bleed for no apparent reason at all?40
E2不知道，我只知道牙龈流血。还有，我后面的牙有个洞，我补的牙里面的填充物掉出来了。所以牙又开始疼了。(I don’t know, I just know that my gums have been bleeding. Also, one ofmy back teeth has a cavity. The filling in it fell out so I have atoothache again.I don’t know, I just know that my gums have been bleeding. Also, oneof my back teeth has a cavity. The filling in it fell out so I have atoothache again.
M2Let me have a look. Please sit in the chair. Lean your head backagainst the chair. It is a deep cavity. We’ll have an x-ray taken ofthat tooth just to make sure about the apex. If it is in good condition,I will treat it.48
E3这颗牙还可以再补吗？如果不能补,我可真的没辙了。近来每天晚上，我都疼得睡不好觉。 (Can it be filledagain? I don’t know what to do if it can’t be filled. I haven’t beensleeping well due to the pain.Can it be filled again? I don’t know what to do if it can’t befilled. I haven’t been sleeping well due to the pain.
M3Yes, it can be filled. I’ll clean it now. Please let me know if ithurts. Bite please. Now please open your mouth again. Do you feelanything abnormal when you clench your teeth?34
E4感觉不舒服，而且我吃冷的或热的东西，牙就疼得更厉害了。晚上的时候疼痛也会加重。即使我有时候吃止痛药，也没多大作用。I’m feeling uncomfortable and the pain gets worse when I eat cold orhot things. And it’s more serious during the night. Even though Isometimes take painkillers, it doesn’t help much.
M4From my observations, I’d say you have inflammation of the gums aswell as pulpitis. We’ll have an x-ray done as soon as possible to seewhether there are any wisdom teeth that need to be extracted.35
E5我之前没有做过牙齿的 X光检查，会疼吗？另外，这个费用能用政府的保健医疗卡报销吗？I’ve never had a dental x-ray before. Does it hurt? By the way, isit covered by Medicare?
M5I’m afraid not. If you have private health insurance, you may beentitled to claim some of the money back. I am not an expert though, youprobably need to consult your private health insurance provider.36
E6我没有私人保险，不过现在申请可定也来不及了，看来这次看牙将会是一笔很大的支出了。不管怎么说，谢谢您医生。I don’t have any private health insurance but it is now too late toapply. It seems that this time this dental problem will cost me a lot.But anyway, thank you, doctor.
M6You’re welcome. I’ll get my secretary to make another appointmentfor you.12

entry.title: 背颈劳损
entry.content:
The following dialogue takes place between a doctor and a Mandarinspeaking patient, regarding a work related injury. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Mrs Li, I’ll start by asking some questions about your background,especially about your work history. I hope you don’t mind. What’s thehighest education you obtained in China and what sorts of jobs did youhave there.38
M1我高中毕业之后考上了一所大专技校，相当于这边的TAFE，我当时学的专业是机械。所以毕业之后就在一个机床零件加工厂工作。I went to a technical junior college after I finished high school.It’s similar to TAFE in Australia. I was studying mechanics so I beganto work at a machine parts processing and manufacturing plant aftergraduating.
E2Can you be more specific? What were your responsibilities in thefactory? For example, was that assembly work or a sales role?22
M2是个零件加工的工作，我也做过销售，但那时后来的事了，大部分的工作都是做流水线。It was for parts processing. I also worked as a salesperson but thatwas some time afterwards. Most of my work was done on the assemblylines.
E3So after you came to Australia, what jobs did you have? I can seefrom your file that you started working in a factory called StarTechnology in 1999.29
M3没错，在那之前只做过一些零零散散的工作，时间太久了，也记不太清楚具体做过什么了。是的，我99年进了那个工厂之后就一直在那工作，直到后来落下脖子疼和背疼的毛病，才不得不辞职。Yes. I only had some casual jobs before working there. But I can’tremember the details as it was a long time ago. Yes, I was working inthat factory since I started in 1999, until I noticed these neck andback problems caused by this job. So I quit.
E4I see. Since you mentioned neck and back pain, we can come to thisfirst. Was there a particular accident that caused your neck and backinjury?27
M4没有出什么事故，但是我长年累月的做一个工作，坐着工作的时间太长，而且经常需要搬很沉的箱子，才落下了这个病。No, there were no accidents. But I have such problems because I hadto keep doing the same work for so many years and I had been sitting forso long. Also, I often had to move heavy boxes.
E5So you were saying that the pain was there a while ago and it hasworsened over time? When did you first go the see your GP about thismatter?30
M5大概两年前吧，当时不知道是不是工伤，但我的家庭医生认为这和我的工作有很大的关系。About two years ago. I wasn’t sure whether it was a work relatedinjury, but my family doctor suggested it was closely related to mywork.
E6I will ask some detailed questions later about your previous job andabout your worker’s compensation claim.17
M6没问题，我有一些书面材料，马上拿给你看。Sure. I have some paperwork that I would like to show you rightaway.

entry.title: 儿童接种
entry.content:
This dialogue is between a parent and an officer from the AustralianChildhood Immunisation Register. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon, I’m Lion Hutton. You said you have some questionsregarding the immunisations that your child received. What can I do foryou today?25
M1我想我儿子已经接受了所有该做的免疫。但是上个星期五我收到这封信说还有其他种类的免疫。我感到有点诧异。I think my son has received all the necessary vaccination shots. ButI was surprised when I received this letter last Friday, saying thereare other kinds of vaccinations needed.
E2How old is your son? Do you have his immunisation record book withyou now? Also, can I have a look at the letter you mentioned?26
M2我儿子上个星期刚满 17个月。是的，我今天把免疫记录本带来了，还有这封信，给您。last week. Yes, I have brought his immunisation record with me todayand this is the letter. Here you are.
E3Let me see. Yes, actually this letter is from the AustralianChildhood Immunisation Register. It automatically sends out reminders toparents when their children are due for immunisation.28
M3但是我儿子已经做过好几种疫苗接种了。我记得第一次是在他出生的时候，以后又接种过两次。所以我认为他不需要再接受免疫了。But my son has already received several vaccines. I remember thefirst shot was given right after he was born and there were two timesafter that. So I don’t think he needs any more vaccinations.
E4You were perfectly right in saying that he has received severalimmunisations. The fact though is that certain types have to be givenmore than once to provide the child with sufficient immunity.33
M4好吧，就算某些疫苗需要接种一次以上，但需要三次吗？小孩子能受得了吗？你不认为这封信寄给我是寄错了吗？Alright, even if some vaccinations have to be given more than once,does it have to be three times? Don’t you think it’s too much for ayoung kid to cope with? Don’t you think the letter was sent to me bymistake?
E5We sometimes send 5 reminders. In most cases, it’s recommended thatimmunisations should be repeated several times. In the case ofdiphtheria, tetanus and whooping cough, the injection is given 5 timesover 5 years.35
M5但是我小的时候都没有接受过这么多次免疫，可你看，我身体这么好，连一般的感冒都不得。But I didn't receive so many vaccinations when I was a kid. But youcan see I am so physically fit and healthy that I rarely catch acold.
E6In the past, the vaccine wasn’t as available as it is now. Besidesthere were many deaths and illnesses in the past that could haveactually been due to a lack of immunisation.33
M6我想你是对的。过去的医生没有合适的办法和仪器来正确诊断疾病。I think you are right as doctors in the past didn’t have propermethods and equipment to give accurate diagnoses.

entry.title: 女儿水痘
entry.content:
This dialogue is between a woman, Mrs. Wang, and her GP, regardingsome rashes on her daughter’s skin. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon Mrs. Wang. This must be your daughter Lucy. How can Ihelp you?15
M1我女儿发烧 37.8度有两天了。她身上和脸上都长了很多小红点儿。但她的食欲很好，睡眠也没问题。您快帮她看看吧。我很担心。My daughter has had a temperature of 37.8 degrees for two days now.There are many red spots over her body and face. But she still has agood appetite and has no sleeping problems. Please have a look at her. Iam so worried.
E2When did you first notice the rashes? Does she feel itchy or haveany pain? I would like to find out some more details.24
M2昨天她从幼儿园回来说她不舒服。当时我看到她胸前有一些粉红色的皮疹。今天早上看到她脸上也起了很多疹子和水泡似的东西。我女儿觉得很痒，昨天晚上都影响她睡觉了。She complained she was not feeling well after coming back fromkindergarten yesterday. I saw some pink rashes on her chest and I foundmany rashes and something like blisters on her face this morning. Shesaid they were so itchy that she didn’t sleep well last night.
E3Let me have a look at Lucy. The rash appears in crops and papules,and there are blisters on the body, extremities and face, looking like’dewdrops’ on a red base. She has chickenpox, which is an infectiousdisease.38
M3水痘？估计是幼儿园有其他的孩子得了水痘，我的女儿被传染了。那会不会留下疤痕啊?要多久能好？我应该怎么在家照顾她啊？Chickenpox? It seems that my daughter contracted chickenpox fromother kids who have it in the kindergarten. Will it leave any scars? Howlong does it take for the disease to be cured? What do I need to do athome to take care of her?
E4The crusts fall off in one to three weeks, leaving no scars. Pleasekeep her away from other children until the crusts fall off completely.Give her plenty of water to drink. Keep her skin clean in order toprevent infection. Don’t let her scratch her skin.47
M4好的，我会的。不过要是特别痒她肯定会不停的抓的。您能给她开些口服药或者药膏吗？我不想我的女儿那么难受。OK. I will. But she will keep scratching if it is too itchy. Couldyou please prescribe some oral medicine or ointment for her? I don’twant to see her suffering.
E5I will give her some lotion and some medicine to control theitching. Lucy should start feeling better after about a week.21
M5好的，谢谢医生。我女儿昨天还和一个小朋友一起玩儿，希望她的朋友不会有什么事。OK. Thank you, doctor. My daughter played with one of her friendsyesterday. I hope she won’t get infected.
E6If the fever persists or the symptoms get worse after a few days,please bring her back to see me again.21
M6我知道了。但愿我不用再过来见您。再见。I understand. I hope this is the last time that I see you for thismatter. Good bye.

entry.title: 楼梯摔伤
entry.content:
The following dialogue takes place between a specialist and apatient, Mrs. Li, who has just broken her hip and arm. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning Mrs. Li. I’m Doctor Clark, an orthopaedic surgeon. Howcan I help you today?16
M1我从楼梯上摔下来，当时顿时觉得左胯部疼得厉害，根本没法自己站起来。现在还是觉得很疼。I felt a sharp pain in my left hip after I fell down the stairs. Icouldn’t stand up by myself. Now it still hurts.
E2When did it happen? Have you taken any painkillers? If not, how didyou manage the pain?17
M2昨天下午发生的。我什么药都没吃，我的家庭医生把我转介到这里的。主要是伤到了我的左胯部还有左臂。It happened yesterday afternoon. I didn’t take any medicine. Myfamily doctor referred me to you. My left hip and left arm wereseriously injured.
E3The x-ray and MRI results show a fracture in your left arm. To makesure the bone heals properly, I suggest you be admitted to the hospital.You need an operation to fix it. Is your left elbow still in pain?41
M3是的。受伤后左胳膊僵硬，发紫发胀。有时候还觉得很麻。什么都做不了,现在只能先在家。而且就算什么都不做，伤处都会疼。Yes. I felt stiffness in my left arm and it was swollen and turnedblue. Sometimes I feel numbness. I’m not able to do anything now andhave to stay at home for the time being. The injured parts are still inpain even when I stay still.
E4We will give you an “L” type plaster cast on your elbow andshoulder. You will have to have it for about six weeks.24
M4除了带石膏托外，我还需要注意什么吗？这是我第一次受这么严重的伤。Apart from wearing the plaster cast, what else do I need to payattention to? It’s the first time that I’ve gotten injured sobadly.
E5When you rest in bed, please keep your elbow higher than your heart.Move your finger joints from time to time. Keep an eye on the colour ofyour fingers. If you have pain and numbness or if the colour of thefingers turns paler or darker, please come back to see me straightaway.55
M5好的，我知道一旦伤到骨头就很麻烦，需要很长时间才能恢复。我还想麻烦您一件事，我以前从来没住过院，您能不能帮我给医院打个电话，联系住院的事，或者让他们帮我安排一个翻译？Alright. I know that if you have broken bones it is a big hassle andwill take a long time to heal. I would like to ask you to do me anotherfavour. I’ve never been admitted to hospital before so could you pleasecall the hospital to make the necessary arrangements for me or ask themto hire an interpreter for me?
E6No worries Mrs. Li. I’ll send the results back to your family doctorand either your GP or I will ring the hospital for you. I believe thehospital has an interpreting service available.35
M6多谢您了，大夫。Thank you, doctor.

entry.title: 工伤复查
entry.content:
A doctor is interviewing a patient, Mr. Xue, about an injury hereceived as a result of a work accident. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning Mr. Xue. Thanks for coming. I will ask you somequestions about the accident and then we will examine your eyes. How isyour right eye?28
M1感觉涩涩的。不舒服。您刚才一开灯我的右眼就感觉到疼痛。我现在对强光特别敏感。It’s dry and it feels uncomfortable. My right eye started to hurt assoon as you turned on the light. I am now especially sensitive to brightlight.
E2I understand. From the file I can see that you were a gyprocker andyou got injured on the 18th of March this year while you were working.Is that right?31
M2对。我当时正在一块金属板上钻洞突然间就感觉到一个很尖的东西飞进了眼睛里。可能是金属碎屑。我疼痛难忍我的同事马上送我去了医院。Yes. I was drilling holes on a metal sheet and suddenly somethingvery sharp got into my eye. It could have been a piece of metal. Thepain was killing me and my co-workers immediately took me to thehospital.
E3According to the file here, you stayed in the hospital for about twoweeks. You had two operations after the injury. Have you gone back tothe hospital or the specialist since you were discharged from thehospital? Are you on any medication now?44
M3出院后我还没有回过医院也没有去看过眼科医生。但是医生要我九月份的时候回去进行复查。I haven’t gone back to the hospital or seen an ophthalmologist afterbeing discharged. But the doctor asked me to see him again inSeptember.
E4I see. I will have a look at your right eye in a second. Before wedo so, can you please tell me all your concerns about your right eye andhow it affects your daily life?37
M4如果看到强光，眼睛就会疼，最主要的问题就是我看东西都是重影的，看东西都很模糊。眼睛有问题对我的生活有很大的影响。It’s painful whenever I see bright light and the main problem is Ihave double and blurred vision. This eye problem has caused me a lot oftrouble in my daily life.
E5Can you give some examples, like what things you were able to do butcan no longer do since the injury?19
M5我现在已经不能再回到原来的地方工作了，而且也不能开车，害怕出危险。两只眼睛经常涩涩的，还经常发红。I can’t go back to my previous job anymore and I’m not able to driveanymore because I am afraid of having a car accident. My eyes are oftendry and they often turn red.
E6Thanks Mr. Xue. Please follow me to another room and I’ll examineyour eyes. We should be finished very soon.20
M6好的，谢谢你，医生。Alright. Thanks Doctor.

entry.title: 戒酒失败
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Zhong, a recovering alcoholic, and Mr.James, a social worker, about the progress of Mr. Zhong’s recovery. * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Hello, Mr. Zhong. Thanks for coming in today. I’d like to have achat with you and see how you are doing these days.
M1你好，James先生。老实说，我最近又开始喝酒了，我妻子因此很伤心，她不想看到我做出了这么大的努力最后还是失败。Hello, Mr James. To be honest, I’ve started drinking again recently.My wife is very sad about it. She doesn’t want to see me fail after allthe effort I’ve put in.
E2I see. A little setback is inevitable. In the initial stages, youshould set a more realistic goal, say, not drinking for at least threedays per week.
M2我也知道要一步一步来，但我越不让自己喝越是想喝。而且我清醒的时候感觉很空虚害怕，醉了反而舒服。I know I need to take one step at a time, but the harder I try tostop myself from drinking, the stronger my cravings become. Also, I feelempty and afraid when I’m sober, but comfortable when I’m drunk.
E3Those are called withdrawal symptoms. It’s because you are dependenton alcohol, both physically and psychologically. To reduce yourdependence, you need to stay away from alcohol and your old drinkingbuddies as much as possible.
M3这点我深有体会。几个老朋友上星期他们硬要拉我去喝酒，结果我们喝了个通宵。我不能一直这样下去。I can totally relate to that. Several old friends insisted on havinga drink with me last week, and we ended up drinking the whole night. Ican’t keep doing this.
E4I’m glad you’ve realised the importance of a positive environmentfor your recovery. That’s why you need a strong support group that helpsand encourages you throughout the process.29
M4我知道。可是我内心深处还是很不安，我的生活一团糟，看不到希望，我总觉得自己是个受害者。I understand. But I still feel uneasy deep down. My life is a messand I can’t see any hope. I often feel like I’m a victim.
E5Well, self-pity is likely to lead you back into drinking again. Whynot see things in a different way? You are taking steps to regaincontrol of your life. That’s very brave.32
M5对呀，我应该乐观一点的。人们常说，态度决定一切。我要试着改变自己的态度。That’s right. I should be more optimistic. People often say thatattitude is everything. I’ll try to change my attitude.
E6That’s the spirit! Remember you are not in this alone. Give us acall or come back anytime when you need support.22
M6太谢谢了。我会尽自己的努力让生活重回正轨的。Thank you so much. I’ll do my best to get my life back ontrack.

entry.title: 裁员社保
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between James (J), a Centrelink Officer, and MrLiang (L). Mr Liang is enquiring about his eligibility for a Low IncomeHealth Care Card. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1不好意思啊，先生！我迟到了几分钟。是巴士晚点了，真的很抱歉。I am very sorry sir. I’m a few minutes late. The bus was late, I amreally sorry.
M1No worries Mr. Liang. My name is James Morris. How may I help youtoday?15
E2最近我们公司需要缩减开支，必须要裁员，我也是其中之一。所以我来这看看有什么福利我可以申请。Recently, my employer needed to reduce his expenses and had to makesome staff redundant, and I was made redundant. That’s why I’m here tosee what sorts of benefits I can apply for.
M2You may be eligible for the “New Start Allowance” and a “Low IncomeHealth Care Card”. Are you still engaged in any sort of employment, forexample, working part-time or working as a casual employee?35
E3有呀。我仍然在我朋友的餐馆做服务员。每周工作三天。虽然薪水不算好，不过，好就好在它可以包午餐和晚餐。Yes, I’m working in my friend’s restaurant as a waiter. I work 3days a week. The pay is not that good but the good thing is that lunchand dinner are provided.
M3In this case, I’m afraid that you can only apply for the latter one,which is the “Low Income Health Care Card”. It gives low-income earnersaccess to cheaper prescription medicines, and various concessions fromgovernment and private organisations.40
E4听起来不错。那我该怎么申请这张卡呢？我身体不大好，所以总是要去看医生、买药什么的。如果有了这张卡，一定会帮到我很多的。It sounds great. How can I apply for this card? I have some healthissues so I always need to see a doctor and buy medication. It will helpme a lot if I have this card.
M4You may be eligible for the card if you meet the income test. For asingle person, your weekly income must not exceed $497 or $3,976 in 8weeks.39
E5我的收入肯定没有这个数！我还有个问题，这个卡是跟政府的保健医疗卡一样，有五年的有效期吗？My income is definitely less than that. I have one more question, isthis card valid for 5 years, just like the Medicare card?
M5Mr Liang, you need to renew this card every 6 months and every timeyou are required to show evidence in order to qualify for it.26
E6什么，这么麻烦？那我都需要带什么材料呢？我能用我的工资单和银行对账单作为证明材料吗？你这儿有申请表吗？What? That’s a real hassle! So what should I bring? Can I use mypayslips and bank statements as evidence? Do you have the applicationform here?
M6Yes, that’s fine. I can give you a copy of the application form,just a second.16

entry.title: 社福拒保
entry.content:
This dialogue is between a Centrelink officer and Mr. Jiang, whoseapplication for a Centrelink payment has just been refused. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Morning，Mr Jiang. We are here to discuss the benefit that youapplied for. I am afraid the payment you applied for cannot beapproved.
M1为什么啊？我现在经济很拮据，所以我很需要这笔家庭补助，我的条件不是都符合吗？为什么拿不到补助呢？Why? I am now experiencing financial hardship so I really need thispayment. Don’t I meet all the requirements? Why can’t I get it?
E2Mr. Jiang, as the guidelines indicate, in order to be granted thebenefit, you are subject to both an income test and an assets test. Youcannot be eligible for the benefit unless you pass both of them.
M2我现在失业，我妻子自从生完孩子会就因为身体原因无法上班，我们现在没有其他经济来源，连房子都是租的，这还不够条件吗？I don’t have a job now and my wife can no longer go to work becauseof her physical condition after giving birth. We don’t have any othersource of income and we live in a rented place. Isn’t that enough for usto be eligible?
E3Mr. Jiang, I understand that you are in financial difficulty, whichis in line with the result of our investigation. Basically, you havepassed the income test but problems occurred when it came to the assetstest.
M3资产测试不就是检查我们名下的资产状况吗？我们现在基本没什么资产，银行就剩那点存款了，你们完全可以去查。另外，我们也没有任何房产，现在的房子都是租的，我也提供了租赁合同不是吗？The asset test is to assess the assets under our names, right? Wedon’t have many assets except for our small savings in the bank. You cango and check it. Apart from that, we don’t have any properties and we’rerenting the place we live in. I have provided the lease, haven’t I?
E4Mr. Jiang, our officers have investigated your assets thoroughly andit was found out that you did not report your assets truthfully. Yoursavings and lease are fine. However, it seems that you did not provide aproper account in terms of property possession.
M4我的资产都在这了，除了房子，我们也没有任何的股票证券之类的投资，总之我们就是一穷二白啊，我们应该享受社会福利啊。My assets are all here. Except the house, we don’t have any otherinvestment like stocks and securities. We are very poor and I think weare entitled to the social welfare benefits.
E5Even though you do not have property yourself, you may be able toinherit a house from one of your distant relatives with no heirs orfamily, which you didn’t inform us about. In this case, it can beconsidered as intentionally providing misleading or false informationfor financial benefit.
M5我不是故意的啊，的确是有这么回事，但谁知道以后会怎么样啊，我当时就想，万一写上这一点，会影响我的测试结果，所以就没写。I didn’t mean to do so. That’s true but no one knows what willhappen later. I thought if I put it in my application, it would affectthe test results, so I didn’t.
E6Mr. Jiang, you are obliged to provide truthful information toCentrelink. Otherwise, you are committing an offence and you can make usdoubt the overall credibility of your documents, thus severely affectingyour eligibility for the benefit.
M6我知道了，我真的不是故意的，我发誓，以后一定如实报告一切情况，绝不遗漏。I see. I didn’t do it on purpose, I swear. I will report everythingtruthfully next time with no information missing.

entry.title: 丧妻社福
entry.content:
The following dialogue is between Mr. Hu and Larry, a Centrelinkcustomer service officer. Mr. Hu has recently lost his wife. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning Mr. Hu. Please come in and have a seat. Now, how can Ihelp you today?17
M1我的妻子最近因为乳腺癌去世了。我的朋友建议我来这里咨询一下，看看能否获得什么帮助。My wife passed away of breast cancer recently. My friend recommendedthat I come here and make an enquiry about what kind of help I can getfrom you.
E2I’m very sorry for your loss, Mr. Hu. Are you receiving any incomesupport payments at the moment? If not, you may be entitled to aBereavement Allowance.29
M2没有，我一直都在工作，开大巴，虽然工资不高，但还比较稳定。我妻子在世的时候有领疾病津贴，因为她身患癌症不能工作。No. I have been working the whole time as a coach driver. The pay isnot high but it’s stable. My wife was receiving a Sickness Allowancebefore she died because she was diagnosed with cancer and was unable towork.
E3In that case, you should be eligible for the allowance but theamount you can get depends on your assets and income. I’m sure you havegone through these kinds of tests before.33
M3是的，但我只知道你们需要评估我的资产。但我还是有些疑问。比如，哪些资产是需要被评估的？我有一处投资的房产，这要算在内吗？Yes, but I only knew that you would assess my assets. I still havesome questions. For example, which assets should be included in thisassessment? I have an investment property. Does it need to beincluded?
E4Yes, we need to assess the value of your assets, which includes anymoney you have, any real estate you own other than your principle homeand any motor vehicles you own. You can find the complete list on thisfact sheet.42
M4那收入测试是怎样的呢？我现在一周大概能挣个六百来块钱。我在银行还有五万元的定期存款，每年能有大概三千元的利息。您觉得我满足收入测试的要求吗？How does the income test work? I earn about 600 dollars a week nowand I have a 50,000-dollar term deposit in the bank and it yields about3,000 dollars annually. Do I meet the requirements of the incometest?
E5Well, I can’t give you a definite answer right now before the testis done. However, if your fortnightly income is less than $1647.60 youmay be eligible for a part pension.32
M5其实钱有多少我无所谓。最大的痛苦是以后的人生我只能一个人度过了。我不知道我能否忍受这样的孤独。我要是跟我妻子一起去另一个世界就好了。In fact, it doesn’t matter how much I can get. The most painfulthing is that I have to live alone for the rest of my life. I don’t knowif I can stand such loneliness. I wish I could have gone with mywife.
E6You really have my sympathy Mr. Hu. I understand this is a reallytough time for you. We can refer you to an expert grievance counselloror other such services. I’m sure they can help you get through allthis.40
M6好的，非常感谢你的热心帮助。等我准备好材料再来见你。Ok. Thank you for your kind help. I will come back to see you when Ihave the documents ready.

entry.title: 公司福利
entry.content:
The dialogue between Mrs. Li and Hector resumes after Hector finishestalking with his supervisor. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Sorry for keeping you waiting Mrs. Li. Let’s get back to business.We were talking about…16
M1你说我也许还能获得其他的福利，比如药品，房租什么的。You said I may be eligible for other welfare benefits as well, suchas something for medicine or rent.
E2Right. Normally Sickness Allowance recipients are entitled to otherpayments. First is the Pharmaceutical Allowance, which helps you withthe cost of prescription medicines. The fortnightly payment is $3.10 foreach person.32
M2这也太少了吧，还不够我买盒止痛药呢。不管了，聊胜于无吧。那你说的租房补助呢？That’s not even enough for me to buy a pack of painkillers. Nevermind, it’s better than nothing. What about rent assistance?
E3Given you are over 25, with no dependent children and are going toreceive the Sickness Allowance, you can receive rent assistance as longas you are not renting public accommodation.33
M3这太好了，我是和私人房东签的租约，房租每周 400块。你说我现在没有孩子，所以可以领租房补贴，那我生了孩子之后是不是就领不了了？That’s great. I signed the lease with a private landlord and therent is 400 dollars per week. You said that I am eligible for rentassistance because I don’t have any kids. Will I still be able toreceive it after I give birth to my child?
E4That’s not the case. Normally, if you have a dependent child and getmore than the base rate of the Family Tax Benefit, you can still keepreceiving the money. So don’t worry too much, Mrs Li.37
M4是这样啊。我记得你说过我还可以获得电话费补助的。我家没有固话，只有手机，这包含在内吗？Oh, I see. I remember you also mentioned that I can get a telephoneallowance. But I don’t have a fixed line at home, I only have a mobilephone. Does that count?
E5Let me check. Oh, sorry, I’m afraid you are not entitled to theallowance because only Sickness Allowance recipients who are over 60 canreceive a telephone allowance.28
M5哦，没关系。虽然每笔福利的数额并不大，但加在一起还是挺可观的。确实能解我们的燃眉之急。Well, no worries. Each payment is not much but they’ll add up to asizeable sum of money. It will definitely help solve our immediateproblems.
E6Now, I’m going to get all the forms you need. Just fill them out andbring them back with all the supporting documents to make a claim.27
M6非常感谢你的耐心帮助。等我丈夫伤好了，我会让他来当面感谢你的。Thank you for your patience and help. I will ask my husband to comeand thank you in person when he recovers from his injuries.

entry.title: 疾病津贴
entry.content:
The following dialogue is between Mrs. Lu and Henry, a Centrelinkofficer. Mrs. Lu is enquiring about rent assistance. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Hello, Mrs. Li. I’m going to be looking after you today. How areyou?14
M1谢谢你关心。我要是能回答“我很好”的话那就好了。不过话说回来，我要是很好的话，我就不用到这儿来了。Thanks for caring, but I wish I could tell you “I’m fine”. Butanyway, I wouldn’t be here if I was.
E2I’m sorry to hear that. All right, now, can you tell me whathappened, so I can figure out how I may assist you?24
M2我的丈夫上周外出购物时被一辆车撞了，一条腿骨折。因为他一个叉车司机，这下至少好几个月不能上班。可是，他是我们家的主要收入来源。My husband was hit by a car when he went out shopping last week andhis leg was broken. He is a fork-lift driver so he won’t be able to workfor at least several months. But, he is the main source of income in ourfamily.
E3In this case we may be able to help you with the Sickness Allowance,which assists you if you are employed, including if you are self-employed, or if you are temporarily unable to work because of a medicalcondition.39
M3那可是雪中送炭。因为我丈夫只有 10天的带薪病假，而我则是偶尔做做保姆挣一点钱。要是没这笔津贴，家里就要入不敷出了。That would be very timely help for us. My husband only has 10 daysof paid sick leave and I’m only doing some nursing work occasionally tomake some extra money. Without this payment, we’d have great difficultymaking ends meet.
E4Please be aware that your husband will need to get his doctor tofill out a medical certificate, preferably a Centrelink medicalcertificate, which confirms he is medically unfit for his usualwork.33
M4这个没问题。那我们可以领取多少疾病津贴呢？是你们一批准我的申请，我就可以开始领取吗？No problem. How much money can we get under the Sickness Allowance?Will I get paid immediately as soon as my application is approved byyou?
E5The amount of money you get under the Sickness Allowance depends onboth you and your husband's income and assets. The maximum fortnightlyamount you can get is $439.40 each. You are not usually paid for thefirst 7 days that you are eligible for the Sickness Allowance.48
M5除了疾病津贴，我们是否能够领取其他津贴呢？我最近刚刚怀孕了，我们也打算给宝宝攒点钱呢。Are we eligible for other benefits, apart from the sicknessallowance? I just got pregnant and we are planning to save some moneyfor the baby as well.
E6If you qualify for the Sickness Allowance you may be entitled toother payments and benefits, such as a pharmaceutical allowance, rentassistance and telephone allowance. Excuse me for a moment, mysupervisor wants to talk to me.38
M6好的，不急。我先在这里看一下这些中文的小册子。All right. Take your time. I will go through some brochures inChinese here first.

entry.title: 涨租社福
entry.content:
The following dialogue is between Mrs. Lu and Henry, a Centrelinkofficer. Mrs. Lu is enquiring about rent assistance. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Hello, Mrs. Lu. My name is Henry. How have things beenrecently?12
M1说实话，糟透了。我之前找到一份清洁的兼职，所以你们减少了我的失业金。现在他们不需要我了，你们是否能将失业金调高？To be honest, things couldn’t be worse. I found a part-time cleaningjob, so you lowered my payment. Now they don’t want me anymore, so canyou now increase the payment again?
E2After we have re-assessed your income we’ll decide whether yourpayment should be increased. Just fill out this form and it should bedone within three working days.28
M2还有一件事,我想看看你们是否还能帮我什么。上周房东通知我要涨房租了。要是你们不帮我，我就要无家可归了。One more thing, I want to see what else you can help me with. Lastweek the landlord said he would raise the rent. I will be homeless ifyou don’t help me.
E3I think our rent assistance may offer you a lot of help in yourcurrent dilemma. You are getting more than the base rate of Family TaxBenefit and you’re over 25 years old. Is your landlord a privateone?40
M3是的，是我通过一家房产中介找到他的。我已经在那儿住了两年。我也试过申请公租房，但没申请到。你为什么问这个？Yes, I found him through a property agent. I have been living therefor two years. I tried to apply for public housing, but in the end Ididn’t get it. Why do you ask?
E4Rent Assistance is generally not payable if you have a lease with astate or territory housing authority or if you own or are buying thehome in which you live, except for mobile and relocatable homes.39
M4我要是有自己的房子就好了。你们会付给我多少租房补助呢？希望不是杯水车薪。I wish I had my own property. How much will you pay me in rentassistance? I hope it’s not an insignificant amount.
E5You are single, aren’t you? If your fortnightly rent is more than$265.40, you can receive the maximum payment of rent assistance which is$119.40 per fortnight.27
M5我只是租了整栋房其中的一间，所以我没有正式的租约，在这种情况下我应该如何证明我交的房租是多少呢？I am only renting one room in that house, so I didn’t sign anyformal lease. Under such circumstances, how can I prove how much rent Iam paying?
E6You need to complete a Rent Certificate and the person you pay rentto will need to sign it. When we’ve got the certificate we’ll calculatehow much you can get.31
M6那好，我明白了，非常感谢。Ok, I see. Thank you very much.

entry.title: 丧亲社福
entry.content:
The following dialogue is between Mr. Guan and Adam, a Centrelinkofficer. Mr. Guan is taking care of his nephew who has just lost bothparents. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon, Mr. Guan. You said on the phone that you were in avery difficult situation. Can you tell me what happened?22
M1我是为我的侄子 Andrew而来。他的父母，也就是我的弟弟和弟媳，两周前在一场惨烈的车祸中丧生了。所以我来看看是否能从这儿获得一些帮助，来帮我们度过难关。I came here for my nephew, Andrew. His parents, who are my brotherand sister-in-law, passed away in a horrible car accident two weeks ago.So I’m here to see whether I can get some assistance from you to help usmanage a little better.
E2I’m very sorry to hear that. I hope Andrew is coping well. Sounfortunately, he is an orphan now. Is he living with your family? Doeshe have other relatives in Australia?33
M2对，他现在住在我们家。除了我们，他仅有的亲戚就是爷爷奶奶，外公外婆。但他们都不住在澳大利亚，而且很年迈了，不能照顾他。所以我是他的监护人。Yes, he lives with us. The only relatives he has besides us are hisgrandparents. But they are all living overseas and too old to look afterhim. So I am his guardian.
E3Well, as a relative caring for the child, you may be eligible to getvarious types of assistance from the Family Assistance Office and theChild Support Agency, in addition to assistance provided byCentrelink.35
M3也就是说，一般父母能够获得的补助，我都能获得是吗？我现在在领家庭税务福利A，每两周能领 214 刀。对于 Andrew，我也可以领取同样的一份津贴吗？That is to say I can receive all the benefits that parents normallyget, right? I’m receiving the family tax benefit A and receiving $214per week. Can I receive one more payment the same for Andrew?
E4Yes, you are eligible for another payment of the Family Tax BenefitPart A but the amount may be different since it depends on the child’sage.26
M4Andrew 才 5岁，白天一直需要人来照顾。但我和我妻子都要上班，所以必须要把 Andrew交给别人照看。你们能在这方面帮我吗？Andrew is only 5 and he needs to be taken care of during the day.But my wife and I both have to work, so we have to find someone else tolook after him. Can you help us with that?
E5Yes, we can help you with our Childcare Benefit, which is availablefor children who are looked after by approved or registered childcarecentres. It can be claimed as reduced childcare fees or as a lump sumpayment.38
M5这太好了。Andrew真是一个可怜的孩子，我想尽力给他营造一个好的成长环境。幸亏有你们的帮助，不然这是不可能的。That’s great. Andrew is a poor child. I want to try my best to offerhim a good environment to grow up in. However, I wouldn’t be able to dothat without your help.
E6Supporting people in need is what we do. By the way, I think you arealso eligible for the Double Orphan Pension, since both of Andrew’sparents are deceased.29
M6好的，谢谢。那我马上就填表申请吧。要是有什么问题我再来问你。Great, thanks. Then I’ll fill out the application form right away.I’ll get back to you if I have more questions.

entry.title: 失业社福
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. Liu (L), who is recently unemployed,and a Centrelink officer Harry (H). The dialogue begins now. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning Mr. Liu. I’m Harry, your customer service advisor. Howcan I help you today?16
M1我工作的工厂最近倒闭了，所以我失业了。因为劳动成本的原因，制造业在这个国家正在消亡。所以我来请你们帮助我。Good Morning, Harry. The factory I worked for was closed downrecently so I’ve lost my job. The manufacturing industry is dying inthis country because of rising labour costs.
E2Well, if that’s the case, I think we may be able to help you throughthis with the Newstart Allowance. But firstly, I need to determinewhether you’re eligible for the allowance. Can I have a look at your IDplease?41
M2给你，这是我的驾照。我从来没想到我会来求你们施舍。这种感觉真不好。This is my driver’s license. Here you are. I never thought I wouldcome to you asking for charity. I feel terrible about it.
E3Please don’t think about it that way. It is our responsibility tohelp people get through difficult times. You meet the age requirement soyou’ll need to enter into an Employment Pathway Plan.33
M3你能给我解释一下这个计划吗？是说只要我加入了这个计划，你们就能帮我找到工作吗？它需要我去做什么呢？Can you explain this plan to me? Are you saying that you will find ajob for me if I join this plan? What does it require me to do?
E4An Employment Pathway Plan explains what you need to do to get a jobor improve your employment prospects and what assistance you will beoffered. The plan may contain activities such as job searching,vocational education and participation in a labour market program.44
M4所以，这个计划是由你们制定的，然后要求我严格遵行吗？如果我觉得某些活动不适合我怎么办？这样听起来似乎是你们想控制我的生活。So is it true that this plan is made by you, and then I need tofollow it strictly? What if I think some activities are not suitable forme? It sounds like you will control my life.
E5That’s not how it works. We’ll negotiate with you to identify yourindividual needs but once we have both agreed on the plan you’ll have toparticipate in the activities. Otherwise, there will be a ‘No Show, NoPay’ penalty.40
M5既然是根据我的个人需求制定的计划，我肯定会欣然执行。我会珍惜一切机会来提高我找到工作的可能性。As long as it’s based on my personal needs, then I will definitelybe happy to abide by it. I would appreciate every opportunity to improvemy chances of getting employed.
E6Excellent. Please be aware that you need to regularly send usevidence that you are actively looking for suitable paid work and attendall job interviews.26
M6好的，我知道了。你能跟我说一下津贴的数额有多少？我如果偶尔做一些临时工，会不会影响我领取福利金？Alright, I see. Can you tell me how much the allowance is? If Ioccasionally do some casual work, will it affect my payment?

entry.title: 盗版光盘
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr Philip, an officer from Customs andBorder Protection and Mr. Lin, an Australian Citizen who just came backfrom a recent trip to China and has now arrived at Sydney InternationalAirport. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Excuse me, sir. Can I see your passport and your Incoming PassengerCard please?
M1怎么了?我没带什么不合法的东西，缉毒犬也已经过来闻过一遍了，没有任何特殊的反应。你们为什么把我拦下？What happened? I don’t have anything illegal with me and a snifferdog has already checked around and it did not show any particularreactions. Why have you you stopped me?
E2The X-ray shows there may be some undeclared prohibited items inyour baggage. If you are caught carrying undeclared, prohibited orrestricted goods, you could be fined or prosecuted. Do youunderstand?
M2我既没有走私，也没带任何的违禁品。不过，您看我的行李都捆绑好了，要是把东西都拿出来再放回去是很费劲的。你们海关就是小题大做，专找我们亚洲人的麻烦。I’m neither smuggling, nor carrying any contraband. You see myluggage has been strapped up. It will be very troublesome if I have totake everything out and put it back in again. You Customs officers arejust making a fuss about everything and picking on us Asians.
E3Do you know there are certain restricted goods you need to declareon arrival, such as firearms, weapons and ammunition, and currency ofAUD$10,000 or over? Do any of those apply to you? Besides, if you arecarrying certain kinds of medicines and substances, food, biologicalgoods, or wildlife products etc, you must declare them.
M3这样啊。我就带了一些土特产给我父亲，他说他很想家，很怀念家乡的味道。另外还有一些光碟是给我母亲的。你把我拦下来，是因为怀疑这些光碟是盗版的吗？I see. I only brought some local specialties for my father, becausehe said he was homesick and missing the local flavours of our hometown.Apart from that, there are some DVDs for my mother. Are you suspectingthe DVDs are pirated? Is that why you stopped me here?
E4It is a normal practice for customs to run random luggage checks.Those DVDs have to be forfeited as they appear to be counterfeit. Sodoes the local special produce that you have, since they are meatproducts. What is in those paper bags? Can you please open them?
M4那好吧，反正也不值什么钱。纸袋里没什么违禁的东西，就是一点草药。我妈有慢性支气管炎，西药不管用，只治标不治本。所以我就在国内的中药店抓了一点草药给她。Alright. Those DVDs are not worth much. There is nothing illicit inthose bags, just some herbs. My mom has chronic bronchitis, but westernmedicine doesn’t seem to be working for her. It only relieves thesymptoms but does not cure the disease completely. So I bought someherbs for her at a pharmacy when I was in China.
E5You should have declared that traditional medicine on your IncomingPassenger Card, because they may contain endangered plant or animalproducts. I’m sorry, but that medicine also needs to be forfeited.
M5请不要这样。她需要这些药来治病的。您这不是要她的命吗？如果我交罚款,你是不是就不会没收这些药了？Please don’t do that. They are very important for her treatment.Only if you want to kill her. Can I keep the medicine if I choose to paya fine?
E6I don’t think so. It is advisable that you take her prescriptions toan Australian medical practitioner. I’m sure Chinese medicinepractitioners here can help her with this matter.
M6随便你吧，看来也只能自认倒霉了。Whatever… it seems I have to accept this as bad luck.

entry.title: 就业赞助
entry.content:
A lady is talking to a shop manager, asking about the possibility ofemployment sponsorship. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1你好，你是这家按摩店的经理吗？我是 Lisa.Hello,areyouthemanagerofthismassageshop?MynameisLisa.
M1Yes I am. How are you? How can I help you, Lisa?
E2我是一名按摩师，在中国有将近 10年的工作经验。听说你这儿在招聘，所以我过来试一试运气。I’m a masseuse with nearly 10 years work experience in China. Iheard that you are hiring, so I’m here to try my luck.
M2Yes, currently we are short of experienced staff. I believe youunderstand that one requirement for this position is being able tocommunicate with clients.
E3当然了。我正在上英语课，也达到了一定的水平。但为了保证今天和你沟通的质量，我觉得还是通过口译员比较好。Of course. I’m taking an English course and have made some progress.But I thought I’d better speak to you via an interpreter to maintainsmooth communication.
M3That’s fine. You will have to be familiar with the terminologyrelated to remedial massage and aware of the specific needs of ourclients. They’ll be more willing to come back if you can go the extramile.
E4我明白。我之前一直在做按摩，所以我深知客人的不同需求。我现在非常想在这里定居。我真的不适合呆在大城市，我喜欢小镇的宁静与安逸。I understand. I’ve been doing this for a while so I know about thevarying demands of customers. Now, I’d like to settle down here. I’mreally not a big city person. I prefer peaceful and cozy smalltowns
M4Well, I suppose you’re interested in the Regional SponsoredMigration Scheme. I heard of this at a massage association meeting. Theysaid under this scheme, qualified massage therapists can migrate herepermanently.
E5是的，我之前也去中介咨询过。他们说我必须有这里的学历，所以我就去一家学院学了一个证书，并通过了这里的技术评估。Yes, I consulted an agent before, who said I had to have a localqualification. So I got a certificate at an institute and passed theskill assessment.
M5If we are to sponsor you, it will involve a financial commitment onour part as well as the time needed to prepare the application. Wereally need some time to consider it.
E6我完全理解。这样，我把我的简历给你，上面有我的联系方式，你们随时可以联系我。我也可以先工作，担保的是我们慢慢来。I totally understand. Let me give you my resume first, which has mycontact details. You can contact me anytime. I can also start workingfirst and discuss the issue of sponsorship later.
M6That would be perfect. Thank you very much. I’ll be in touch withyou.

entry.title: 亲戚移民
entry.content:
The following dialogue is between Mr. Li and Herbert, a migrationagent. Mr. Li is seeking advice on sponsoring an overseas relative tocome to Australia to work. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Hello Mr. Li, you said to me last time that you wanted to sponsoroverseas workers to come here, right?
M1是的。我在悉尼拥有一家食品加工厂，生产各种中式点心。我希望我的侄子能来澳洲帮我做事。Yes. I own a food processing factory in Sydney, producing variouskinds of Chinese dim sims. I hope my nephew can come here and work forme.
E2Both the employer and the employee need to meet certain requirementsto be eligible for the employer nomination scheme. As the employer, youmust be actively and lawfully operating a business in Australia.
M2这个肯定没问题，我这个厂已经开了快 10年了。我的产品非常受欢迎，你在各个华人超市都能买到。我的年营业额有四百多万呢。This is not a problem at all. I’ve been operating the factory foralmost 10 years. My products are very popular and you can find them inevery Chinese supermarket. The annual turnover is more than $4million.
E3Then the position you provide must be full time, ongoing andavailable for at least three years. It must also be a highly skilledoccupation that is on the Employer Nomination Scheme Occupation List(ENSOL).
M3这份清单是什么？我没听说过。我给我侄子安排的职位是食品技术员，您能帮我查查这个职位是否在这份清单上吗？What’s this list? I have never heard of it. The position I’m goingto offer my nephew is food technologist. Could you check for me and seeif it’s on the list?What’s this list? I have never heard of it. Theposition I’m going to offer my nephew is food technologist. Could youcheck for me and see if it’s on the list?
E4You can only nominate overseas workers to fill a position in anoccupation that appears on the ENSOL. Let me have a look. Well, foodtechnologist is on the list. That’s very good!
M4那我的侄子需要满足哪些条件呢？他在国内大学学的就是食品科技，毕业后至今已经有了五年的相关工作经验。在技术与资质方面他应该是没问题的。What requirements does my nephew need to meet? He studied foodtechnology at university in China and has five years’ relevant workingexperience after graduation. There shouldn’t be any problems in terms ofhis skills and qualifications.
E5That seems good enough. You should also be aware that he needs tomeet the vocational English language requirements. That is to say, heneeds to score 5 in each of the four sections of the IELTS test.
M5我不太了解他的英语水平。不过雅思 5分对于他这样一个读过大学的人来说应该不是什么难事吧。I’m not sure about his English level. However, for a universitygraduate, scoring 5 in the IELTS test should not be very difficult, Ireckon.
E6Other requirements are more general. For example, your nephew needsto show evidence of good health and character and sign the AustralianValues Statement.
M6多谢你啦，让我有了一个大致的概念。看来这并没有我想像的困难。Thank you for giving me a rough idea. It seems like it’s not asdifficult as I thought it would be.

entry.title: 母亲移民
entry.content:
The following dialogue is between Mr. Lu, a new migrant, and Henry,an immigration officer. Mr. Lu is seeking advice regarding bringing hismother to live in Australia. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Sorry for keeping you waiting for so long. How can I help youtoday?
M1我希望你可以帮到我。我想要一些资讯关于我的母亲是不是可以在澳洲和我的家人生活在一起。I do hope you can help me. I’d like to have some informationregarding whether my mother can come and live with my family inAustralia.
E2Well first of all, are you an Australian citizen or permanentresident? Also, if you don’t mind me asking, how old is yourmother?我从 1999 年就已经是澳洲公民了。我的父亲不久前刚去世, 留下我
M2母亲一个人生活。到三月份我母亲就 63 岁了。I have been an Australian citizen since 1999. My father passed awaynot long ago, leaving my mother alone. My mother will turn 63 inMarch.
E3In that case, she may be eligible to apply for a parent visa to cometo Australia as an aged parent. But she also needs to pass the familybalance test.
M3你能不能给我解释一下什么是家庭平衡测试？我听说过，但是并不是真正的明白。Could you explain to me what the family balance test is? I haveheard of it but I don’t really understand.
E4Basically to pass the family balance test, at least half of yourmother’s children must be living in Australia or more of them live inAustralia than any other single country.
M4我明白了。我有一个妹妹她生活在墨尔本，和一个哥哥住在中国。我母亲没有其他的子女或继子女了。I see. I have a younger sister living in Melbourne and an olderbrother living in China. My mother doesn’t have any other children orstep-children.
E5Well if that is the case, it makes your mother eligible to apply tocome here as an aged parent. She needs to complete and sign anapplication form. I would also suggest that you buy a copy of our parentmigration booklet.
M5行，我会先把表格里该填都帮她填好，然后再寄回中国给她签字。可是，为什么我需要买一本小册子呢？Ok. I will fill out everything on the application form for herfirst, and then send it to China so she can sign it. But why do I needto buy a booklet?
E6It contains the information you need regarding applying for a parentvisa. It lists the basic requirements that must be met and sponsorshipinformation and contains the application form and a checklist ofsupporting documents.
