However, many people are not aware of this yet.And as to your other question, even if it only occurs once it is stillconsidered sexual harassment. | 48 | | E6 |是啊。很多人对于同性之间的性骚扰仍然存在一些误解。下面我问个棘手的问题，根据刑法，旁观者可能成为性骚扰的受害者吗？ | True. Still manypeople have some misunderstandings when it comes to sexual harassmentoccurring among people of the same sex. Now this is a tricky issue,according to criminal law, can a bystander be the victim of sexualharassment? | | 6.1 | The truth is, criminal law stipulates that thevictim can be anyone who is affected by offensive conduct. Let me breakit down for you, a more likely example would be one in which person A (asupervisor) is having a sexual relationship with person B (asubordinate). | 48 | | 6.2 | Person C (a subordinate) is not gettingpromotions due to the fact that he or she is not in a sexualrelationship with person A. This type of favouritism creates adiscriminatory situation for person C as well as the potential forcoercion due to the implication that C must have sex with A in order toget ahead. | 59 | | M6 |非常感谢您为我答疑解惑。您对于性骚扰这一复杂问题的详细解释让我受益匪浅。| Many thanks for answering my questions and addressing my concerns, Ilearned a lot from your explanations on these complicated issuesregarding sexual harassment. |

entry.title: 赴澳买房
entry.content:
Scenario: Mr Zhang is seeking advice from a real estate agent aboutbuying property. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1早上好，我和我家人刚刚移民到澳洲，想尽快买房子，我在报纸上看到了你们的广告，你们可以帮助我吗？Good morning. My family and I just migrated to Australia, and wantto buy a property as soon as possible. I’ve read your advertisement inthe newspaper. Can you help me with that?
M1Good morning! Absolutely, I would be more than happy to assist you.We have various types of properties in different price ranges. Could youtell me what type of property you’re after?32
E2我家有 4 口人，所以想要个大一点的房子，要有 4 个卧室，3个卫生间。有个大的后花园，我们可以种一些植物，我太太喜欢园艺。My family has 4 members in total, so I’d like to have a bigger housewith 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. We also need a big back yard where wecan grow some plants. My wife loves gardening.
M2There shouldn’t be any problem. We have a long list of propertiesfalling into that category. First of all, could you tell me which suburbyou would like to live in?31
E3我的朋友建议过 Hurstville 或是Chatswood，因为那里华人比较多，所以对于英文不好的我们来说，会比较方便。另外，我和太太白天要去city 工作，所以不想离市中心太远。My friend suggested Hurstville or Chatswood, because of the bigChinese communities there. It would be more convenient for people likeus with poor English. Besides, my wife and I both need to work in thecity during the day, so we don’t want to live too far from thecity.
M3I see. Both of the places you just mentioned are not too far fromthe city; usually, it takes about 20 mins by train. I’d also suggestBurwood and Strathfield as they would suit your needs and have betterhousing conditions.41
E4是吗？ Strathfield也住着很多华人吗？记得我朋友说，那里主要是韩国人啊。我不太了解这两个区。您可以解释的更详细点吗？Really? Are there many Chinese living in Strathfield as well? Myfriend told me most of the residents there are Korean. I don’t reallyknow much about those two suburbs. Could you describe them to me in alittle more detail?
M4Sure. Strathfield is now one of the main suburbs with a big Chinesepopulation. The properties we have in Burwood and Strathfield are newlyrenovated and in a leafy and quiet residential area. They are close toshopping centres as well as local parks where children can play afterschool. Of course, the price there could be a little higher thanHurstville.62
E5我明白了。根据我的估算，我大概可以承担不超过 80万的房子。不知道这个价钱是否可以在 Burwood买个合适的独栋房。但是，我要先看房子才能做决定。37I see. Based on my estimation, I can’t afford anything over$800,000. I don’t know if that’s enough to buy a good house in Burwood.But, I will make the decision after inspecting them.
M5I believe you can buy a very good house for that price in this area.I’ll show you the properties in all the areas and leave you to make adecision. Shall we make an appointment now to inspect theproperties?41
E6好主意，明天早上 11点好吗，我现在住在朋友家。我还没有买车，你能来我朋友家接我吗？Good idea. How about 11 am tomorrow? I’m living at my friend’s placeat the moment. I haven’t got a car yet. Could you come here to pick meup?
M6Sure, I will pick you up at your friend’s place at 11 am tomorrow.Could you email me your friend’s address later, thanks?23

entry.title: 网瘾少女
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr David Brown, a school advisor, and MrsYu, a mother who is concerned about her daughter socialising on theinternet. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Thanks for coming in on time, Mrs Yu. I’m David Brown. Nice to meetyou.15
M1很高兴见到你，布朗先生。我发现近来我女儿总是花很长时间上网。这让我很担心。Nice to meet you too, Mr. Brown. I have noticed that my daughter hasbeen spending too much time on the internet recently. It really worriesme.
E2Well, children these days often have a strong thirst for knowledgeand the internet has become their main source of all kinds ofinformation. Do you have any particular concerns?30
M2是的。她爸爸上个月给她买了一台 iPad作为生日礼物。但从那以后，她无论到哪里都带着那个iPad，整天都在网上跟朋友聊天。Yes. Her father bought her an iPad for her birthday last month.Since then, she has been taking it with her everywhere she goes,chatting with friends online all the time.
E3Chatting on the net is very popular among young teenagers. It can bea great way to meet and talk to people from different time zones andbackgrounds. However, risks also exist, especially in chat rooms.36
M3是这样的。我真的很想知道她究竟进的是哪些聊天室，跟什么人聊天。可是她拒绝告诉我，说那是她的隐私。That’s true. I really want to know which chat rooms she is visitingand who she is chatting with. But she refuses to tell me, saying thatit’s personal.
E4Do you socialise online yourself? I know many parents are doing thisas well so that they can add their children’s “friends” and see whatthey are doing.28
M4我基本连互联网都不怎么用，除非是为了我的生意，更别说那些五花八门的网络聊天应用程序了。这一代的小孩子的确比他们的父母更懂得用电脑。I don’t even use the internet very often unless it’s for mybusiness, let alone all these kinds of online chat applications. Infact, children of this generation know more about computers than theirparents.
E5I’d like to suggest you get involved in your daughter’s use of newtechnologies, as parental supervision is a must to protect children frompotential dangers, such as cyber-bullying, identity theft, scams andharassment.34
M5您说的对。那我就让她来教我怎么上网聊天。或许，她会因为我的参与而更加愿意跟我分享她在网上的一些经历。I agree. I think I can get her to show me how it works. Maybe she’llbe more willing to share her online experiences with me if I’m moreinvolved.
E6That’s a great idea. Keeping the lines of communication open is justas important as setting the rules. Give her the confidence that you’realways the right person to turn to.31
M6我会听从您的建议的。谢谢您的宝贵时间。I’ll do as you’ve suggested. Thank you for your time.

entry.title: 呼气测试
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between a police officer and Mr. Zhang at aninformation session about random breath testing (RBT). * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1By law, probationary drivers (P-platers) must maintain a zero BAC(Blood Alcohol Concentration). New alcohol laws affecting P-platers areexpected to be introduced in January 2012. Does anyone have any otherquestions?32
M1我有。根椐现行法律，警察是否有权叫我靠边停车，让我做随机呼吸测试？或者这么说吧， 法律是不是规定他们随便什么时候想做随机呼吸测试都可以？Yes. According to the current legal system, does a police officerhave the authority to pull me over and randomly breathalyse me? Or letme put it this way, are they authorized by law to perform a RBT wheneverthey want to?
E2Thanks for your question. As you might already know, the police dohave the power to randomly stop vehicles, but it does not mean they canperform random preliminary breath tests in any circumstances.34
M2我知道了。 也就是说他们并不能在任何情况下都有权利命令我们做呼吸测试。那么，在什么情况下他们可以要求司机停车接受检查呢？I see. So they can’t perform breath tests whenever they want. Then,in what circumstances can they ask drivers to pull over and take abreath test?
E3They have the authority to require a person to comply with apreliminary breath test if they have reasonable suspicions that a personis driving, attempting to drive or is in charge of a motor vehicle on aroad or other public place while under the influence of alcohol.49
M3很多人都认为喝了一点点酒再开车是没有那么危险的。但我并不这样认为。您能否具体介绍一下什么是 BAC，它又是怎么个测算法的呢?Many people think that driving after drinking a little bit is notthat dangerous. But I don’t agree. Would you please explain in detailwhat BAC is and how BAC is measured?
E4Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) is a measurement of the amount ofalcohol in the body. BAC is measured in grams of alcohol per 100millilitres of blood. The legal blood alcohol concentration (BAC) limitis 0.05. This means that a driver’s body must contain less than 50milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood.55
M4我觉得我有必要记住这些具体的规定。非常感谢您的解释。我还想问一下，如果警察有合理的怀疑的话，是否有权在我家进行呼吸测试呢？我之前听说有类似的情况。I think it’s necessary to memorize those specific regulations justin case. And I thank you for your clarifications. I wonder whether theyare also authorized to require a breath test in my own home if they havereasonable suspicions. I have heard of such cases before.
E5I fully understand your concern. The truth of the matter is, as longas a police officer is not trespassing on a suspects property then anybreath test requirement they make will be lawful, meaning you would haveto comply with their requests.43
M5这个倒是说得通。还好，那如果是青少年犯罪的情况呢？我是说如果青少年酒后驾驶的话，需要其监护人出面吗？Fine, that makes sense. What if the offender is a teenager? I meanif a teenager commits drink-driving, will their guardian need to bepresent?
E6In cases where a juvenile has been detained at a police station fora drink driving related offence there is no requirement for the policeto wait for an appropriate adult to be present to commence the breathtesting procedure. // The procedures do not constitute an interview andtherefore should not be unduly delayed.54
M6你所提供的有关酒后驾驶的信息非常有用。谢谢您抽时间向我解释。Your explanations regarding drink-driving is very helpful and Igreatly appreciate your time.

entry.title: 脑伤就医
entry.content:
Mrs. Yang is consulting her GP about a head injury. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mrs Yang. The receptionist told me you have a deep cuton your head which needs to be treated urgently. How are you feelingnow?27
M1是的，医生。我不小心割伤了额头，现在还是很疼，但是已经不流血了。麻烦您先帮我看看。That’s correct, doctor. I accidentally cut my forehead. It’s verypainful but has stopped bleeding. Please have a look at it for me.
E2Hmm, nothing too serious. The cut is still fresh, now we need to getthat treated first. It shouldn’t leave any scaring. But how did youinjure yourself?28
M2一小时前我在家晕倒了，醒来的时候我, 觉得额头有灼痛, 一照镜子，发现了这么大一道伤口，我想我一定是晕倒后，头磕到了鞋架的边缘。I passed out at home one hour ago. After I regained consciousness, Ifelt a burning pain in my forehead. Then when I looked into the mirror,I found this big cut. I guess I must have hit my head on the edge of theshoe rack after I fell down.
E3I see. Have you passed out like this before? Apart from the pain,did you feel anything else after the fall? Like a headache or nausea?Have you noticed whether there are bumps or bruises on other parts ofyour head?38
M3没有，我从来没有这样过。估计是因为低血糖。头疼倒没有，可是我觉得没有胃口，还有一点耳鸣。脑袋后面都有一点疼，我之前都没有觉察到。医生，应该不会很严重吧？No, it’s the first time. I think maybe hypoglycaemia is the trigger.I don’t have a headache, but I have no appetite. Also my ears have beenringing. The back of my head is in a bit of pain but I didn’t noticethat before. Is it serious, doctor?
E4I am trying to rule out the possibilities of concussion. Since yourfall might have been quite hard, I am worried about the potential braininjuries, like mild concussion.28
M4天啊，脑震荡，不会这么严重吧？那我该怎么办呢？会不会有后遗症，我需不需要做手术？Concussion? Oh dear! Is it that severe? So what should I do now? Isthere going to be any after-effect? Do I need surgery?
E5I’ll get you to see Dr Merphy, the specialist. Don’t worry Mrs Yang.Like any condition, early detection is best. That’s why I want you tosee a specialist soon. Chances are things are not as bad as theysound.42
M5好吧，医生。那我接下来有什么需要注意的呢？剧烈运动肯定是不能参加了吧？我该怎样预防伤口感染呢？Alright, doctor. What things do I need to pay attention to from nowon? I can’t do any strenuous activities, right? What should I do toprevent the wound from infection?
E6Try to rest until you see Dr Merphy. I will give you somedisinfectant to wash the wound. Try to keep it clean and dry, so itwon’t get infected.32
M6好的。 医生， 多谢您的关照。 请你给我开一封转接信。 我明天就去Merphy 医生那儿。Ok. Thank you for looking after me. Can you please write me areferral. I’ll go see Dr. Merphy tomorrow.

entry.title: 父亲施暴
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Mr. James, a school principal, and Mr.Luo, a father, who has been called in for an interview regarding hittinghis son. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Thanks for coming in, Mr. Luo. I am the school principal, StevenJames. Nice to meet you.17
M1您好，校长先生。您今天找我来，是为了什么事吗？是我儿子最近在学校调皮捣蛋了？Hello, Principal. What is the problem that you need to talk to meabout? Has my son been acting up at school lately?
E2Well, Tom has been very well behaved recently. But his teachernoticed some bruises on his back while he was doing sports yesterday. Doyou know anything about that?29
M2噢， 您是说那些淤青啊 … 那是因为他上一次考试又不及格，我实在太生气了，就教训了他一下。Oh, you mean the bruise … that is because I disciplined him a bit.You know, he failed the exam again, and I was so angry.
E3By saying “discipline”, do you mean you, as a matter of fact, havephysically punished your son and it was you who caused the bruise?25
M3你这样说，也可以。男孩子总是很顽皮的，我觉得体罚作为一种教育手段，是必要的。而且，这种瘀伤，很快就能好的。Well, you can put it that way. Boys are often quite naughty and Ithink physical punishment is necessary as a disciplinary measure.Besides, he will recover soon from this kind of bruises.
E4But physical violence against children is harmful, and it can causeserious injuries. I think that it is wrong to consider it a way toresolve issues with your child.30
M4怎么会呢？我小的时候做错了事、或者不听话的时候，也总是挨父亲的揍。但是您看，我现在不是好好的，也没受到任何的伤害呀？How come? When I was little, my father often hit me if I didsomething wrong or behaved disrespectfully. Look, I turned out to bealright now. It didn’t do me any harm.
E5I can’t agree to that, Mr. Luo. Violence only creates problems andconflicts, not the other way around. Children never deserve to bephysically hit or abused. They will learn nothing positive from suchaction.35
M5这就是我们中国家长的教育方式。我们才不像澳大利亚的父母，让孩子们为所欲为，都把孩子给惯坏了！This is the way we Chinese parents educate our kids. We aredifferent from Australian parents who let their kids do whatever theywant. Their kids are all getting spoiled!
E6But I must ask you to stop such action since it is againstAustralian law. Otherwise you may be charged with child abuse and facingpossible penalties and even jail sentences.30
M6真有这么严重？对不起，之前我还真不懂这些。好吧，那我以后不打他了。Is it really that serious? Sorry, I didn’t know that. Alright, Iwon’t hit him anymore.

entry.title: 预定团游
entry.content:
A Mandarin speaking man is making a phone call to a travel companynamed NT Adventures. He has an enquiry about making a tour booking toKakadu National Park for a group of Chinese tourists. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, NT Adventures. How may I help you?9
M1你好，我想了解一下怎么样能够去卡卡杜国家公园。我是想给一群中国游客来预定。Hi there. I’d like to make an enquiry about booking a tour to KakaduNational Park for a group of Chinese tourists.
E2Certainly. Could you start by telling me how many people are in yourgroup and how long you’d like to tour the park? NT Adventures has anumber of different tour packages available. I’ll try my best to findone most suitable for you.44
M2嗯，这个团总共有六个人，他们将会于 9 月 30 号从澳门飞去达尔文，然后10 月 3 号的早上去飞回去。所以我们想要的是一个两日游。我去年的时候其实用过你们公司而且觉得你们的工作做的相当好。It’s a six-person group. They’re flying from Macau to Darwin on the30 thof September and are flying back on the 3 rdof October in themorning. So we’re after a 2-day tour. I actually used your company lastyear and thought you did a fantastic job.
E3Well, that’s good to hear. In that case, there is one particulartour that I think would be suitable for you. It’s a two-day 4WD tourthat takes you to see some spectacular waterfalls and local wildlife,including crocs of course.
M3听起来很棒，因为我们时间紧，可是又想游览到卡卡杜国家公园最美的景点。那住宿怎么安排呢？这些客人都是来自大公司的企业家，住惯了五星级酒店。这次他们想尝试些新鲜的体验。It sounds great as we are short on time and want to see the best ofKakadu National Park. How about accommodation then? The guests are allentrepreneurs from big companies. They have gotten used to five-starhotels. But this time they want to try something different.
E4Well, there are two options. One is to camp under the stars. Theother is to stay in a cabin. Which do you think your group wouldprefer?28
M4我想一个小木屋对我们这个团应该更合适一些。那么，两日游总共有的花费要多少呢？I think a cabin would be more suitable for this group. How much willthe two-day tour cost in total then?
E5Well, in total it comes to $810 for twin share and $900 for singleroom. That price includes entrance to the national park, as well as GST.I’ve added a 10 per cent discount considering you are a repeatcustomer.
M5很好。我们这个团说他们想看一下本地的这个传统土著居民的艺术和文化。他们还说他们想爬爬山，但是我觉得我们可能没有时间去爬山。您怎么看呢？Great. They told me they’d like to check out some of the traditionalAboriginal art and culture. They also said they’d like to do some hikingbut I don’t think we’ll have time for that. What do you think?
E6Well, during the tour we actually take you to a local Aboriginalcommunity to experience traditional Aboriginal culture, and see ancientrock paintings. There is some hiking during the tour on the second day,but nothing too strenuous.38
M6好，听起来不错。我们这个团里还有这个养鸟的爱好者，他们说如果可能的话想去看看本地的鸟。OK, that sounds fine. There are a couple of bird enthusiasts in thegroup. They said they’d like to do some bird watching if possible.
E7We may be able to arrange something on the second day of the tour.I’d have to get back to you on that one.24
M7谢谢。我 15 分钟之后就给你打个电话过来，商量更多的预定信息。Thanks. I’ll call you back in 15 minutes, to go through more detailsabout the group booking.

entry.title: 遗嘱咨询
entry.content:
Scenario: Mrs Lee goes to see her solicitor about making a will * **
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mrs Lee. The interpreter is here so we can understandeach other now. Could you tell me how I can help you today?25
M1我今天来是想咨询立遗嘱的事情,我的年纪大了,觉得是时候处理这个问题了。I came here today to enquire about making a will. Considering myage, I feel it’s the right time to deal with this issue.
E2As a matter of fact, no matter how old they are, everyone shouldhave a valid will, which makes sure that their belongings aredistributed according to their wishes rather than under the rigidformula that exists for those who die intestate.42
M2说得有道理。那就请您先解答我的几个疑问吧。首先，立遗嘱应该先做什么？遗嘱都应该包括什么呢？I agree. Could you start by answering a couple of questions for me?Firstly, what should I start with when making a will, and what should beincluded?
E3Firstly, you should know that a will must be accepted by a court andit must also be in writing, signed and witnessed by two witnesses.// Asfor the other question, all your property and possessions should beincluded in the will. This includes everything you own: your home, car,money, insurance policies, shares, securities, jewellery and so on.59
M3我明白了。我还有一个问题，不好意思，我对于法律方面一窍不通。是您帮我处理和遗嘱相关的所有事宜，对吗？I see. I have another question. Sorry, I have no knowledge of law atall. So you will be the one helping me deal with all the issues relatedto the will, right?
E4Of course, I’m more than happy to take care of it for you. Also, youneed to start considering appointing an executor to handle your affairsafter you die. This can be anyone you want, including myself.37
M4我可以指定我的一个孩子做遗嘱执行人么？我有两个孩子，一儿一女。但他们也都没有学过法律专业。执行人都有哪些职责呢？Can I appoint one of my children to be the executor? I have twochildren, one son and a daughter. But neither of them has studied law.What are the responsibilities of an executor?
E5The executor will be the one who has to obtain probate of the willand pay any taxes, debts or expenses before distributing the balance tothe beneficiaries named in your will. So it has to be an independentparty, and can’t be the beneficiaries.45
M5这样的话，那我想，我最好还是找一个专业人士吧。我可以请您做我的遗嘱执行人吗？If that’s the case, I’d better find a professional to do this. Socan I ask you to be the executor of my will?
E6Certainly! I assure you that you can trust me and my professionalknowledge and experience. The first thing you need to do is to give me alist of your possessions and we can start to draft a will if youlike.42
M6我在 Hurstville有一栋房子，拥有两台车。除了银行存款以外，我还有一些股票证券方面的投资，价值大约有 50 来万吧。其他的小额财产，我需要回家好好整理下，再告诉您。I have a house in Hurstville and two cars. Apart from bank savings,I have investments such as shares and securities, roughly valued at$500,000. As for other small value possessions, I have to sort them outat home first before I get back to you.

entry.title: 斐济换钱
entry.content:
This is a conversation between a financial advisor and Mr Wang aboutexchanging money into Fijian Dollars. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1G’day Mr Wang! I’m David McDonald, financial adviser of theCommonwealth Bank of Australia. How can I help you today?20
M1你好，麦当劳先生。我今天是想来咨询一下关于我去斐济旅游的问题，我是否需要提前在澳洲兑换一些斐济币。Good morning Mr McDonald. I’m here to inquire about my trip to Fiji.Do I need to buy some Fijian dollars here in advance?
E2Certainly you could, but as the Fijian dollar is not a commoncurrency, we need you to make an appointment. But, let me check for youand see how much cash we have on hand. So, how much do you want?41
M2我想兑换大概价值澳元 3000 元的斐济币。大概是多少钱呢？我要去那边呆 1个月呢，而且可能去外岛度假，所以可能会花不少钱。我怕那边太偏远，没法用信用卡，所以我还是比较想换好现金再去。I’d like to convert about AU$3000 to Fijian dollars. How much can Iget? I’ll need to stay there for about a month and I may spend some timeduring the holiday going to outer islands as well, so it may cost quitea lot of money. I’m worried that the place is too remote to use mycredit card, so I want exchange some cash to take with me.
E3Yes, you are right. If you go to some remote islands, we wouldsuggest that you to take enough cash to last the whole time. However, ifyou arrive in Fiji at Nadi International Airport, there are ATMfacilities and exchange booths for traveler’s cheques and Australiandollar notes. Umm …. According to our records, we have only 1000 Fijiandollars at this branch.64
M3这不够啊！我是会在楠迪机场降落，但是我要立刻转机，可能没有时间出去找两替店了。我知道信用卡可以用，但是我听说不论走万事达还是走维萨的通道，都会收取高达 3%的手续费。刚才你说的旅行支票是什么？Ah that won’t be enough! It is true I will land at Nadi Airport, butI’m going to transfer straight away, so I may not have time to find anexchange booth. I know I can use my credit card, but I heard that bothVisa and Master card charge a transaction fee as high as 3%. You justmentioned traveller’s cheques. What is that?
E4Yes, you are right. You will be charged at least 3% of thetransaction as a processing fee. And we are not sure whether they acceptAmerican Express since we don’t have any ATMs there. As I know, ANZ hassome ATMs at Nadi Airport. You can enquire with them about this. Interms of traveller’s cheques, it’s like a bank cheque, which allows youto withdraw cash overseas in a safe and reliable way.75
M4那好的，我看不必要去问 ANZ 了。我可以兑换你现有的 1000 斐济元现金么？然后其余的 2500 澳币左右我想要旅行支票。这样我可以一降落就马上把旅行支票兑换成当地货币。Okay. I don’t think I need to ask ANZ. Can I buy the 1000 FijianDollars you have now? And I’d like a travellers cheque for the remainingAU$2500 so that I can exchange it for local currency right afterlanding.
E5Sure, I will process this for you now. So you want all 50 dollarnotes or a combination of 50 and 100 dollar notes?24
M5我想要 50 一张的纸币作为零花钱，免得到了当地老拿出大钞来，别人以为我很有钱，抢劫我。I’d like to have 50 dollar notes as pocket money, so that I don’thave to use large notes all the time. Otherwise people may think I’mvery rich and want to rob me.
E6Yes. That’s a good way to avoid any risk when you are travellingoverseas. Here you are, that’s your $1000 Fijian dollar cash and yourtraveller’s cheque. Please keep it safe and if any is stolen or lost,please report it to us at the earliest opportunity.47
M6好的，如果真的掉了我会跟你们电话报失的。谢谢。再见。Fine. If I were to lose it I would report to you. Thank you,bye.

entry.title: 性别歧视
entry.content:
Ms. Yang is speaking to a Legal Aid officer about genderdiscrimination and unfair dismissal. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1你好，我想来咨询一下关于性别歧视和不公平解雇方面的问题。Hello, I am here to make an enquiry about gender discrimination andunfair dismissal.
M1Certainly. Do you feel you have been the victim of this in your workplace? Would you like to tell me more about it?24
E2在被解雇前, 我在一家俱乐部做代理经理，每星期工作 20 小时。前不久俱乐部的董事们决定将这个职位提升为全职职位。 // 可是一星期前董事们给了我两周通告，把我辞退了， 理由是他们想找个男的来做这份工作。我觉得这太不公平了！I was the acting manager of a club before I got dismissed. I workedthere 20 hours a week. Not long ago, the club directors decided to makethis role a full-time position. However, a week ago, they gave me a two-week dismissal notice, because they preferred to get a male staff memberto do the job. I think it’s so unfair!
M2Based on what you’ve told me, the actions of the club directors areindeed against the law. Have you tried talking to them? If the club hasa set of policies or a procedure to deal with this kind of thing, itwould be advisable to try to get this problem addressed through thesechannels first.56
E3我已经试过和董事们沟通了，但他们不听，我也没有办法。俱乐部也没有专门应付此类事件的策略或程序– 我是代理经理，这一点我最清楚了。I tried to talk to the directors but they wouldn’t listen to me.There’s nothing I could do about it. And the club doesn’t have anypolicies or procedures to deal with that kind of issue. I know thatbetter than anyone else as a previous acting manager there.
M3What I suggest you do then is to write to the Anti-DiscriminationBoard, explain what happened and ask them to help you. It won’t cost youanything and you don’t need a lawyer to do it, but the complaint must bein written form, and you must sign it.49
E4可是，我的英语水平很差， 肯定看都看不懂那些表格和文件。万一写错了什么地方，可怎么办呢？所以，您能不能替我起草一份投诉书呢？But my English is very poor. I can’t even understand those documentsand forms. What if I make a mistake? Can you help me draft a complaintapplication?
M4You can write to the board in any language, and there arediscrimination complaint forms you can obtain from their website, so youdon’t have to worry about your English skills. The board staff can alsohelp you complete the form.41
E5那太好了。那您能否现在帮我打开那个反歧视委员会的网站，然后帮我把表格打印出来呢？口译员在这里，更好可以帮我翻译。那么我投诉之后会怎样呢？That’s great. Could you now go to the website of theAntiDiscrimination Board and print out the forms for me? The interpreterhere can help me translate. So what will happen after the complaint islodged?
M5Sure. Here you are. The board will investigate your complaint, andif they find that the actions of your employer were against the law,they will try to facilitate conciliation. The settlement will be aprivate agreement between you and your employer, and what it entailsdepends on what both parties are willing to offer and accept.57
E6听起来有些复杂而且很耗时间吧？我想继续在俱乐部里做经理，您觉得这有可能吗？It sounds a bit complicated and time-consuming. I’d like to continuebeing a manager at the club. Do you think this would be possible?
M6It will depend on what your employers are willing to offer. They maychoose to offer you an apology, financial compensation, or perhaps yourold position. You will have to talk to them about it when the boardorganises a conciliation session.42

entry.title: 照料津贴
entry.content:
Mr Gao, a Mandarin-speaking man, has come to a local Centrelinkoffice. He has asked to speak to a Centrelink officer about applying forcarer payments. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning. Please take a seat. Before we start could I confirmyour CRN (Client Reference: Number) and your name please?18
M1我上个星期才拿到卡，号码是 524 094 104K.我的名字是 Qiang Gao.I only got the card last week. The number is 524 094 104K. My nameis Qiang Gao.
E2Cheers, Mr. Gao. So, what can I help you with today?11
M2是关于我的孙子，他叫查斯特，今年 12 岁了。他有唐氏综合症和智障。因为我要全职的照顾他所以我没办法工作。最糟糕的是，我的太太最近又丢了工作。如果 Centrelink 可以给我们一些帮助我们会很感激的。It’s about my grandson, Chester. He is 12 years old. He has Down’ssyndrome and an intellectual disability. Since I provide full-time carefor him I am not able to work. The worst thing is, my wife has lost herjob. We would be extremely grateful for any kind of assistance thatCentrelink can give us.
E3Well you may be eligible for Carer Payment, and I see on your filethat you and your grandson are both permanent residents. So, may I ask,when did you first arrive and settle in Australia?36
M3我们是 2005 年一月从中国移民过来的。那年七月，我们全家搬到墨尔本边上的一个小镇上，然后就一直住到现在。We migrated here from China in January 2005. Then in July the sameyear, my family and I moved to a small town near Melbourne. We have beenliving there since then.
E4The reason I asked about when you came to Australia is because toqualify for a Carer Payment both you and the person you are lookingafter must be Australian residents and they must have been living in thecountry for at least two years. Now, I can see this would not be aproblem in your case.58
M4我想这份补助真的会帮到我们很大的忙。除了查斯特的医药费以外，我们还有汽油费，每天开两个小时的车去特殊学校。您觉得我们每个月可以拿多少钱呢？I think this payment would help us a lot. On top of the cost of hismedical expenses, there are also petrol expenses. We have to drive twohours every day to get to a special school. So how much money do youthink we can get per month?
E5Well I’m afraid I won’t be able to give you an exact figure today.The Carer Payment is income and assets tested, so individual payments dovary. I would advise you to register an ‘intent to claim’ form for theCarer Payment as soon as you can.47
M5那还有别的什么补助，我有可能符合资格领取吗？请你帮我查一下好吗？Are there other kinds of payments that we may be eligible toreceive? Could you find out for me?
E6Now as part of the payment you will also receive a PensionerConcession Card and Pharmaceutical Allowance. You may also be able toget a few other payments such as Rent Assistance and UtilitiesAllowance. And if you are eligible you will be notified automatically.You won’t need to apply for them yourself.53
M6嗯，那个太好啦。我这就会去填表。谢谢！OK. I think I’ll go fill in the form right away. Thank you!

entry.title: 疑似失眠
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between Dr. Philip, a GP, and Mrs. Li, about hersleeping problems. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon Mrs. Li. So what has brought you here today?11
M1下午好，Philip 医生。我最近感觉不太好，因为我晚上总是睡不好觉，所以白天就无精打采的，还很易怒。Good afternoon, Doctor Philip. I’ve been feeling very well lately. Iam listless and moody during the day because I have been having sleepingproblems.
E2I see. How long exactly have you been suffering from disturbedsleep? Also, could you tell me what kind of sleeping problems you havespecifically?25
M2大概有三个多星期了， 就是自从我退休之后。 晚上的时候，我觉得焦躁不安，总要在床上翻来覆去几个小时，很难入睡。It has been over three weeks probably, ever since I retired. I feelrestless through the night and I often toss and turn for hours but justcan’t fall asleep.
E3Sleeping problems are particularly common in people over 65. Theycan affect people in different ways. For example, they may have troublefalling asleep, they may wake frequently or have poor sleepquality.33
M3是呀，是呀。您说的这些症状，我都有。我该怎么办呢？医生，您说我是不是得了失眠症了呢？Yes, exactly. You see, I have all the symptoms that you justmentioned. What shoul I do? Doctor, do you think I have insomnia?
E4It depends. The need for sleep varies from person to person. It alsovaries depending on the level of activity. In your case, I believe themain cause is just a change of lifestyle after retirement.36
M4我的确是很难适应现在的退休生活。可是，这个问题每天都越发严重了。那您能给我开点安眠药吗？我太久都没有好好得睡上一觉了。I do have problems adapting to retirement. But this condition isgetting worse day by day. Could you prescribe some sleeping pills forme? I haven’t had a proper night’s sleep for a long time.
E5Actually, at this stage, doing more exercise and being more activeduring the day could be a better solution for you. Also, worrying aboutloss of sleep can in turn lead to having even worse sleep.36
M5好吧，既然您说不是大问题，那我就放心了。那除了您刚说的，在睡前习惯方面，我有什么需要注意的吗？Alright, I’m very much relieved since you said it’s not a big deal.Apart from what you just mentioned, is there anything else I should payattention to in terms of pre-sleep routine?
E6Well, yes. Doing things such as spending at least half an hourwinding down, reading a paper or listening to some music can be quitehelpful.26
M6那好吧。我会照您的话去做的。谢谢。Alright. I will follow your advice. Thank you.

entry.title: 探亲签证
entry.content:
Mrs. Lu is being interviewed by a member of the Migration ReviewTribunal (MRT) regarding a rejected visa application. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1How are you, Mrs Lu? Good to see you today. Please have a seat.14
M1謝謝，您一定得幫我。 我帮我的弟弟申请了短期停留探访签证，但是申请遭到了拒绝。我们现在很绝望。Thank you. Please help me. I helped my brother to apply for a shortstay visitor’s visa. But our application was rejected and we’re reallydesperate.
E2Don’t be upset. Our job in the MRT is to review unfavourabledecisions made by DIAC. However, in making its decisions, it must haveregard to the relevant laws, and to government policy. Does that makesense?37
M2恩，我明白。我想我来对地方了。我认为移民局的拒签決定太不合理了。我肯定，他们错了。Yes, I understand. I think I have come to the right place. I thinkDIAC’s decision to reject the visa is so unfair, and I am sure they havemade a mistake.
E3I can’t say anything about that until I get the details. Now, thismatter relates to the refusal to grant a Short Stay visitor’s Visa. Iknow you wanted to sponsor your brother to come to Australia for athree-month period. Why was that?44
M3是這樣，我母親跟我們一起住在澳洲，她一直有糖尿病，去年開始又有了一系列的併發症，半年前還發作過一次心臟病，身體越來越差了。她很想再見一次我的弟弟，所以我弟弟需要一个签证。Well… my mother is living with us in Australia. She has diabetes andshe’s started to suffer a series of complications since last year. Herhealth has been getting worse since her heart attack 6 months ago. Butshe really wants to see my brother again, so my brother needs avisa.
E4According to the decision, they were not satisfied that your brotherwould leave Australia when his visa expired. The reason is firstly, thatyour brother has never travelled overseas before; and that he hadlimited incentives to return home. Why do you think the decision isincorrect?47
M4我弟弟在中國經營著一家書店， 有自己 的 房產 ， 有妻子和一個孩子。我們已經在申請里提交了銀行證明，顯示我弟弟有超過 70 萬人民幣的银行存款。My brother owns a bookshop and has his own property in China. He hasa wife and a child. We did provide the bank statement with ourapplication, showing that his bank savings are over 700 thousandRMB.
E5That makes sense. Looking through the file, I can see that youprovided very detailed documentation with your brother’s application.And now you have provided me with a letter that states you will acceptthe imposition of a security bond for your brother, if necessary.45
M5是的，先生。我們是 好公民，並沒有任何不良行為。澳洲移民局爲什麽這麼冷酷？我只是想让我的弟弟来这里探望生病的母亲而已。Yes, Sir. We are good citizens here with no record of bad behaviour.Why is DIAC so cold-hearted? We just want to bring my brother here tovisit my mother as she is sick.
E6You are absolutely right. It is quite possible that the MRT will setaside the decision of DIAC.18

entry.title: 新洲工作
entry.content:
Mr ZHONG is a newly arrived migrant, he has recently found a new jobopportunity. Before accepting the new job, he goes to NSW Office ofIndustrial Relations to seek further information about working in NSW.Ms Jones, an IR officer meets Mr ZHONG at her office. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1我最近在找工作。有一个雇主要求我去面试，在我去之前，我想咨询您几个问题。I’ve been looking for jobs recently. One employer asked me to attendan interview. But before I go, I would like to ask you a fewquestions.
M1Congratulations！I will try to provide you with all the informationthat you might need. Before you start work you need to know theconditions you will be working and exactly what you will be expected todo in the role. Your employer should give you this information in aletter of offer.54
E2这封聘用书都具体都应该包含那些内容呢？我知道的有，我的工资，工作时间，我的职责等等。但是我希望聘用书里面能包括公司的政策，因为它能反映用人单位的雇佣理念。我还希聘用书能列出一些对我有益处的职工培训项目。What exactly should be included in the letter of offer? I only knowthere should be my salary, working hours and duties. But I hope it alsoincludes company’s policies which normally reflect their employmentphilosophies, as well as some useful training programs that I may findbeneficial.
M2You are right. The letter of offer should include the employer’sname and contact details, your duties, salary, working hours, youremployment conditions and whether you are to be employed as a casual,full-time or part-time employee.37
E3原来有这么多的细节信息呀。我本来想着特别简单，就是我上班，雇主给钱。却不知道还有这么多不同的工作形式。Oh so there is actually that much detailed information. I thought itwould be just as simple as I work and get paid. But I didn’t know thereare so many different types of jobs.
M3Please remember to ask your employer what employment you will beworking under and whether you are covered by a state or federalaward.24
E4我明白了，每个细节都必须搞清楚。如果雇主给我书面聘用书，我应该收到后立刻签署相关的文件吗？I see. I need to go through every detail. If the employer sends mean offer in writing, should I sign those documents as soon as they areprovided?
M4As part of the process of accepting a new job, you may be asked tosign a document agreeing to particular working conditions. This could becalled a contract or an agreement. If this happens, make sure you readit very carefully first. Don’t feel pressured to sign straight away,especially if it doesn’t suit you.56
E5如果雇主没有给我书面的聘用书，我应该怎么办？我应该和他要吗？有的雇主嫌麻烦，不愿意出书面的聘用书。What should I do if the employer is reluctant to present me with awritten offer Should I ask for it? Some employers simply can’t bebothered to issue an offer letter.
M5A verbal agreement is also a legal contract. One of the best thingsyou can do is to note down everything the employer has told you aboutthe job and your working conditions. Even though you have written ityourself, this can be used as evidence if there is any future disputeabout your pay or conditions.57
E6我听说这边主要分两种工人，一种是合同制工人，一种是雇佣制工人。而且雇员有全职工作， 半职工作，还有临时工？如果雇主要求我做免费试工，我该怎么办？I heard that there are two types of workers, under which I caneither work as a contractor or employee and that I can work full time,part time or casually. What if they ask me to do an unpaid trial?
M6Yes, you are right. It is important for all workers to know whetherthey are employees or contractors. Workers can be employed on afull-time, part-time or casual basis. It is against the law forprospective employers to make you do an unpaid work trial, even if it isjust for a few hours.54

entry.title: 煤气泄漏
entry.content:
his is a dialogue between a woman discussing some problems regardingher living arrangements with a case manager at the Department of Familyand Community Services. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good afternoon. How is everything going? You moved into the unit inMurray St almost three months ago now. Have you settled in allright?25
M1是这样的，其实还没有。有些问题，我得跟你反映一下。Well, no actually, there are a few problems I need to talk to youabout.
E2Oh, really? I'm surprised to hear that. You were so pleased when youwere able to get that unit, because it's in such a convenient locationfor you. What's the matter?31
M2嗯，还是存在不少问题的。但主要让我担心的是，厨房里好像总是弥漫着一股让人头晕的煤气味。我恐怕是有煤气泄漏。Well, there are a few things…but my main concern is that there seemsto always be a faint smell of gas in the kitchen, and I'm worried thatthere might be a leak.
E3Oh! Well yes, if that's the case, you're quite right, it does needto be fixed immediately. I'll ring the gas company right now. Will yoube home for the rest of the afternoon?34
M3这里结束之后，三点钟我就得到学校去接我的儿子放学。然后我们就直接回家了。一般三点半之前就能到家。Well, after I leave here I have to pick up my son from school at 3o'clock, but then we'll be going straight home. We usually get homebefore 3.30.
E4Good. When it’s a suspected leak, they usually get someone to comeand investigate it within a couple of hours. But you'll need to be thereto let them in.30
M4噢，对啊，我知道。那没有关系。如果能解决这个问题，我就放心多了。现在我可不可以再反应一下其他的问题？Oh yes, I understand. That will be fine. It will be a great reliefto have that fixed. Is it all right if I mention the other problemsnow?
E5Of course, go ahead.4
M5嗯，是关于 6 号房的那家人，就住在我们楼上。他们太吵了。夜里，我试过让他们把电视机的声音关小一点，但从来都没有用。我们根本睡不了觉！Well, it's about the people in unit 6, directly above us. They'revery noisy. I tried asking them to turn the TV down at night, but ithasn't helped. We can't get any sleep!
E6Ah, yes, some of the other tenants have complained about them too.I'll send them a warning letter. If they don't keep the noise down, letus know and we'll follow it up.33
M6那就麻烦你了，谢谢。Please do. Thank you!

entry.title: 为女贷款
entry.content:
Mrs. Shan is speaking to a Legal Aid officer about helping herdaughter financially. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Mrs. Shan. Sorry to have kept you waiting. Thereceptionist wasn’t very specific when she mentioned what you’re herefor today. Am I correct in saying that it has something to do withtaking out a loan?39
M1是的，是这样的。我的女儿最近和女婿在 Burwood 买了一套房子，借了不少钱。// 前不久她和我打电话时说她失业了， 女婿一个人打工还房贷还要养家很辛苦。我想用我在 Kensington 的房子抵押贷款，来帮他们一把。Yes, you’re right. My daughter and her husband bought a property inBurwood recently. They borrowed a lot of money for that.// She called menot long ago, saying she has just lost her job, so her husband is nowstruggling to make the loan repayments and support the family all byhimself. In order to help them out, I want to use my property inKensington to get a mortgage.
E2I understand that it’s very difficult to watch your daughterstruggle financially, but you also need to protect your own interestsand make sure that whatever is asked of you is realistic. With that inmind, how would you describe your own financial situation?44
M2我的经济状况？一般吧。退休以后我就靠养老金生活，省点用基本能够凑合。不过 Kensington 的房子是我自己的，房贷也已经还清。我女儿说如果现在拿去抵押贷款的话可以借到一笔不小的数目。My financial situation? It’s pretty average. I’ve been living offthe pension since retiring. I have no problem getting by if I save a bitof money. But the property in Kensington is mine and the mortgage hasbeen paid off. My daughter said that if I use it to get a mortgage Iwould be able to borrow a lot of money.
E3I think I am getting to understand the whole story. Are you sayingthat, your daughter was the one who suggested the loan, is thatcorrect?26
M3是的，虽然她和她丈夫的个人信誉评价都很好，但由于房贷的关系，各大银行都不愿意再借钱给他们，所以不得不求我帮忙。Yes. She and her husband both have very good creditworthiness, butno bank wants to lend them money due to their current mortgage. So theyhad to turn to me for help.
E4Whilst I can empathise with your situation, I would still like tohighlight that you will be the one who bears most of the risk.25
M4我明白，但是最近房价涨得这么厉害，如果银行因为他们还不起房贷而回收他们的房子，以后再要买房就更困难了。I know, but the housing prices are soaring. It would be difficultfor them to buy another property in the future, if the bank took backtheir house away just because they couldn’t afford the loan.
E5But if you take out a loan to help your daughter, you will berelying on her to make the repayments, as your pension is only enoughfor you to get by. If she can’t pay, you might lose your house.41
M5可是她毕竟是我唯一的女儿， 我不帮她谁帮她呢？我这次来也是她的提议，因为我们都想不出更好的办法。您对此有什么建议吗？或许我应该把房子的产权转一部分给她？But she is my only daughter. If I don’t help her, who else will?Coming to see you was also her suggestion, as neither of us could comeup with a better idea. What’s your advice? Should I transfer part of myproperty title to her?
E6That would still carry the same risk as if you take out the loanyourself. You can consider taking out a reverse mortgage, where you onlypay back the loan when you die or sell your home. But that might leavetoo little equity in the property to pay for your health care or toleave as an inheritance to your daughter.62
M6反向抵押贷款？我从没听说过。麻烦您给我一些关于这种贷款的信息，我得回家和我女儿讨论一下。A reverse mortgage? I have never heard of it. Could you please giveme more information about this kind of loan? I’d like to discuss it withmy daughter when I get home.

entry.title: 花粉病症
entry.content:
Mr. Lee (L), a Mandarin speaking patient, is speaking to his GP (G)about his flu-like symptoms. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1醫生，我覺得好难受呀。Hello doctor. I am not feeling very well.
M1Good morning Mr. Lee. You actually don’t look very good. I can seethat you have blood-shot eyes and your face is swelling.23
E2我近來一直打喷嚏、流鼻涕。起初我以为是流感，所以就去买了些治流感的药片。但吃了药之后却并没有好转。Recently, I’ve been sneezing a lot and have had a runny nose. Iinitially thought that it was the flu, so I went to buy some flutablets. But I didn’t get any better after taking the medication.
M2Right, it doesn’t look like a cold or the flu to me. While I’mtaking your temperature, could you please tell me whether you have itchyor watery eyes?29
E3有呀。白天我的眼睛感觉更难受。除此之外，我胃口不错，睡眠也没问题。并无大碍。医生，我这是怎么了？我可真是受不了了。Yes, I do. My eyes get worse during the day. Other than this, I havea good appetite and can sleep well. There’s nothing major. Doctor, whatis my problem? I really can’t stand this anymore.
M3I see. What you have now is an allergy that is commonly known as‘hay fever’. It is triggered by an allergic reaction to pollen in theair, usually in spring and summer.33
E4哦，是这样。难怪我那天在后院修割草坪之后，觉得更严重了。这病严重吗？Oh, I see. No wonder I felt worse the other day after I mowed thegrass in the backyard. Is this a very serious illness?
M4Mr. Lee, don’t worry. I can assure you that your condition is notunique. Hay fever is very common in Australia – about 3.2 millionAustralians suffer from chronic hay fever.30
E5你可不可以给我开点药呢？我想尽快康复。尽管你说了这病不要紧，可我还是觉得我很难集中精神。Can you give me some medicine? I want to recover from this as soonas possible. Even though you just mentioned that this is not a seriousproblem, I find it very hard to concentrate.
M5You don’t need any prescription for the medication. You can simplygo to any chemist and buy some nasal spray or tablets over the counterto alleviate your symptoms.29
E6醫生，那你能否给我一些如何预防花粉症的信息呢？我不想再得这种病了。Doctor, could you please give me some information on preventing hayfever? I don’t want to suffer from this anymore.
M6Sure, there are some leaflets on preventing hay fever in thereception. You can take a copy with you when you leave.22

entry.title: 蛀牙手术
entry.content:
This is a dialogue between a general dentist Mr Bryant and a patient,Ms Gao, regarding her toothache caused by horizontal tooth impaction. ** *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1Good morning, Ms Gao. What brings you here today?9
M1医生，早上好，我牙齿的 X 光的结果出来了吗? 上次检查，您说我是长智齿了。我每天都牙疼得吃不下、睡不香，生活一团糟。Good morning, doctor. Have you received my dental X-ray results?Last time, you told me that I have a wisdom tooth coming out. I cannoteat or sleep well due to the pain. My life is just a mess!
E2I have examined your X-ray report, I can see that you do have onewisdom tooth at the back left corner of your mouth. It seems that it iscausing the gum around the tooth to be infected, and adjacent teeth todecay also. We have to treat this matter seriously, otherwise you mightend up with severe complications.59
M2您指的是哪些并发症？您认为我现在的牙周炎是由长智齿引起的么 ? 我近来已经格外注意保持口腔卫生了，但似乎也没什么帮助。What kind of complications are you referring to? Do you think mycurrent periodontitis was caused by this? I have been paying particularattention to keeping my mouth clean lately but it seems it hasn’t beenmuch help.
E3The most common complications include erosion cavities, infections,crowding and cysts. Your wisdom tooth has stalled halfway, which makesbrushing and flossing of it extremely difficult. Food and bacteria havebuilt up around the neighbouring molars, causing decay and guminfection. I can imagine the enormous pain you are experiencing.50
M3是这样， 那麻烦您再给我开点抗生素和止痛药吧！上次的药， 我都已经用完了。我每天都疼得受不了，而且越来越严重。怎么才能彻底让它不痛呢？That’s true. I have finished all the antibiotics and pain killersthat you prescribed for me last time. Could you give me some more? Thispain is unbearable and worsening each day. How can I completely get ridof this pain?
E4Unfortunately, although mouth infections such as periodontitiscaused by wisdom teeth can be treated with antibiotics, the infectionwill re-occur unless the wisdom teeth are removed.26
M4一定要拔吗？虽然我身边的很多朋友都拔了，但我听说拔牙也可能引发许多后期的问题，比如说牙齿渗血、出血，牙槽干燥，甚至神经损伤。如果真的是这样，那听起来可太吓人了。Do I have to? Many of my friends have had their wisdom teethextracted, but I was told that it could cause many post-extractionproblems. For example, bleeding and oozing, dry sockets or even nerveinjury. It sounds so terrible if that is true.
E5But I’m afraid it is the best option. As you can see from the X-ray,the emerging tooth is angled 90 degrees sideways, and growing into theroots of the second molar, which is generally known as horizontal toothimpaction. We will have to remove it.46
M5看来是别无选择了。你看我的下牙是不是都被挤歪了？我是不是还要戴牙套？我小的时候戴过好几年，但是总被人嘲笑，我可不想再经历一次了。那手术时会不会很疼？It seems I have no other choice. Have you noticed that my lowerteeth are crooked? Do you think I need to get braces? I wore them foryears when I was little, and I was often laughed at because of that. Idon’t want to go there again. Will I suffer a lot of pain in thesurgery?
E6You will be under local anaesthesia during the surgery so you won’tfeel any pain during the procedure. We can talk about orthodontictreatment after the surgery.27
M6那我就照您说的做吧。请您给我安排个手术时间。谢谢。Ok, then I will follow your instructions. Please schedule a time formy surgery. Thank you.

entry.title: 养老咨询
entry.content:
Mrs Hong, a mandarin speaking woman is consulting with Thomas, themanager of an aged care centre. * * *
IDOriginalTranslated
E1你好！谢谢你抽出时间来跟我面谈。我今天来是想要了解一下你们这个养老院的一些大致情况。Hello, thank you for taking the time to see me. I’m here today toget some general information about your aged care centre.
M1Good morning! Thank you very much for showing your interest in ourcentre. Please have a seat. My name is Thomas, I’m more than happy tohelp you.28
E2是这样的。我已经 75岁了。我打算从家里搬出来，因为我的儿子和儿媳妇不再愿意和我住在一起了，说是没有隐私了。我想了解一下你们这里不同房间的价格。Well, I’m 75 and I am planning to move out of my home, because myson and his wife don’t like living with me anymore. They said they needmore privacy. I’d like to know the rates for different types of roomshere?
M2Sure. Actually it is a very wise decision to choose us as we havevarious types of rooms which come with a variety of rates so you canchoose the one that best suits your needs. The most popular one is astudio.43
E3哦，我了解了。那么你们这里通常都是住着什么样的人呢？我希望我的左邻右舍都是很好心又乐于助人的人。人老了，就图个心情好，要是遇到一些不好的邻居，那就麻烦了。Oh, I see. So generally speaking, what kind of people are livinghere? I ‘d like to have some kind and warm-hearted neighbours. Whenyou’re old, being happy is all one cares about. If my neighbours happento be unfriendly, that would cause trouble.
M3Don’t worry. Our centre has been among the top ten aged care centresfor five years in a row, and we are as careful in choosing our membersas they are in choosing us. If there is any dispute, you can alwaysrefer it to our dispute mediation committee to have it solvedfairly.54
E4听起来还不错，你们还有专门的调解委员会。那么我想问问你们对客户在健康方面的要求有什么特别设计的一些设施吗？Sounds great! So you have this particular mediation committee here.Also I’d like to know, do you have any specially designed facilities andsupport for members with special health needs?
M4Oh yes, we take our members’ health issues into consideration. Wehave a carer team to help people who have Alzheimer’s and dementia, andall the rooms are specifically designed for seniors, and include thingssuch as automatic lighting systems and heating systems. Our members’specific health requirements are seen as very important to us.55
E5我有健忘症，还有高血压，而且你也看到了，我是用轮椅的。你们这里有针对我这样情况的设施和护理人员吗？I have amnesia and hypertension. And as you can tell, I am a wheelchair user.Do you have any facilities or carers to help people in mykind of situation?
M5Amnesia and hypertension are common among seniors, and when we firstdesigned this centre, we took this into consideration. We have a team of16 experienced nurses to provide professional care. Also, our rooms areall purpose built, which means they are all wheel-chair accessible.45
E6这很好。那么关于心理方面，你们有相关的专业人员吗？你知道，老年人很容易感到孤单，被社会隔离等，这些负面的心理倾向往往会引发一些生理上的问题。That’s good. What about the mental health services? Do you have anyprofessionals? You know seniors often feel lonely and socially isolated.These negative psychological tendencies often lead to mentalproblems
M6I understand your concern. We have our own counselling servicecentre and activity centre. Our professional counsellors are more thanhappy to help each of our members. Also, social activities such asshopping and seeing movies are organised on a monthly basis.42

entry.title: 劫匪抢包
entry.content: This is a dialogue between Ms Phillips, an officer at the VictimSupport Service, and a woman who is seeking assistance because her baghas been stolen. * * * | ID | Original | Translated | | --- | --- | ---| | E1 | Hello, I'm Sarah Phillips, from the Victim Support Service. Howcan I help you? | 14 | | M1 |是这样的。上周六，在伊丽莎白购物中心，有两个小伙子抢了我的包。警察说我应该来找你们反应一下。 | Well, last Saturday I had my bag snatchedby two young boys at Elizabeth Shopping Centre. The police said I shouldcome and talk to you. | | E2 | I understand. Can you give me some moredetails about what happened? I take it you have already reported this tothe police, is that right? | 26 | | M2 |是的。昨天我去警察局做了说明。我跟他们讲述了事情经过也描述了那两个人的长相。警察还给我头上的伤口拍了照。 | Yes, I went to the policestation to give a statement yesterday. I told them everything anddescribed the two boys. The police also took photographs of the cut onmy head. | | E3 | Oh, were you injured when they snatched your bag? Howdid that happen? | 13 | | M3 |他们抢我包的时候，把我推倒了。我的头撞到了长条座椅上，当时都流血了，所以我就去了医院。在这个位置，我缝了五针呢。 | They pushed me overwhen they grabbed my bag, and I hit my head on a bench seat. It wasbleeding, so I went to the hospital. I have four stitches, just here. || E4 | That must have been painful. It's good that you got some medicalattention straight away. How are you feeling now? | 20 | | M4 |对啊。现在还是很疼。但主要的问题还是，当包被抢走的时候，我刚刚才从银行取了钱，准备是去买菜的。现在，我的钱都没有了。 | Yes, it's stillquite sore. But the main problem really is that, when they took my bag,I had just withdrawn money from the bank to do our grocery shopping. NowI have no money. | | E5 | Right. Well I can certainly assist you withmaking a compensation claim, but that usually takes some time. In themeantime though, I can give you some supermarket vouchers you can use tobuy groceries. | 35 | | M5 |那可太好了。太谢谢你了。我朋友也说他们也会接济一下我的，但我清楚他们自己也不宽裕。 | That would be wonderful, thank you so much. Myfriends also said they will help, but I know they don't have a lot tospare. | | E6 | There may be some other things we can help you with inthe longer term, but this is the priority for now, isn't it? Let's justfill out an application form to get the process started. | 36 | | M6 |再次感谢你！我这就去。 | Thank you again! I will do that right away.|

entry.title: 车险咨询
entry.content: This is a dialogue between Adam, a staff member at the RTA and MrWang, who wants to buy a car and an insurance policy. * * * | ID |Original | Translated | | --- | --- | --- | | E1 | Hello. My name isAdam. How can I help you today. | 你好。我叫亚当。今天我能为您做些什么?| | M1 |你好。是这样的，我今天来想咨询一下我能否在这个国家开车。因为我想买一个二手车。所以我还想知道一下，我需要上怎样的保险 | Hello. I’m heretoday to inquire about whether I can drive in Australia. I want to buy aused car, so I’d like to know what kind of insurance policy I need totake out. | | E2 | Sure, I can assist you with these matters. But let’sdeal with them one at a time. First, can I have your photo ID please?Are you a visitor or a permanent resident | 33 | | M2 |好的。给你，这是我的护照。我还不是永久居民。我朋友告诉我说我只能用我国内的驾照在这里开 3 个月，在这 3个月之内我必须转换成澳洲驾照才能继续在新南威尔士州开车，对么？ | Okay.Here you are. This is my passport. I’m not a permanent resident yet. Myfriend told me I can drive here with my Chinese driver’s license foronly three months. Then I have to convert it into an Australian licenseafter that, right? | | E3 | No, since you are not a permanent residentof NSW, you can still drive with your overseas licence until you becomea permanent resident or citizen of this country. So you don't need toworry about that at this stage. Now, what do you want to know about carinsurance | 50 | | M3 |那太好了！我来这里发现很多郊区的公共交通并不是很好，如果不开车还真麻烦，所以我打算买一个二手车，但是我朋友告诉我，我还得买一个强制的保险？我发现保险有很多种类，不知道怎么选 | That’s great! I’ve found thatpublic transport in many suburbs is quite poor and it’s veryinconvenient if you don’t have a car. That’s why I’m planning to buy asecond hand car. But my friend said I have to buy compulsory insurance.I’ve found there are many types of insurance and I don’t know what tochoose. | | E4 | Yes, you need Compulsory Third Party insurance, whichis also known as a Green Slip. This is a prerequisite of registrationfor every vehicle in Australia. Without it, you cannot renew yourvehicle’s registration, even if it is second hand. But in terms of othertypes of insurance, they are not compulsory, but I strongly recommendthat you should at least have Third Party Property Insurance if you area new driver in this state. | 76 | | M4 |就是这里我搞不太清楚，网上的一堆资料和广告都搞得我头晕眼花了。还有那个第三方强制责任险和第三方财产保险，到底有什么区别？ | This is where Igot confused. I’m confused by the information and advertisements I foundon the internet. And what is the difference between the Compulsory ThirdParty Insurance and the Third Party Property Insurance? | | E5 |Compulsory Third Party insurance covers compensation for the life andgeneral health of others if there is an incident or accident due to yournegligence. Third Party Property Insurance is responsible for any damageto another’s vehicle or public property. But please be aware that thiswill not cover damage to your vehicle | 53 | | M5 |哦，我明白了，看来我的确是有必要买一个第三方财产保险，要不然万一我撞到一劳斯赖斯我就死定了。那我是否一买车就必须开始上保险呢，还是我想什么时候买就什么时候买？ | Oh I see. It seems that the Third PartyProperty Insurance is quite necessary, otherwise I’ll be in big troubleif I crash into a Rolls Royce. So do I need to buy the policy as soon asI buy the car, or can I buy it at any time I want?) | | E6 | You don'thave to buy the insurance unless you think it is necessary. But for theCTP, it will automatically transfer from your previous driver's policyto yours. So you don't have to buy it until your rego is expired | 40 || M6 |哦，原来是这样啊。我明白了非常谢谢我回去研究一下。如果有什么不懂得我再来找您。再见。 | I see. Thank you very much. I’ll go back and dosome research. If there is anything I don’t understand, I’ll come backto you. Good bye. |

entry.title: 逃逸伪险
entry.content: Mr Li, a mandarin speaking man, is calling his car insurer AAMI tomake a claim. * * * | ID | Original | Translated | | --- | --- | --- | |E1 | Thanks for calling AAMI Insurance, this is Jennifer. How can I helpyou today? | 23 | | M1 |你好，我刚刚出了车祸，现在打来咨询下出车祸以后我要做些什么。 | Hello, Ijust had an accident. I’m calling to ask what I should do next. | | E2 |Sure, please tell me your name, and where did you have the accident? Doyou need me to call an ambulance for you? | 23 | | M2 |不用了，谢谢。我叫李航，我是在 Eastwood 这里发生的车祸，我的车头已经被撞的面目全非。我的车是全保，而且车祸不是我的责任，我现在需要交多少垫底费啊？ | No, thanks. My name is Li Hang and I just had anaccident in the Eastwood area. The nose of my car has been completelysmashed in. I’ve got comprehensive insurance and I was not at fault. Howmuch excess do I need to pay? | | E3 | Ok, don’t worry. Please tell methe make of your vehicle and the policy number. As for the excess, thatdepends on the type of policy you have and the condition of your vehicleafter the accident. | 37 | | M3 |我的车是一辆白色丰田车，保单号是：AU538896. 我的保险是在一个中国人的中介那边购买的。那个人跟我说，全保只需要在车祸时交个垫底费就可以 了。| It is a white Toyota and my policy number is AU538896. I purchasedthis policy through a Chinese agent. He told me that with comprehensiveinsurance, I just need to pay an excess fee if an accident happens. | |E4 | Ok. Give me a second; let me check your policy number. Mr Li, I amsorry to tell you that, maybe your agent has tricked you or there mightbe some misunderstanding between you and your agent. The policy you havepurchased is third party property insurance. | 47 | | M4 | 什么是第 3方财产保险？能给我解释下这两者有什么不同吗？我当时也没多想，我想说我开车技术那么好，怎么可能出车祸啊。再说我车这么贵，谁敢撞啊？ | What is the third party property insurance? Could you explainthe differences to me, please? I didn’t think much at that time as Ithought it was impossible for a good driver like me to have an accident.Also I thought nobody dared to crash into my expensive car. | | E5 |Sure. Comprehensive insurance covers all the damage for your vehicleregardless which party is liable; however, third party insurance onlycovers the damage you cause to another vehicle. | 28 | | M5 |什么？也就是说，对于我的车造成的损坏，我全部要自己承担吗？我被那个中介骗了吗？太可恶了！| What? Are you saying that I will have to pay for all the damage to mycar out of my own pocket? I got cheated by the agent? That’s soterrible! | | E6 | I am afraid that is the case Sir. But please calmdown. If you have the registration number of the other car who crashedinto you, maybe you still have some hope to get compensation from them.| 37 | | M6 | 可问题是，我没看见是谁撞的我。显然那人是肇事逃逸了！ | Butthe problem is I didn’t see who crashed into me! It was obviously a hitand run! |

entry.title: 入室行窃
entry.content: Mr Liu, a mandarin speaking man, is reporting a home burglary to thepolice. * * * | ID | Original | Translated | | --- | --- | --- | | E1 |Hi. Mr. Liu. Now the interpreter is here. We are able to understand younow You have reported that you’ve been robbed; please tell me when andwhat did they take. | 31 | | M1 |谢天谢地，你终于来了。今天晚上我回家的时候发现门是开着的，我进去一看，有个人正在往我新买的宝马上装我那心爱的 60 寸电视。 | Thank goodnessyou are finally here. When I came home tonight I found my door wasunlocked. When I got in closer, I saw a guy was loading my treasured60’’ TV into my newly bought BMW. | | E2 | Did you get a good look atthe guy who was trying to take your stuff， and did you confront him? |22 | | M2 |没看清楚，因为我下班回来已经天黑了，而且那小偷也每开灯。我没敢惹那小偷，他看到我以后就马上开走了。 | No, as it was already dark then andthe thief did not turn on the light. I didn’t dare confront him. Hedrove away quickly after he saw me. | | E3 | How many guys did you seeat that particular moment? And can you give me a detailed list of thingsthat are missing? | 23 | | M3 | 我隐隐约约看到车里有 2个人，加上房间里的。一共 3 个。丢的东西太多了，你让我好好看看房间里少了什么，因为我刚刚一直在等你们，没敢碰里面的东西。 | I vaguely saw there were two guys in the car, plus the oneinside my house, so in total there were three. I lost so many things.Please let me have a look at what has been stolen because I have beenwaiting for you and did not touch anything. | | E4 | You are right tokeep the crime scene uncontaminated. Ok, Mr. Liu, now you can go in andsee what’s missing. Just be careful, try not to touch anything on thefloor or on the walls and doors. | 38 | | M4 |恩。刚买的车被开走了，丢的还有电视，电脑，游戏机，iPad。还有一些 钱。 |Hmm, the car I just bought was driven away. My TV, computer, video gameconsole, iPad and some cash were also stolen. | | E5 | I think the cashis something you won’t be able to claim. Can you give me an estimatedtotal value of the stuff missing, and have you got home and contentsinsurance? | 32 | | M5 | 所有丢的东西加起来一共$5万多块钱吧，车买了保险，其他的没有保险，因 为是租的房子怎么可能有保险。| That would be around $50,000 in total. The car is insured but theothers are not. It’s impossible for me to get insurance for this is onlya rented place. | | E6 | Ok, I will give you a police note with whichyou can make a claim for the car from your insurer, but as for the otherthings, you didn’t get them insured so there is nothing I can do. | 39 || M6 |好吧，那也只能干认倒霉吧。希望你们能尽快把这些窃贼捉拿归案。谢谢你了警官。 | All right, it seems I have to take this bad luck. I hope youcan catch those burglars as soon as possible. Thank you officer. |

entry.title: 入室砸抢
entry.content: This is a conversation between Superintendent Watson and Mr Wu, whohas just experienced a home burglary. * * * | ID | Original | Translated| | --- | --- | --- | | E1 | Hello Mr Wu, now we have an interpreterwith us and we can understand each other. So please tell me whathappened. | 22 | | M1 |你好警官，是这样的，我今天早上一起来，发现我家里被人进来过了。我的电视机被人碎了，我才刚买 2 天啊，56 寸的最新 LED 电视就这么没了。你一定要帮我找到这个混蛋啊。 | Hello officer. This is what happened: whenI woke up this morning, I found somebody had broken into my house. My TVwas smashed. I’d just bought this latest 56’’ TV two days ago but nowit’s broken! Please help me find the bastards! | | E2 | Well. Pleasetell me more details. Otherwise I’m afraid we won’t be able to help you.Please tell me when exactly you noticed you’d been burgled, and is thereany other damage? | 31 | | M2 | 我是早上 8点起来，要去厕所刷牙，可当我路过客厅的时候发现有什么不对劲。当我看见我新买的电视就这么被人砸了，我差点没晕倒。哪个混蛋做的啊！除了电视，我发现我新买的 Ipad mini 还有所配套的配件都被人卷跑了。 |I got up at 8 am and I found something strange when I walked through theliving room as I was going to the bathroom to brush my teeth. The viewof my new TV smashed almost made me faint. Besides the TV, my new iPadMini and its accessories have all been stolen too. | | E3 | Well. That’sterrible. You have my sympathy. However, it seems like the burglar wastargeting at your new home entertainment system. Does anyone know thatyouhave recently bought those things? | 31 | | M3 |我想很多人应该都知道吧。我一买回来安装好就拍照片上传到各种社交网络上了，比如说推特，脸书还有微博。我当时很开心，就想和亲戚朋友分享一下快乐，没想到这居然引来了犯罪。真是太倒霉了。 | I think many peopleknow about it. I set everything up as soon as I brought them home, thenI uploaded photos to social media including Twitter, Facebook and Weibo.I was happy and I wanted to share this happiness with my friends andrelatives. I didn’t expect it would entice a crime. What bad luck! | |E4 | Well. Then I believe there must be some sort of association betweenthis and your posts on your social networking sites. We have noticedsome new crimes, which are a result of people mistakenly showing theirlocation information and wealth. | 38 | | M4 |是么。我没想到这种事情会发生在我身上。我并不知道我发送的图片会包涵了我的地理信息。不过算了，现在我打算把那些东西都关掉了。你能帮我查查么，录入指纹什么的，搞不好就是住在周围的哪个小毛贼干的。 | Yes. Inever thought this would happen to me. I didn’t know the photos I postedincluded my location. But never mind. I’m going to turn off thesefunctions. Could you help me check things, maybe take fingerprints orsomething? It might have be done by a burglar who lives around my area.| | E5 | Sure, our constable is recording fingerprints now. Please bepatient and we will give you a report when we finish. Could you pleasegive me your photo ID? We want to keep it on record. | 36 | | M5 |好的，给你，这是我的驾照。请有任何消息第一时间通知我。谢谢。 | Okay,here you are. This is my driver’s licence. Please inform me immediatelyif anything comes up. Thank you. |

entry.title: 误会贩毒
entry.content: Mrs Wang is stopped by a customs officer, who suspects she issmuggling drugs. * * * | ID | Original | Translated | | --- | --- | ---| | E1 |喂，你们为什么把我带到这里啊，我的飞机马上就要起飞了，我错过飞机谁负责？| Hey, why have you brought me here? My plane is going to take off soon.Who’s going to take responsibility for me missing the plane? | | M1 |Ma’am, please calm down. The reason we brought you here was because wehave reasons to believe that you were trying to smuggle drugs out of thecountry. | 28 | | E2 |什么！这不可能，我连烟都不抽，怎么可能碰毒品呀。你们一定弄错了。 | What?That’s impossible! I don’t even touch cigarettes, let alone drugs. Youmust have made a mistake! | | M2 | According to your boarding pass, yourname is Wang Chen, is that correct? And is this your bag? | 18 | | E3 |对，我叫王晨，是我的包呀。但是看着有点别扭，怎么好像被打开过，因为我记得我的锁不是这样的。 | Yes, I am Wang Chen and this is my bag. Butit looks a bit odd and as if it has been opened, because I remember mylock was not like this. | | M3 | Really? You actually think that I willbelieve that? Did you pack your bag or did someone else do it for you?Or did someone give you this bag? | 29 | | E4 |我自己装的包啊，里面是一些巧克力，是带给我女儿的。我不可能给我女儿带毒品吧。你们肯定搞错了。不信我打开给你看。| It was me who packed the bag. There are some chocolates for mydaughter in there. It would be insane if I brought my daughter drugs.You must be wrong. I can open it if you don’t believe me. | | M4 |Please go ahead. We will need to examine the contents of this bag; wehave been informed that you are an international criminal, and webelieve there is cocaine in it. | 31 | | E5 |放屁，我是来旅游的，我一直都是跟旅游团在一起，而且我一直是一个遵纪守法的人，怎么可能是罪犯。包打开了，你们自己看，里面都是什么。| Bullshit! I’m here for a trip and I stayed with the group all thetime. Also I’ve been always a law-abiding person and there is no way I’ma criminal. Now I’ve opened the bag. You can check what’s in it. | | M5| We are just following procedure; we need to go through the bag. Let mejust ask you, did you lend the bag to anyone while you were inAustralia? | 29 | | E6 |借给过我们一个旅游团的人，他说他东西多借我的包装下东西，我没多想就借给他了。这有什么问题嘛?| I lent it to another guy in our group. He said he had too much stuffand wanted to borrow my bag to put something in. I did not thinkanything of it before I lent it to him. Is there any problem? | | M6 |Yes, we detected traces of cocaine on the bag. And we were of the beliefthat you were trying to take drugs out of the country. But it is clearthat we have made a mistake. Sorry, madam, you can catch your flightnow. | 44 |

entry.title: 耳鸣就医
entry.content: Ms Wang is having a consultation with an ENT Doctor, about treatingher blocked ear. * * * | ID | Original | Translated | | --- | --- | ---| | E1 | 医生，我右边耳朵堵了，现在听声音很费劲。有时候还耳鸣。 |Doctor, my right ear is blocked and I have trouble hearing. Also,sometimes my ears are ringing. | | M1 | I see. Firstly, could you tellme how long you’ve had this problem? Has it happened before? Are you inany pain? | 22 | | E2 | 这是第一次，两天前开始的。目前还不痛，可是听得不是很清楚，好像耳朵被人蒙着那样，听到的声音都变得很低沉。这种感觉在人多、嘈杂的地方就更加明显。 | This is the first time and itstared two days ago. I feel no pain yet, but I can’t hear clearly. It’sas if my ear is covered and everything sounds so low and deep. Thisfeeling becomes worse when I am at noisy, crowed places. | | M2 | I see.Let me have a look at this one first. Umm, it’s inflamed. And the rightone is completely blocked by wax too. And it seems the wax has beenthere for quite a long time. Do you clean your ears regularly? | 43 | |E3 | 原来是耳屎。我还担心自己得了中耳炎，听说中耳炎也会有类似的症状。我基本不经常掏耳屎，因为我一直都是油耳，不是康耳。 耳朵堵住之前，我侧躺着看电视看了一天。 |It’s the wax? I thought I had otitis media, as I heard the symptoms aresimilar. I don’t clean my ears very often, because I’ve always had oilyears not dry ones. Before my ear got blocked, I was lying on my side andwatching TV for a whole day. | | M3 | That might be the cause. We haveto put eardrops in. This is to soften the wax so that it can be removed.We can’t do it now while it is still hard. | 33 | | E4 |滴耳药水？我从来没有滴过, 去会疼吗？我直接去药房买就可以了吧？需要您开一张处方给我吗？ | Ear drops? I have never put ear drops inbefore. Does it hurt? Can I get them from the chemist straightaway or doI need a prescription from you? | | M4 | If the wax keeps building up itcauses too much pressure. It may cause damage to the ear drum and thenimpair your hearing. This procedure is common. It won’t be painful atall. It is a non-prescriptive medicine, so you can get it easily fromany chemist. | 48 | | E5 | 说实话，我挺讨厌往耳朵里滴药水。光想想我就觉得有点毛骨悚然。一定要这样做吗？还有别的办法吗？ | To behonest, I hate putting drops into my ears. It makes me creep all overjust at the thought of doing so. Do I have to do this? Are there anyother solutions? | | M5 | I’m afraid not. This is quite important foryour hearing. You really must do this. Apply about five drops in bothears and leave it for ten to thirty minutes. Do that for a couple ofdays and come back to see me. | 43 | | E6 | 请问滴了这个药水之后，我是不是该用小棉塞堵住耳朵，不让药水流出来？之后要怎样才能把耳屎清出来呢？ | After applying, shouldI put a small cotton plug into my ear to stop the liquid from runningout? So how is the wax removed after that? | | M6 | Yes. It depends onhow severe the ear is impacted. In some cases, the loosened ear wax maybe cleared from the ear itself. In more severe cases, we may need toremove it with a syringe. | 37 |

entry.title: 儿子打架
entry.content: This is a conversation between Mr. Craig, a school teacher and aparent Mr Wan, whose son was involved in a fight. * * * | ID | Original| Translated | | --- | --- | --- | | E1 | Hello Mrs. Wan. Thanks forcoming on time today. I am going to talk with you about your son James.| 20 | | M1 |你好老师，没事儿，儿子的事儿才是最重要的事儿。他出什么事了？ | Hello,Mr. Craig. Not a problem at all. Nothing is more important to me than myson. What happened? | | E2 | He has always been a good student atschool. But this morning, he fought with another student and injuredthat student’s face. Do you know anything about that? | 28 | | M2 |啊？不会吧？这不可能。他一向都非常乖，无论是在家还是在学校。怎么会跟人打架呢。一定是你搞错了。 | What? Really? No Way. He has been sowell-behaved all the time, both at school and at home. My son wouldnever get involved in a fight. It must be a mistake. | | E3 |Unfortunately, I am not joking with you. He did severely hurt the otherboy. At first, I couldn’t believe it either, but when I went to theschool clinic I found out it was true. | 35 | | M3 |啊！那真是对不起。现在 James 在哪里？有没有受伤？那另一个小孩现在怎样了，对方家长说什么了么？ | Really? I’m sorry. Where is James now? Ishe injured? How is the other boy? Have his parents said anything? | | E4| James is fine and is now talking to our school psychologist. We thinkhe might have some unstable psychological condition. By the way, theother boy’s parents are very angry and they are at the hospital now. |37 | | M4 | 这一切真的是太意外了。James 性格内向，一向很听话，甚至都很少和人争 执。您知道他们到底是因为什么才打架的吗？ | This is soshocking! James is an introverted and obedient child. He rarely argueswith others. Do you know what on earth caused this fight? | | E5 | Sofar, we are not so clear about the reason they fought, but I was told bysome students in his class that it’s because of a girl. | 28 | | M5 |因为一个女孩？现在的小孩怎么那么早熟啊。而且他才是一个小学生，懂什么叫做爱情啊。我看他是应该去看看心理医生了。我现在都不知道怎么去面对另外一个孩子的家长了。 | Because of a girl? How come today’s childrenget mature so early? Besides, he is just a primary school student, whatdoes he know about love? I think it is time for him to see apsychologist. I don’t know how to face the other kid’s parents. | | E6 |I’d suggest you talk to your son and find out what is going on with him.And go to the hospital to apologise to the other boy’s parents. I don’tthink they will take you to the court if you sincerely apologise tothem. | 44 | | M6 |好的。我知道了，我现在就去校医室看看我的儿子。然后我会带他一起去医院给对方赔礼道歉去。谢谢你了老师，给你们添大麻烦了。 | All right, I see.I’ll go to the clinic to see my son right now. Then I will take him tothe hospital and make a sincere apology to the other boy’s family. Sorryfor the trouble we caused you. |

entry.title: 母亲痴呆
entry.content:
Mr. Lu, a new Chinese immigrant in Australia, is talking to Joe, anACAT (Aged Care Assessment Team) consultant, about placing his motherinto an aged care centre. * * 

        
          * * | ID |Original | Translated | | --- | --- | --- | | E1 | Good Morning, Mr. Lu.Thanks for coming in today. How can I help you? | 14 | | M1 |早上好，我最近在考虑帮我的母亲找一个合适的养老院，所以来咨询一下你。 |Good morning, I’ve been considering finding my mother a good aged carecentre. So I am here to make some enquiries. | | E2 | Certainly, inorder to assist you better, could you give me some details on theapplicant before we talk through the admission procedure? | 23 | | M2 |好的。我母亲得了老年痴呆症。一开始只是记忆力不好，比如说，有一次她独自上街却忘记家在哪里了。还有就是，最近我觉得和她沟通越来越困难了。 | Sure. My mother has got senile dementia. At first,it was just that her memory wasn’t very good. For example, one day shewent out on her own but later forgot where she lived. And I’ve foundit’s getting more and more difficult to communicate with her recently. || E3 | Well, I am sorry to hear that. It is quite normal for many of usto think we need to place our parents in residential care places whenthey have a condition that is severe or likely to worsen. // But it isnot the only option. Often, people who are highly dependent often managequite well at home with the help of a carer, family, friends orcommunity services. | 70 | | M3 |我一开始也打算在家自己照顾她，但其实主要是我太太在照顾，我工作比较忙。更糟糕的是，最近我母亲老是莫名其妙的和我太太起争执。前几天洗澡的时候她摔断了胳膊，当时我就觉得要把她送老 人院了。 | Ioriginally planned to look after her at home. Well, actually my wife isthe main carer as I am very busy at work. But what’s worse, my motherstarted to quarrel with my wife a lot for no reason. And when she brokeher arm in the shower the other day, I realised it’s time to place herin aged care. | | E4 | I see. Well, there are currently a variety ofaged care services offered in the community. I’m sure we can worktogether with you, and find the best arrangement for your mother. First,your mother will need to be assessed so we can decide what kind ofservice is best for her. | 52 | | M4 |恩，这没问题。但我想了解一下，这个评估是由谁来做的呢？评估的流程又是怎样的呢？ | That’s not a problem. But I’d like to know whowill be the assessors and what the assessment procedure is like. | | E5| The assessment is run by one or two members of the aged careassessment team or ACAT. They will visit your place and discuss with youwhether community help will enable your mother to continue living athome or whether her needs would be better met through our aged carehome. | 51 | | M5 |那你能告诉我，评估的时候通常会问哪些问题呢？这样我好提前准备一些相关的书面材料给评估人员看。 | Could you tell me what sorts ofquestions will be asked during the assessment? So that I can preparesome documents in advance to provide to the assessors. | | E6 |Questions asked at each assessment vary as they pertain to theindividual, but they often include the types of daily living activitiesyour mother needs help with, her general state of health and any otherhealth issues she might have. | 40 | | M6 |我朋友说这边的养老院挺好的。但是我妈妈比较挑剔，所以希望您帮忙找个好一点的，这样她就不会搬来搬去。 | I heard from my friend thatthe aged care services here are quite nice. But my mother is a bitpicky, so I hope you can help her find a good place to avoid having tomove her again in the future. | | E7 | Well, Mr. Lu, I suggest that youfill out this application form first and we will see what results comefrom the assessment. Then we can make any further arrangements, Okay? |31 | | M7 | 好的，谢谢，我注意到外面的架子上有很多小册子，我可以去拿几本回家看看吗？ | Sure, thank you. I noticed there are many brochures onthe shelf outside, can I take some to have a read at home？ |

entry.title: 产后忧郁
entry.content: Dr. Bride is in a conversation with a patient, Mrs. Yu, aboutinviting her to join his research on post-natal depression. * * * | ID |Original | Translated | | --- | --- | --- | | E1 | Hello, Mrs. Yu. Goodto see you today. How are you feeling? | 12 | | M1 |你好医生，我很好，谢谢。待会儿我准备和我先生去看场电影。 | Hello Doctor,I am very well. Thank you. I am going to see a movie with my husbandlater on. | | E2 | That’s great. Your file indicates that you werediagnosed with post-natal depression early last month and have undergonetreatment. It seems you are a lot better now, right? | 28 | | M2 |是的。记得我第一次来看您的时候，状况真的糟透了。我当时真的觉得人生没有喜乐，很无助。要不是我先生逼我来看医生，我可能现在还在痛苦中挣扎。 | Yes. I remember when I first came to see you, mycondition couldn’t be worse. I found no joy in my life and I felthelpless. I would still be suffering right now if my husband hadn’turged me to see a doctor. | | E3 | I’m happy to hear that you’re makingprogress, Mrs Yu. I’d like to let you know that we are currently doingresearch on post-natal depression and we’d like to invite you to be partof this research. | 37 | | M3 |关于产后抑郁的研究，到底是个什么研究呢？我并不介意加入你们的研究，不过你能向我简单介绍一下这项研究吗？ | Research on post-nataldepression? What is that exactly? I don’t mind being part of it, butcould you tell me a bit more about it? | | E4 | The research is called“The ABX Discovery Program”. We’re now at Phase 2 of the program whichinvolves clinical trials of a new drug ABX on patients with post-nataldepression. | 30 | | M4 |就是说要我帮您试药是吗？这对我和胎儿来说，安全吗？我现在还在吃你上一次给我开的药呢。 | You mean you want me to try out this newmedication for you? Is it safe for me and the baby? I’m now still takingthe medication you prescribed for me last time. | | E5 | ABX is a newanti-depressant. It has been tested before with healthy volunteers andpresented some very positive results. We now want to test the drug onpatients with post-natal depression to find out if the new drug wouldwork better than the drug you’re currently taking. | 47 | | M5 |我的另外一个担心是， 这药还没正式获得政府批准， 会不会有副作用？万一出现了意料之外的状况怎么办？ | I have another concern. Sincethis medication is not approved by the government yet, could there besome side effects? What if something happens out of the blue? | | E6 |This drug has gone through a number of laboratory tests, including testson humans. As I indicated earlier, we know of no toxins or negative sideeffects at this moment. But if it is proven effective through ourresearch program, it may help more women with similar cases to you. | 50| | M6 | 那我还是先回家和我先生商量一下再做决定吧。 毕竟还是有风险的，对吧？所以，您也别抱太大希望了。 | I think I should go back and talkwith my husband about it before making any decisions. After all, itstill involves some risks, right? So don’t get your hopes up. |

entry.title: 移民专业
entry.content: This is a dialogue between Jason, a migration agent (MA) and Mr.Wang, a recently graduated international student. * * * | ID | Original| Translated | | --- | --- | --- | | E1 | Good morning, Mr. Wang. Myname is Jason, and I’m a migration agent. I understand that you camehere because your student visa is going to expire shortly. Is thatright? | 31 | | M1 | 是的，你好。我非常担心，我已经毕业了 2个月了。下个月我的学生签证就过期了。我想一直留在这里工作生活，但是我学的专业不能移民，现在也找不到工作。我可不想这么快就回去。 | Yes, I’m very worried. I graduatedtwo months ago and my student visa is expiring next month. I’ve alwayswanted to stay here. But I don’t qualify for immigration because of mymajor and I can’t find a job now.
